Notes: Beaten with batons on Enqelab Street in Tehran on Thursday, 18 Dey (January 8, 2026) until his skull was shattered. Ambulance was prevented from reaching him. Was transported to Imam Khomeini Hospital by private car but died on 24 Dey (February 13, 2026).
Patriotic teacher and monarchist supporter from Lorestan. Was fired from his job after supporting Reza Shah II, then arrested by Islamic Republic terrorists on 7th of Bahman.
Shot with at least two bullets on Thursday, 18 Dey 1404 during protests in Astaneh, Gilan. Died two weeks later on Thursday, 2 Bahman after succumbing to his injuries.

Father of family, arrested on 18 Dey during Iranian national revolution in Sadeghiyeh, killed with a coup de grâce shot after six days of torture in detention center of the Islamic Republic, family under severe pressure and forced silence

Suffered severe head trauma on Friday the 19th and fell into a coma with consciousness level dropping below 5 percent. After five days hospitalized in a coma, he died on Wednesday. His burial was held on Friday morning the 26th at 7 AM with only family members allowed to attend due to security forces' restrictions.

18-year-old Baluch citizen, son of Abdolkarim, resident of Gazhak village in Delgan county. Shot and killed by unknown armed individuals around 2 AM while traveling by personal vehicle in Chahshoor village area. Died on the spot due to severity of injuries from multiple gunshot wounds. Attackers fled immediately after the shooting.

Wushu athlete shot with war bullet by security forces on 19 Dey (2026-01-08) in Ardabil. Remained in coma for 21 days before dying in Ardabil hospital. Had national-level achievements in Wushu martial arts.

Eight-year-old child shot without justification by police forces in Taheruiyeh neighborhood while a police vehicle was pursuing a car suspected of carrying smuggled goods. The child was an innocent bystander who was hit by gunfire. After being taken to the hospital, police surrounded the hospital and prevented news and details of the incident from being published. The incident led to widespread anger among citizens.

Executed on charges of espionage for Israel. The judiciary claimed he conducted intelligence and operational activities for the Zionist regime including purchasing equipment needed by officers, moving vehicles in Isfahan and Lorestan provinces to prepare for Israeli sabotage of Defense Ministry missile facilities in an operation called 'Great Operation' that was discovered and neutralized by Intelligence Ministry agents in 1401 (2022-2023).

Doctor and architect shot with one bullet to the back/waist and one bullet to the head in Khane Isfahan neighborhood. Has two daughters. Died one week after being shot and was buried without notice in Shahinshahr, Isfahan.
18-year-old 12th grade science student at Hasheminejad 3 High School in Mashhad, arrested on 8 Bahman when security forces raided his home, whereabouts unknown since arrest

Shot at close range with pellet ammunition on January 10, 2026 (19 Dey). Remained in a coma from the time of shooting until death on January 26, 2026 (6 Bahman) due to severity of injuries. Born in village of Eskaneh near Arak.

Teacher and official education employee with master's degree in psychology. Shot directly with military bullet to the head on Thursday January 8, 2026 (18 Dey) in Marlik area. Bullet hit his brain causing severe injury. Was kept alive on life support for one full week in coma with very low consciousness at Shohada-ye Salamat Malard Hospital. IRGC forces prevented organ donation despite his organ donor card, stating those shot during protests cannot donate organs. Family was demanded approximately 2 billion tomans as 'bullet fee' after autopsy to determine weapon type. Died after one week without being allowed to donate organs despite being healthy and suitable for donation. Body was eventually returned to family and buried in Behesht-e Fatemeh cemetery in Qods city.
Family member of Babak Alipour (prisoner sentenced to death), arrested along with other family members

Born in Arak, father of a 2-year-old child. Shot by Velayat-e Faqih forces on 18 Dey (2026-01-08) in Karaj. Died on Monday 6 Bahman (2026-01-26) due to the severity of his injuries. Body buried in Malmir village in Arak.
Shot with war bullets on 18 Dey in Tehran, taken to hospital and underwent surgery, but died on 6 Bahman. Originally from Sabzevar city.
Family member of Babak Alipour (prisoner sentenced to death), arrested along with other family members
Family member of Babak Alipour (prisoner sentenced to death), arrested along with other family members

Lor Bakhtiari citizen from Nanadgan village in Fereydan, Isfahan province. Shot and killed by Basij forces while alone in his barbershop on Felatori Street, Iman Boulevard in Isfahan. He was targeted with two pistol shots from close range. He had previously been identified by local Basij forces on 18 Dey month. Was unmarried and buried in his birthplace in Nanadgan village, Fereydan.
Became martyred on Mokhtari Street in Amiriyeh district of Tehran on Saturday night of the 20th. Witnessed describes seeing his eyes bulging out of their sockets in his final moments
Shot directly by government suppressive forces during protests. Originally from Dezful, resident of Isfahan.
Mother of Sobhan Esmaeil Doost, approximately 60 years old, arrested early Saturday morning on 5 Bahman and transferred to Lakan prison in Rasht
17-year-old who was injured on 18 Dey 1404 in Bushehr and died on 3 Bahman. Born in 1372 Persian calendar.
Shot with pellets on the 18th, his kidneys and lungs were punctured, died on 4 Bahman. Father of three children. From Fasa.

14-year-old Kurdish child who was critically wounded during protests when government forces shot her directly with a war bullet that hit her pelvis area. After two weeks in a coma, she died due to severe injuries and inadequate medical care. She was an honor student at Setaregan School in Kermanshah. Her body was buried on Sunday 5 Bahman under pressure and threats from security agencies.

Shot by bullet in the pelvic area on Haft-e Tir Street in Mashhad and died hours later from her injuries. She had told those close to her before joining the crowd that she was going 'just to be a member of the crowd; so that those who go forward are not alone and know that we are standing behind them.'

19-year-old Baháʼí resident of Kerman arrested on Saturday evening 4 Bahman 1404 when security forces brutally raided her home without showing a warrant. House was searched before arrest. Arrest was part of widespread detention of Baháʼí citizens during protests. No information available about her since arrest.

33-year-old reportedly executed in Mashhad on 22 January, becoming one of the first protesters to be executed. Iran's judiciary denied his execution having taken place, stating that such a person had not even been detained

Left home at 3 AM after celebrating his birthday (2nd Bahman). His phone was in possession of security agencies. The next morning his body was found hanging in the house courtyard with his mouth covered by cloth and hands and feet tied. Forensic results have not been announced. Milad had said he was being followed.

Artist, photographer and potter arrested during security forces raid on his pottery workshop in Mashhad. The arresting agency and charges against this young Mashhadi artist are unknown. Possibly targeted due to Bahai faith as indicated by the Bahai hashtag in the post.

Kurdish citizen from Peteweir village in Salmas, Snap driver, severely wounded by shooting from military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Punak neighborhood of Tehran on 18 Dey 1404. Went into coma and died after 3 days of hospitalization. Family paid 800 million tomans to obtain his body and hold burial ceremony in Salmas

39-year-old Mashhad resident and father of an eleven-year-old daughter. Shot by Khamenei's agents in front of Haft-e Tir police station in Mashhad on 18 Dey and died in hospital 3 days later. His Instagram page shows he was also a supporter of the Pahlavi family.

48-year-old resident of Babol and father, shot directly by suppressive forces during nationwide protests on 18 Dey (first day of Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi's call) in the city. A shotgun pellet hit his eye from close range, causing severe brain hemorrhage, and he died after three days in a coma.

Nurse at Imam Reza Hospital in Kermanshah, internal medicine ward. Shot by a sniper positioned in a tall building above Dr. Kaboli pharmacy near Housing Bank at the city four-way intersection (Doveqola) in Shaabad. He was targeted from behind. Taken home initially but after a few hours had to be transferred to hospital. Died after three days of resistance.
Citizen from Sirvan city residing in Ilam, kidnapped from his workplace by mercenaries of the Islamic Republic on 2 Bahman, no information available about his condition
Died during protests in Tehran in Dey 1404
Victim from Gilan province documented in Iran International Memorial
Died during protests in Tehran in Dey 1404

Baluch citizen who was severely wounded on 24 Dey 1404 during protests in Mashhad by shotgun pellets fired by military forces to the head, neck, chest and abdomen. He hid for 8 days out of fear of arrest and finally died on 1 Bahman.

Baloch citizen killed by security and military forces. Former wushu champion, coach, referee and veteran in Sistan and Baluchistan province. Former political prisoner who was arrested in 2010 in Zahedan prison, sentenced to 20 years exile in Gachsaran prison for charges including 'moharebeh and corruption on earth', sent on leave in 2022 after serving over 12 years of prison and exile, and had been residing in Khajeh Mask village in Zahedan county after refusing to return to prison. Government media claimed he was killed in clashes on the outskirts of Zahedan and labeled him as a member of Ansar al-Furqan group, but the group officially denied any connection with him.

Wounded by shotgun pellet on January 8 in Golshahr, Karaj. After his arrest, he was taken to Qezel Hesar prison, and on January 20, his family was informed that they could retrieve his body from Behesht-e Sakineh cemetery.

23-year-old street vendor from Rasht shot in the abdomen with war bullets by government forces in the Golsar area of the city on January 8, 2026. He died after two days of severe injuries and bleeding. The bullet hit a vital area of his body and his death was a direct result of the shooting. He was from a disadvantaged background and worked as a street vendor to make a living.
Shot with war bullets during the Saturday massacre. Graduate of talented students program and 5th semester medical student at Mashhad University of Medical Sciences.
Mentioned in commemorative tweet from Karaj
Died during the protests

Former political prisoner and long-time civil activist from Mashhad, killed during Iran's national revolution. Shot by security forces while participating in unprecedented protests in Mashhad on Vakil Abad street. He was wearing an electronic ankle monitor used for controlling prisoners at the time. He was a political prisoner in the 1980s and had been repeatedly targeted by security forces and arrested in recent years. In 2011, he was arrested while trying to organize a commemoration for Ferdowsi in Mashhad and was held in solitary confinement for over seven months. Last summer he was arrested to serve a sentence of 3 years and 7 months. Mashhad Revolutionary Court had sentenced him for financially supporting families of political prisoners and charges of propaganda and action against the system. He was an associate of Hussein Barazandeh, a famous religious reformist from Mashhad who was kidnapped in Dey month 1373 (December 1994/January 1995) in Mashhad and killed as part of the political murders of intellectuals and dissidents by Intelligence Ministry forces.
Shot by government forces during protests in Marvdasht
Shot with bullets in Isfahan. His birthday would have been on 10 Bahman (January 29).

13-year-old child from Norabad Delfan, shot in the back with a war bullet by military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Qaemiyeh neighborhood, Eslamshahr, Tehran province. Security institutions pressured the family to introduce him as a Basij member in exchange for handing over the body, but the family refused this demand. His body was handed over to the family after four days and payment of one billion tomans, and was buried under pressure from security institutions in Dehshad cemetery
Shot with live ammunition by government forces during popular protests in Fardis. Killed alongside his brother Omid and nephew Armin while participating as a family in the protests.
Shot directly by government suppressive forces during people's protests

15-year-old girl killed during suppression of protests in Gorgan by direct gunfire from government forces. Due to complete communication cuts in Iran, it was impossible to contact emergency services and get her to hospital in time, and this teenager died from the severity of her injuries.
Shot to the heart in Tehran's Shamsabad neighborhood. Was a psychologist and child rights activist.
Shot by government forces during popular protests. Married, 39 years old, from Marvdasht.

Shot in the head by suppressive forces during people's protests. Her body was returned to her family nine days later with the condition of burial in Kermanshah. She was a 22-year-old art graduate living in Tehran.

Kurdish civil activist from Sardasht arrested by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces at his workplace located in Sharko Internet Cafe. All electronic equipment from his cafe was confiscated and no information about his fate is available.

55-year-old retired education employee from Sangar, living in Karaj. Shot and killed along with his wife and child while inside their personal vehicle during peaceful protests. Government agents opened fire on their car. Bodies were transferred to Sangar and buried before 6 AM under strict security measures and compulsion by agents.
Shot in the head by regime forces, making her face unrecognizable; her mother had to identify her through a tattoo on her hand
19-year-old student, son of Bijan Mostafavi and Zahra Bani-Amirian, killed alongside his parents when their personal car was raked with bullets by government forces. Family friends of the source.
Died in Dezful on 19 Dey 1404 during 2025-2026 Iranian protests
Shot in the throat in front of Tabarsi Shomali police station on Friday 19 Dey, was wounded and died a few days later in the hospital

Shot directly from behind by Islamic Republic suppression forces on Ghaem Magham Street in Malayer while unable to take cover quickly enough during security forces' shooting and dispersing of protesters. Witnesses reported she lacked sufficient speed to take shelter when security forces were firing at and dispersing protesters.

Shot in the head with a bullet. Originally from Arak, married with two children. Family was forced to commit to holding burial in silence in Ebrahim-Abad village in Arak in exchange for receiving the body.

Shot directly in the head during protests. Security forces cut off his ear piercing before returning his body to family because their rules prohibit men from wearing earrings. Described as showing no mercy to his lifeless body.
22-year-old shot and killed in Nazi Abad, Tehran on Thursday. His body was found at Kahrizak after 10 days of family being without news, found on Monday 29 Dey and handed over on 30 Dey
Lor ethnicity from Khorramabad, shot by suppression forces in Masouri neighborhood of the city and died
16-year-old killed during protests. He worked as a hairdresser while studying. His mother said he died for the freedom of his homeland

Car mechanic, 49 years old, married with children. Family found out on the night of the 19th that a war bullet had hit his side. Two agents were placed over him at Valiasr Hospital in Qaemshahr until he died from severe bleeding. Permission to bury was given with a commitment that he was a Basij member and had gone to the pharmacy to get medicine for his mother. He was a monarchist supporter from Dowatishah, resident of Mazandaran, buried in Imamzadeh Seyyed Mehdi, Mehdiabad, Arteh city.

Shot directly in the heart with a bullet while helping an injured person on Setareh Street in Parand. Was with his son who witnessed the killing. The governor contacted the family to come to their home and record a condolence message for Islamic Republic television, but the family refused entry and declared that this dear one's blood was spilled for the freedom of his people and they seek justice.

Shot directly with a war bullet by government forces in District 4 of Tehran, Tehranpars neighborhood. Her body was only returned to her family after ten days, during which time the family was kept in severe anxiety and uncertainty. The family is now under severe security pressure and has not been allowed to hold mourning ceremonies or any gathering in her memory.

23-year-old futsal player and master's degree student in industrial engineering at Shahrood University of Technology, killed by Iran's security forces during nationwide protests. He was the goalkeeper for the university's futsal team and also practiced bodybuilding. Before his death, he wrote on Telegram: 'Even if only one of us remains, it is their duty to remain a narrator.'
Killed during protests in Islamabad-e Gharb (Shababad). Identity confirmed by Hengaw Organization for Human Rights as one of 14 confirmed fatalities.

Shot by Islamic Republic forces on January 8, 2026. Struck from behind by two bullets, one above the heart and the other in the side. Was taken by pickup truck to three different hospitals but none would admit him. Eventually brought to a clinic where his family was informed of his death on January 14. Body was transferred to Kahrizak Forensic Medical Centre and funeral was held on Tajik Blvd, Sabashahr.
Killed during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests

Shot by sniper fire from Islamic Republic security forces. Killed by two sniper bullets from a building near the Education Department while participating in popular protests. Originally from Dehlaran village, family had moved to Shushtar because Mehdi was accepted into gifted students school. Was a part-time student who also repaired bicycles and motorcycles.
Killed during protests in Dezful as part of the freedom movement

Shot by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic during revolutionary uprising in Zirab, Mazandaran. Described as a 37-year-old monarchist. Mother vowed at his burial ceremony to seek justice for his killing.
Judo champion and coach, martyred in Mobarakeh
Shot with war bullets by government agents during peaceful popular protests

21-year-old physical education student and footballer, shot by Islamic Republic forces during protests in the Imamat area of Mashhad. He was targeted with direct gunfire while returning home from work in the Seyedrazi area, was transferred to hospital but died from his injuries. Had professional football experience in second division beach football league and had recently been accepted to play in Karaj first division league.
Killed by security forces in Malard, family reported to be under severe pressure
Shot by security forces during protests in Phase 3 of Andisheh township. He was one of those commemorated in the protests in Tehran.

Shot with bullet on 18 Dey that entered from right side and exited from left side. After falling, was targeted again with pellets in thigh. Despite having injuries, fought against death for one day and night but died on the morning of 19 Dey.

Turkish citizen from Qazvin who was shot in the forehead with pellet gun by government suppression forces during protests on Thursday 18 Dey (January 8, 2026). He fell into a coma and died after eleven days. His body was buried in one of the villages around Qazvin.
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime
Shot in the throat by security forces during popular protests, buried in Behesht Roghayeh cemetery
Shot by suppression forces on Razi Street in Khorramabad
Shot with direct military fire in front of Emamiyeh police station in Mashhad
Shot directly to the head by Basij commander Davood Ghafouri, a resident of the same city. Killed on the night of 19 Dey. The entire city witnessed who killed their child.
Shot in the chest with war bullets by government forces on Friday evening. Security forces prevented his family from holding any public funeral or mourning ceremonies after his death.
20-year-old public administration student from Tabriz, living in Tehran. Shot directly by government suppression forces during people's protests in Sadeghiyeh.
Shot with live ammunition by government forces during popular protests in Fardis. Killed alongside his brother Amir and son Armin while participating as a family in the protests.

Shot directly by government forces during protests in Khaneh neighborhood of Isfahan, in front of his mother and grandmother. Several motorcyclist suppressive forces chased him near his home and shot him from behind. The bullet hit his heart area and he was severely wounded. He was transferred to hospital but died hours later from the severity of his injuries. After his death, government agents stole his body from the hospital and the family was left unaware of where the body was kept. Four days later, Pedram Saeidi's body was found and delivered to the family.

Shot in the lung with a bullet. Was a student of Italian language at University of Tehran and lived in dormitory. Second child of a 4-member family from Qashqai tribe. Body was buried in Firouzabad city.

Theater actress killed by direct gunshot from Islamic Republic agents during the Iranian National Revolution on Friday night in Nazi-Abad neighborhood of Tehran. Family was pressured and threatened by security agents to claim she died in a car accident after a secret burial

27-year-old Kurdish citizen and information technology engineer, arrested on 19 Dey 1404 during popular protests in Pakdasht neighborhood of Tehran. Family identified his body at Kahrizak morgue after several days. Reports indicate signs of beating were visible on his body.

Shot by government agents. Family was under security pressure when they received her body and were forced to commit to not publicize the matter and not hold any ceremony. Buried in Behesht-e Sakineh cemetery in Karaj.
Shot by sniper while trying to rescue an injured girl at Rasht Gas Roundabout. Was shot in the heart from behind. Lived with his mother and supported the household financially as he had no father.
Shot by government suppression forces during the current national revolution in Tehran
Shot directly in the head with a bullet in Narmak area of Tehran. Family wrote on funeral announcement that she was 'gifted to the homeland'
Shot on 18 Dey (January 8, 2026), taken to hospital where his condition was reportedly good and surgery was excellent, but died the next day on 19 Dey
Shot in the head and chest by suppressive forces during people's protests. Married with three children, originally from Ardabil, residing in Parand.
17-year-old from Marvdasht, shot by government forces during popular protests
Shot by suppression forces (security forces) in Tabriz

Shot by Islamic Republic forces during protests in Karaj. Was a 27-year-old player in Iran's women's football league, played for Tehran's 'Mehrgan Pardis' team, had previously played for 'Azarakhsh' and 'Saba' teams, and had been invited to Iran's national women's football training camps. She was also a professional mountaineer who had conquered Damavand and Elbrus peaks. Her body was returned to her family 3 days after her killing on Monday 22 Dey and she was buried in Islamshahr.

Child of Zahra Bani Amerian. Killed along with parents when their private car was shot at by government agents during peaceful protests. The family was inside their personal vehicle when it was riddled with bullets.

Husband of Zahra Bani Amerian. Killed along with his wife and child when their private car was shot at by government agents during peaceful protests. The family was inside their personal vehicle when it was riddled with bullets.
Wife of Bijan Mostafavi and mother of Danial Mostafavi, killed alongside her husband and son when their personal car was raked with bullets by government forces. Family friends of the source.
Kurdish citizen killed during popular protests in the provinces of Ilam, Tehran, Alborz, Markazi, Kermanshah and Isfahan

Shot in the head with live bullets by regime forces on the evening of January 18. Originally from the deprived town of Gosht in Saravan, Sistan and Baluchestan, he was a migrant worker from Iran's marginalized southeast who had moved to Karaj for labor. After days of family searches, his body was identified at Alborz Hospital in Karaj. Forensic authorities demanded 1 billion tomans for body release and pressured family to falsely claim he was a Basij member, which family denied, insisting he was just a humble worker. Burial took place on January 23 in his homeland.
Shot in the forehead with live ammunition by IR armed suppressive forces during protests and died from her injuries

Gilak citizen from Chaboksar, born in 1361 (1982), father of a 17-year-old son and 13-year-old daughter. Shot in the back with war bullets by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during popular protests in Chaboksar on 19 Dey 1404 (January 8, 2026). After enduring severe injuries for several days, he died on 28 Dey 1404
Referee and coach from Isfahan province who had a 2-year-old child, killed by suppression forces with war bullets on Friday
Shot at close range with pellet gunfire on January 8 in the city of Khomein, died on January 17 in the city of Arak due to the severity of his injuries

Brother of Hamid Arzanloo, entrepreneur and well-known activist in Iran's furniture industry. When he went to the scene to help and rescue his brother Hamid, he was targeted by two bullets to the neck area and also fell into a coma. Died in hospital. Security institutions demanded 1.5 billion tomans from family to return the body and forced them to sign a commitment to declare the cause of death as 'brain stroke'. Family was also required to attend mandatory government rally at Revolution Square. Father of three young children.

Shot by Islamic Republic security forces during national uprising on January 9th. Shot twice in the neck while rushing to help his brother Hamid who had been wounded. Fell into a coma and passed away in hospital on January 17th. Entrepreneur brother and well-known figure in Iran's furniture industry. Father of three young children. Security agencies demanded 1.5 billion tomans from family to release body and forced them to sign a pledge declaring cause of death as stroke.

Promising footballer for Tehran's Delvar Afraz youth team, fatally shot by security forces during protests. Authorities enforced media blackout, fabricated a case against him, forced his family to falsely claim he was a Basij member for body release, and threatened them into silence.

59-year-old resident of Nazarabad in Alborz Province. Shot with direct fire of pellet bullets by government suppressive forces during popular protests on 19 Dey (January 9, 2026) in Hashtgerd, Alborz Province. Winchester pellet bullets hit areas of his brain, face, throat, heart and lungs. Died after one week in coma. His body was delivered to his family after interrogation and threats by government forces. Death certificate states he died from internal bleeding following gunshot wound to chest cavity.

Kurdish citizen who was shot by government forces during popular protests in Khorramabad. He was hit by a direct bullet while on the balcony of his house on Razi Street. He was initially wounded and later died in the hospital. His body was buried in the cemetery of Ivandreh village in Kakaraza district.
Injured on 19 Dey 1404 in Isfahan, died on 26 Dey from his injuries
Shot directly in the heart. His body was found after being missing for one week. He was buried on 26 Dey month.
Shot on Friday, 19 Dey 1404 in Anzali (Naser Khosrow area) and died the following Wednesday. Authorities did not allow burial in Anzali, so he was buried in Ramsar instead.

Last seen on 18 Dey (January 8) around 9:30 PM at Coca-Cola intersection. Body was returned 6 days later on 24 Dey. Killed by gunshot at close range to his face. Born 23 Bahman 1372. Had tried to emigrate but decided to stay in Iran and build his life there.

Shot in the head with a bullet in Tehranpars. Family had no information about their children for six days, then were contacted on 25 Dey to come to the forensic medicine office for identification where they found Milad's body. He had a twin sister.

Transgender woman who fell from a motorcycle at Hasht Behesht intersection. Found with head bleeding, taken to Asgarieh Hospital where she died. Body was transferred to Bagh Rezvan cemetery. Family received the body on Friday and burial took place on Sunday January 16 in Gashnizjan village, Isfahan. A memorial service was held at a local mosque on Monday January 18.

Abducted by regime's repressive forces and killed. Known for writing Mahsa Amini's name on a mountain during the Woman, Life, Freedom uprising's 40th day commemoration in 1401. Family was not allowed to bury him in Arak; his body was buried in the city of Astaneh.

Shot by live ammunition (گلوله جنگی) while working in Tehran Bazaar. His body was released to family only after payment of 1.6 billion Tomans (~$24,000 USD). Funeral was held under tight security measures with only immediate family allowed. He had previously been wounded by pellet rounds during the 2022 protests.

28-year-old Gilaki citizen from Rasht living in Tehran, arrested by IRGC intelligence forces on Tuesday 23 Dey 1404. Security agents first stopped her on the street then followed her to her residence. After she entered her home, IRGC intelligence forces raided her family home, searched the premises and arrested her. No official information about her detention location, reasons for arrest, or physical and legal condition has been provided to the family.

Killed by Khamenei's murderers in Amol. His body was stolen and his family was forced under threats and intimidation to introduce him as a Basiji member. Everyone in Amol who knew Iliya knows he hated this regime.

Shot in the back of the neck with a military bullet by Khamenei's forces on 19 Dey in Tehran, suffered complete spinal cord injury, and died on 24 Dey due to complications from the gunshot wound. Originally from Noorabad, Fars

Civil activist from Arak, arrested by IRGC intelligence on her way back from Tehran to Arak. No information available about her fate since arrest. Had been previously arrested months earlier due to her civil activities.

Kurdish citizen who fell into a coma after being shot with bullets and receiving multiple baton blows to the head during protests. Died after one week. Initially wounded on Thursday 18 Dey by government forces through shooting with war bullets and baton strikes. Body was buried on Friday 26 Dey.
Kurdish Yarsan from Zardeh Dalahu, killed by direct shooting by military forces during popular protests

Shot and killed along with Hadi Ghanbarpour at a checkpoint 5 kilometers from Jonghan city. Their car was inspected at the checkpoint, and when they got back in to leave, they were shot from 5-10 meters away with dozens of war bullets. Aligholi was severely injured by dozens of bullets and pellets to his chest, head, neck, face and spinal cord. After being hospitalized for several days, he was abducted from the hospital at midnight by regime security forces accompanied by clerics. His body was returned to his family after he died. The regime attempted to present him as a 'martyr of the Islamic Republic' but this was rejected by the people of Jonghan.

Kurdish citizen shot directly at close range (0.5-1 meter distance) with at least 150 pellets in the right eye area during protests. Pellets penetrated his nerves, brain, neck arteries, and even lungs, completely destroying his face. Lost both eyes immediately and fell into a coma with consciousness level 3. Died after 5 days in coma at Shabad Hospital.
Murdered along with his three-year-old son. Bodies have not been handed over to family.

Shot directly by government forces during popular protests in Shahin Shahr, Isfahan Province on Thursday January 8, 2026 (18 Dey 1404). He was hit by a bullet in his side, which initially caused injury but after four days he died due to the severity of his wounds. His body was buried on Friday January 17, 2026 (26 Dey 1404) in Behesht-e Masoomeh Cemetery in Shahin Shahr. He was married with two children.

Shot and killed along with Aligholi Mokhtari at a checkpoint 5 kilometers from Jonghan city. Their car was inspected at the checkpoint, and when they got back in to leave, they were shot from 5-10 meters away with dozens of war bullets by IRGC suppression and intelligence forces. The regime attempted to present him as a 'martyr of the Islamic Republic' but this was rejected by the people of Jonghan. Both bodies were buried under strict security measures with families forced to give commitments not to publicize the matter.

Shot with pellet gun by government forces at close range while helping an injured person at Sharifabad intersection in Shiraz. More than 80 pellets were extracted from his right kidney. The pellet hit his right kidney which had to be removed, he underwent surgery twice with part of his intestines also removed, and his left kidney failed. He was a truck driver who recently owned a spare parts shop. Family was not allowed to see the wound site, only his face, and his funeral was held under restrictions with four security forces present.
Shot with three war bullets in the abdomen during protests in Amol on the evening of 19 Dey. Died several days later in hospital. From Buran village, Amol.

Father of two children from Rafsanjan who was severely injured by direct gunfire from government forces during protests on 19 Dey in Rafsanjan. He died from his injuries on 22 Dey while hospitalized. During his hospitalization, none of his relatives were allowed to visit him. His body was buried under strict security measures without any funeral ceremony.

Kurdish blogger known online as 'Black Scorpion' (عقرب سیاه), arrested by government forces in the city of Lomar. No information available about his fate. Previously arrested during the 'Woman Life Freedom' movement.
Mother of a teenage daughter, arrested and killed by intelligence forces in Yaftabad area of Tehran

Shot by forces of the Islamic Republic regime. According to his niece, he was shot directly while participating in protests. He was described as a healthy man who went to the mountains and was mindful of his diet, had 5 grandchildren, and was in the streets during the protests when he was killed.

20-year-old electronics student shot by regime mercenaries in the main blood artery in his leg near Nazi Abad, Tehran. Was taken to Amir al-Momenin Hospital which lacked sufficient equipment, then transferred to Shariati Hospital where surgery was performed, but he could not survive. Body buried in section 309 of Behesht Zahra cemetery.
Killed during protests in Rafsanjan, Kerman. Described as an unidentified/unnamed example case.

Shot with a war bullet during suppression of popular protests in Mehrshahr area of Karaj around 8:30 PM on Friday. According to eyewitness accounts, he was targeted in the abdomen area and the bullet exited through his back. Plainclothes agents had created tension among the crowd and thrown stones at shop shutters before security forces fired tear gas and threw grenades. At least two people were shot during the incident.

3-year-old child who died from injuries sustained from direct gunfire by government suppressive forces during protests. Was hit by a bullet during clashes between government forces and protesters on January 9, 2026, was wounded and fell into a coma before dying. Body was buried on January 14, 2026 in the cemetery of Shadab village in Neyshabur. Government institutions blamed protesters for her death.

Baloch citizen shot directly in the neck by government forces during popular protests in Neyshabur. Suffered severe spinal cord injury and spinal cord severance. Died after three days in ICU. Body was returned to family after three days for 300 million tomans.
Citizen of Talesh from Makelovan area of Fouman, worked as tire seller in Tehran, shot directly by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran in Nezam-Abad area of Tehran

Shot with bullets in the Zia Abri area of Rasht city. After his death, security agencies prevented any public ceremonies for him. His family was pressured and forced to sign a written commitment to introduce his body as a 'Basiji'. His body was buried in the Nasirolmahalle mosque in Shaft without public ceremonies. He was a 52-year-old Gilak citizen from Shaft.
Died during protests in Ghaleh Seid, Dezful in Dey 1404. Born in 1370 Persian calendar

Shot by Islamic Republic security forces during national uprising on January 9th. Critically wounded by bullet to the head and fell into a coma. Died on January 11th after being unconscious. Entrepreneur brother and well-known figure in Iran's furniture industry. Father of two children. Security agencies demanded 1.5 billion tomans from family to release body and forced them to sign a pledge declaring cause of death as stroke.
Killed during protests in Tehran. Worked at a car showroom in Abbas Abad, Tehran.

Gilan citizen from Shaft, residing in Rasht. Shot by Iranian government forces in the Razi roundabout area of Rasht while inside his vehicle. The bullet hit his forehead area. His body was buried on 21 Dey 1404 (January 11, 2026) with heavy presence of intelligence forces at around 12:30 AM in Osmavoandan village.
Shot with bullets while traveling by motorcycle with his close friend Mohammadamin Khatem. The two young men were intimate friends who were targeted while in transit and lost their lives.
31-year-old powerlifting champion from Shahrood, Semnan Province, shot in the head and killed on Monday
Died in Gonabad during the protests
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial database
37-year-old resident of Shahreza, shot by direct fire from government forces during popular protests on 19 Dey 1404
Died in Tehran during the 2025-2026 protests

Shot by suppressor forces on Darvish Street in Isfahan. His relatives kept his body at home under ice and the next day secretly took him to his father's village 'Dork Shahpouri village' and buried him there
Shot with three military bullets to the stomach, side, and chest during the Lion and Sun revolution
Shot three times in the side and hand on January 8th in Bandar Abbas. Was hospitalized for two days but was denied medical treatment. Died two days later due to bleeding.
Shot by suppressors from behind
Killed in the way of the homeland during protests. Friend of the tweet author who was reported killed by someone who briefly connected to internet from Iran.

Shot with war bullets while returning from work on the evening of his birthday. Initially wounded by gunshot to the thigh area, then killed by security forces with finishing shots. Father of a 4-year-old daughter. Security forces used war bullets against protesters who had no weapons and showed no signs of armed conflict.
Father of two children, shot by Islamic Republic forces in front of the governor's office in Homayounshahr (Khomaini-shahr) during the Iranian national revolution
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial database

Shot with a bullet to the temple area. Left home alone around 6:30-7 PM on Friday evening before any protest calls, never returned. Family searched hospitals, detention centers and streets for days. Body was found bloodied and later washed for identification at Behesht Reza cemetery in Mashhad. After his killing, authorities pressured family to present him as a 'Basiji' member, which family refused. Death was ultimately registered as an 'accident' to cover up the crime. Described as a cheerful, harmless, and jovial person who had never even seen the inside of a detention center and was not one to cause trouble at his age.

Father of two children aged 7 and 10, shot by security forces in Saba Shahr, Shahriar around 9 PM near Melli Bank and Taleghani Street. Bullet hit his chest area. After being shot, friends took him near his home. While his family was trying to get him to hospital, he died in his father's arms.
22-year-old from Dezful, killed on the night of 19 Dey month by Basij forces with direct gunfire using war bullets

Shot during peaceful protest in Andisheh Township, Phase 3, Ferdowsi Street near Rudaki intersection. Direct gunfire from behind and from an unknown location hit his back and side around 8:20 PM while he was attending a protest gathering with his daughter. Despite severe bleeding and pain, he remained conscious and speaking. He was transported to hospital by his daughter and several young people but died after approximately two hours due to severe blood loss. His body was transferred to Kahrizak and identified by his son and close relatives among thousands of bodies two days later. Buried in Behesht Zahra cemetery.
Shot directly in the head by Islamic Republic suppression forces during the national uprising

25-year-old microbiology graduate student at Ferdowsi University of Mashhad. Two accounts exist of his death: first account suggests he was killed on the night of 20 Dey month with body returned to family after ten days; second account indicates he was first arrested and after about a week his family was called to collect his body

Shot in the side/flank area during protests on Piroozi Street in Tehran. He was the only child of his family and son of someone killed in the Iran-Iraq War. The night before on 19 Dey, he witnessed widespread violence by security forces and personally took many wounded to the hospital, but was not deterred by the violence he saw.
Died in Isfahan during the protests

Shot during popular protests, killed by direct gunfire from IRGC forces. He was a 24-year-old Gilaki citizen from Manjil, Gilan province. He was the only child of his family, known as an athlete and footballer with a bachelor's degree. He had a serious interest in sports, especially football and basketball, was a Persepolis fan, and dreamed of playing at the highest level of professional football. He had recently been deployed as a soldier to the naval base in Manjil but had left the barracks during the protest days to join the street demonstrations.

Turkmen citizen of Gonbad-e Kavus, shot directly by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces on Sarabi Street during protests in the city. His body was delivered to the family after several days at 6 AM. Before the body was delivered, the family was repeatedly threatened by security institutions to 'not make trouble'. Two security agents accompanied and controlled the family inside the morgue. The body was transferred directly to the cemetery and the family only had a few seconds to see his body. The burial ceremony was conducted without public rituals and under security pressures at Gonbad-e Kavus cemetery.
17-year-old from Abpakhsh city in Braazjan county, Bushehr province, killed by Islamic Republic's suppression forces
Shot directly by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government in Rasht. He was a Gilaki citizen from Rasht and father of one child.

Artesh First Lieutenant shot and killed 'while on mission' in Khavaran neighbourhood, eastern Tehran. Iranian state media reported his death and US-based human rights activists acknowledged his death on 20 January.

Orphan raised by grandmother with worker's wages, shot directly by security forces near the police station in Rostamkola, Behshahr County, Mazandaran Province. Body returned to family after several days with severe restrictions

Shot with 3 war bullets in the hand and stomach in Nazi-Abad Tehran on the night of 18 Dey. Died at 7 AM the next morning (Friday) at Pakdasht Hospital. Was a husband and father of a 4-year-old daughter. Had grown up without parents since childhood.
Shot with war bullets in Fardis on 19th Dey. Was born in 1375 Persian calendar and was a monarchist supporter.
Shot by regime suppression forces during protests. Young man from Razgardan village near Arak.

Born April 6, 1997 (16 Farvardin 1376). Had an associate degree in management and worked at his father's cookery. Shot in the head with a war bullet while protecting his mother and two sisters during protests. He had taken them to a side alley when security and military forces began direct shooting at people. When he looked out to see if officers were following them, he was shot in the head. Died in the arms of his mother and two sisters. Family was forced to pay one billion tomans to retrieve his body.

16-year-old teenager shot with live ammunition in the upper chest/heart area outside Jaber Ansari Street metro station in Isfahan. He was severely wounded and died after being transferred to Dr. Gharazi Hospital in Isfahan. His body was returned to his family about a week later. Shot directly with war weapons targeting vital areas of the body including head and heart by security forces, demonstrating clear intent to kill.

8-year-old girl killed when security forces opened fire on a vehicle she was traveling in with her mother. IR officers had prevented their car from taking the route toward their home, and after the mother attempted an alternative route, shots were fired and Anila was killed.
Shot in the back of the neck with direct gunfire by government suppression forces during people's protests
Victim documented in Iran International memorial

Shot directly in the head on Bagh-e Daryacheh Street in Isfahan, killed in her son's arms. She was an athlete, mountain climber, and fitness trainer. Mother of two children, a 19-year-old son and 25-year-old daughter.

6th semester medical student at Islamic Azad University Najafabad branch, killed during the national uprising. Born in 1383 (Persian calendar), family from Shahrekord. Body returned to family after several days delay on evening of Thursday 25 Dey. Burial ceremony held Friday 26 Dey in restricted atmosphere in Shahrekord with threatening phone calls to relatives warning against large gatherings or public expressions of grief. Memorial service held Monday 29 Dey at Behesht Rahmat Cemetery in Shahrekord with about 1000 attendees despite restrictions.

Shot with three bullets by the Islamic regime. He was only 20 years old and his only weapon was chanting against the regime. In his last messages he was hopeful that more people would come out the next day and fight for their freedom.

15-year-old girl killed by direct gunfire from Iranian government forces during protests. After being seriously wounded, she was unable to be transferred promptly to medical facilities due to a complete shutdown of communication lines and later died from the severity of her injuries.

Well-known farmer in Torbat-e Jam, father of four children with one grandchild, shot directly from behind in the head by Islamic Republic forces. Security agencies later contacted his family calling it 'human error' and offered to declare him a 'martyr' but family rejected this. Part of wider suppression in Torbat-e Jam where over 100 people were killed including children, with direct shooting at unarmed citizens in the streets.

Mother of two children aged 8 and 16. Shot directly with a bullet to the carotid artery in her neck. Killed on the path to freedom. Killed in silence because she could not bear to see the torture of two young people.
Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppressive forces during national uprising, bullet hit his heart. Family received his body three days later after paying 400 million tomans
Shot with bullets. Family was unable to publish his photo and information, and his name does not appear anywhere
Shot in the leg with a bullet in Babol. Security forces reportedly prevented his admission to hospital and he ultimately died due to severe bleeding. He had a 9-year-old daughter.
Shot in the head with a bullet by regime agents while on his way home in Mahallat county
From Baharestan area of Isfahan, commemorated as martyr (javidnam) during 2025-2026 protests
Died in Isfahan during the protests
Baloch citizen killed during protests in Bandar Abbas. From the Chatri tribe, son of Hassan, had a 3-year-old daughter, originally from Anbarabad (Kerman province). Buried on 22 Dey in Anbarabad.
Mother of twin young sons, shot directly in the heart by government suppression forces during people's protests
Shot with direct bullet to the heart area by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government during protests. Gilaki citizen from Lashtnesha.
Mother with a five-year-old child who was taken/arrested and subsequently disappeared with no news or explanation since

Shot directly with war bullets by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic during suppression of popular protests. His body was targeted with war bullets and at least 12 pellets were observed in his head area

Shot with war ammunition. Friend took him to clinic but they said it wasn't their job. Friend went to get a car, when he returned authorities had arrived and taken Erfan away. The next day his body was found dumped in front of hospital entrance.

Shot in the head with pellet bullets during protests in Rasht. Gilaki citizen from Shaft. Family was pressured by security agencies to sign a commitment letter stating 'fall from height' as the cause of death in the hospital report before the body was released. Family was forced to hold burial and mourning ceremonies in complete silence without public ceremonies.

21-year-old Baloch citizen killed during popular protests in Bandar Abbas by direct shooting of war bullet by military and security forces to the head area. Son of Mohammad Youssef, from Zahedan and resident of Bandar Abbas. Body was delivered to family from Khalij Fars Hospital and buried on 22 Dey (January 12) in Mohammad Rasool Allah cemetery in Zahedan. This is the third Baloch victim in the nationwide 1404 protests.
Killed during protests in Bandar Abbas, identity confirmed by Hengaw Organization for Human Rights

22-year-old midwifery student and volleyball player, shot near Milad crossroads, Imamat Boulevard in Mashhad during the Shir-o-Khorshid revolution. Transferred to medical facility but died due to severity of injuries. Her mother was also injured during the incident. Family kept her name secret for a long time due to pressures and threats, and even her burial ceremony was held without public announcement.

Bakhtiari ethnicity. Killed by proxy forces of the Islamic Republic (Iraqi forces) during recent protests. He defended himself and people against repression by Iraqi terrorist forces, confronted them and neutralized one of them, but terrorists from Hashd al-Shaabi fired seven bullets into his chest
Father of a 5-year-old daughter, shot by Islamic Republic forces in Falah neighborhood of Tehran with one bullet to the shoulder and one bullet to the face
Death on January 10, 2026 in Mobarakeh, Isfahan during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests
Killed at Diba Clinic on Shafaq Street where she worked. She was from Qods Township in Isfahan, below the prison bridge. She came from a poor family and was caring for her sick parents.

Shot while returning home from work in the Kakh Circle area of Gorgan on the evening of Thursday January 8, 2026. She was a 20-year-old athlete and physiotherapist. After being shot, she was transferred to Panj Azar Hospital but died two days later due to the severity of her injuries.

16-year-old high school student from Isfahan who was a tenant and worked in the afternoons. Shot with three war bullets by special forces near Bozorgmehr Bridge in front of her father and mother's eyes on the night of 19 Dey.

PhD student and mathematics elite who was shot by Islamic Republic forces on the night of January 8, 2026 during suppression of popular protests. He was severely wounded and hospitalized for several days before dying from his injuries. Previously beaten severely during Green Movement protests in Shiraz to the point of near death. Had been under security pressure for years including detention, expulsion from university, and systematic educational and professional restrictions. According to his cousin, he was killed with a shot to the heart while in Islamic Republic custody.

Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppressive forces in Fardis, Karaj. He was a production line worker at 'Toga' company. After his death, the company deleted all his information and records from their systems due to fear of security pressures. Security forces did not allow his family to bury his body in Karaj. The family was forced under pressure to transfer his body to northern Iran for burial in one of the villages in the Savadkuh region. This represents the regime's policy of creating terror, controlling burial ceremonies, and preventing public gatherings at victims' graves.
Shot directly by government forces' bullets in the evening of 19 Dey

Shot in the chest by suppression forces during protests in Isfahan on Hasht Behesht street near his home. Signs of beating and bruising were also reported on his leg. His body was found after 6 days of searching at Bagh-e Razvan cemetery in Isfahan. He was buried in his hometown Naghan in Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari province.
Killed by regime forces, burial location concealed by authorities
Killed on Friday, 19 Dey. Body was buried.
Shot by Islamic Republic forces during protests in Shazand, Arak. When Hassan was shot, he was still alive and managed to reach his home with difficulty, but died in front of his house.
45 years old, married, father of two children, from Marvdasht. Shot by government forces during people's protests.

Shot in the head with a war bullet in Hashemieh district of Mashhad. Family was demanded 1 billion rials to receive his body. Authorities prevented family from holding funeral ceremonies and told family to claim he died in an accident.
Shot during protests on Aram Boulevard in Mehrshahr, Karaj. Family was not permitted to hold a public burial.
Son of Aframarz Baba-Ahmadi, one of the notables of the Bakhtiari tribe. Shot with live ammunition by Islamic Republic suppression forces in the city of Falavarjan, Isfahan Province.
21-year-old from Khorramabad, Lorestan, killed by security forces

Shot in the stomach by Islamic Republic security forces bullets in the city of Shazand. His burial was conducted at 5 AM under government threat and coercion, without the presence or knowledge of the people
Killed innocently in front of a grocery store in Malekshahr, had two children and was from Deligan neighborhood
66-year-old woman who died during protests in Arak. The tweet mentions she was one of the casualties from Arak, with people from all generations participating in the protests.

Shot with Kalashnikov rifle in pelvic area and side, killed in front of police station 13 in Joyabad neighborhood. Buried a week later under family pressure without ceremony in Bagh Ferdows cemetery in Khomeinishahr

Shot from behind with direct military fire (confirmed Kalashnikov) in Pasdaran neighborhood on January 7, 2026. Bullet exited from his left eye. Initially stabilized at Shohada Hospital in Tajrish with consciousness level improving from 3 to 5. Family arranged transfer to private hospital where neurosurgeons confirmed he could be saved, but hospital staff administered an injection that caused cardiac arrest within an hour. Body was held hostage by authorities who demanded payment of 1.2 billion tomans ($8,900) before releasing it to family. Funeral held under heavy security with family threatened against continuing mourning.
Shot directly in the heart while helping an injured person

43-year-old Kurdish woman from Hamadan residing in Qarchak (Tehran suburb), shot directly by suppressive forces during popular protests. She was married, mother of three children (ages 16, 11, and 2), standing next to a tree when targeted by snipers positioned around the gathering. Bullet hit her head, transferred immediately to hospital, died after two hours. Her body was delivered from Kahrizak on Monday 22 Dey and buried in a security atmosphere at Fatemeh Paradise cemetery in Qarchak.
Provincial wrestling champion shot by regime forces with war bullets near his family home. Bullets hit his head area and he died at the scene. He was a young wrestler and provincial champion.
Bodybuilding champion from Qazvin, shot in the chest during protests
Captain (naval), father of two daughters, shot with war bullets during Friday protests in Bushehr city
Killed in Karaj. Family found his body three days after his killing.
Died at Simin intersection in Isfahan

Shot from behind with pellets while fleeing from security forces who attacked while she was standing in front of her aunt's house door in Saadi neighborhood of Kermanshah. She was a professional karate athlete with several championship medals.
Dentist working in Sattar Khan area of Tehran, killed by direct shooting by Islamic Republic mercenaries

Shot directly by suppressive forces on Bozorgmehr Street in Isfahan on Friday, January 8th, 2026. Was wounded and transferred to hospital, died two days later on January 10th, 2026. His wife was also wounded while trying to lift him from the ground and is currently under intensive medical care. His body was delivered and buried after four days among a pile of bodies from Bagh-e Rezvan cemetery.
Died in Yaft Abad, Shams Abad neighborhood. Local children requested that his memory not be forgotten.
Shot by firing squad along with 20 others who were cornered in a dead-end alley; only one person survived the mass execution. Originally from Boroujerd and buried there.
Ceramic artist and mother of a 14-year-old son, killed during protests by shotgun pellets that hit her heart and lungs

Shot directly with a war bullet to the liver area by government forces. 48-year-old head of household, mother of two children and caregiver to elderly parents. After her killing, severe pressure was exerted on the family to declare her as a 'martyr' and accept the government's official narrative. Her body was transported to northern Iran for burial under intense security pressure with very limited attendees. The mosque door was not allowed to be opened for her ceremony, despite her previous extensive financial contributions to that mosque. Her body showed suspicious conditions - her abdomen was completely cut and stitched, but no signs of stitching or repair were visible at the bullet impact site, raising serious doubts about possible unauthorized organ removal.
Shot with bullet in Eslamshahr, Tehran. Had prepared his wedding ceremony for the following week. His sister is restless and heartbroken.

Shot in the head on Chahal Va Panj Metri street in Dezful next to an underpass. He suffered from severe kidney failure after contracting COVID-19, had undergone a kidney transplant that was rejected, was undergoing dialysis three times a week, and was waiting for test results for another transplant. He owned a pesticide shop and had dreams of having his own greenhouse, getting married, and living life.
Killed in Fardis, Karaj during protests
Shot directly by security forces near the police station in Rostamkola, Behshahr County, Mazandaran Province. Body returned to family after several days with severe restrictions
Shot directly by government suppression forces during people's protests. His body was handed over to family 5 days later after payment was received
Shot in the head. Worked as an auto body mechanic in Gotvand, Khuzestan Province
Initially shot in the leg and arrested on 18 Dey. According to reports, two days later in prison, regime mercenaries shot another bullet into his chest, killing him
Killed during popular protests by direct attack from government suppression forces. His family is under security pressures.

Shot in the neck with a military bullet by Khamenei's mercenaries in the evening while living in Dehno neighborhood of Isfahan. He was married with two young children aged 7 and 4, described as very moral and athletic
Killed by war bullet at Education roundabout

Shot with war bullets while protesting. Killed on the order of Khamenei on Saheb road in Shushtar city during protests over the country's conditions. Described as being in the prime of his youth, less than three decades old.
Kidnapped from his confectionery workplace in Arak by Khamenei's suppressive forces along with his brother on 20 Dey. No information about their fate is available since then.
Shot directly by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic in Rasht. 39 years old and from Rasht.

Shot with war ammunition in the upper torso from behind around 10 PM near Dr. Hesabi Street in Isfahan. Died from blood loss before reaching hospital. Body was returned to family 4 days later and buried in Bagh-e Rezvan cemetery in Isfahan.

Shot in the neck with a military bullet while riding behind her father on a motorcycle. Found in Kahrizak with a hole in her throat. She fell from the motorcycle after being shot and died in her father's arms, unable to speak when trying to say 'dad'.

Shot directly by government forces' bullets in Rasht city. Originally from Fouman county. Was a childhood friend of Mehran Basir Tavana who was killed in the 2022-2023 protests and never forgot his grief over losing Mehran. Was arrested for 15 days after chanting against government suppression and violence at Mehran's 40-day memorial ceremony. Was a football enthusiast and leader of Fouman football team, worked at a hookah lounge. Family was pressured after his death - body was buried at night in complete silence with only mother, sister and brother allowed to attend. Even hanging a black flag on their house door was prohibited. Family had to pay bail to receive his body and now remain silent due to fear of further pressure. Buried at Imamzadeh Mirza in Fouman near his family's residence.

Shot with multiple shotgun pellets at Pol-e Fajr (Fajr Bridge) in Mashhad. Suffered spleen hemorrhaging and bleeding. Prevented from being taken to hospital for 6 hours, died from severe blood loss after 6 hours.

Shot in the heart near Farhangiyan store in Azadegan Square, Karaj. According to a close source, he had two mobile phones which were stolen from his corpse along with his watch and not returned to the family.
Master's degree student in Computer Engineering (Software orientation) at Iran University of Science and Technology, admitted in 1402, killed by war bullet
Shot by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during nationwide protests in Rasht. Gilak citizen from Rasht.
Shot and killed in Haft Houz. His last words to his friend were 'Run, they're going to shoot you now' before a bullet took his life.
Shot in the heart with a war bullet in Azimiyeh, Karaj

Shot directly in the side area, then executed with a gunshot to the forehead. Family found his body after several searches and during identification observed signs of the execution shot to the head. His brother Mohsen Pirmoradian was killed in the Iran-Iraq war. Despite family opposition, security forces buried him in the martyrs' cemetery in Najafabad and only allowed 10 family members to attend the funeral ceremony.
Died during protests in Isfahan
Two-time national youth MMA champion and member of Iran's national MMA team. Shot by Islamic regime agents.
Heavy-vehicle driver and only son of family, son of war veteran, shot from the front with live ammunition by IRGC forces during protests. Killed in the area opposite the waterfall in central Shazand.
16-year-old victim from Independence Square (Meydan-e Esteqlal) in Mahallat, Markazi Province
From Mobarakeh, shot and killed by plainclothes security officer using unlicensed Samand car

35-year-old gym owner and resident of Saveh, shot by suppressive forces during popular protests on the evening of 19 Dey 1404. In a video released of him, he said 'My Iran is more precious than my body'

Shot in the leg with a high-caliber bullet on Salsabil (Rudaki) Street in Tehran during the national uprising. Died from severe bleeding. Police claimed he was shot by protesters, which follows the regime's narrative of claiming protesters are armed.

Shot with military bullet to the back of the knee causing severe bleeding on the 19th night in Fardis, Karaj, in the area of 8th Street. He was a principal of Nik Nam High School in Fardis and described as a very honorable and righteous person.

27-year-old truck driver from Qazvin was killed with war bullets while honking his horn during protests in Neyshabur. He was transporting cargo from Qazvin to Mashhad when he encountered crowds in Neyshabur. Citizens asked him to honk his horn and he did, but was immediately targeted with direct fire from war bullets. The bullet hit his heart, causing his death.

Shot by Islamic Republic suppression agents in Baharestan area of Isfahan. First shot in right leg, fell wounded, taken by ambulance to Alzahra Hospital Isfahan. At the hospital, agents fired a bullet to the side of his head as a finishing shot. Also known as Shah-Morad, monarchist from Izeh who worked as a guard in Isfahan. Family searched hospitals for days, initially told he was wounded and alive, but later found his body in Bagh Rezvan cemetery Isfahan with clear bullet marks to side of head. Buried with Lion and Sun flag in Izeh village Nashlil-e Do on 28 Dey 1404 (2026-01-18).
Killed during protests

Shot with one bullet right under his throat during protests. Told friends 'I'm suffocating' before dying. Body was taken to Dezful hospital then moved to Ahvaz. Authorities prevented family from seeing the body or saying goodbye, only allowing direct burial after extensive searching and negotiations.
Killed on Friday alongside 17 or 18 others by several mercenary motorcyclists who shot at their veins. Father of two sons aged 12 and 3 years old.
Father of three young children, shot in the back of the head by regime forces
Father of three children, fruit seller near the governor's office in Homayounshahr. Shot by forces while going to the street to help an injured woman, according to witnesses
Shot in the back with war bullet by government forces, died from severe bleeding. Mother of a 6-year-old son. Killed with direct gunshot while unarmed civilian.

Arab citizen shot in the neck by security forces during protests in Golestan neighborhood, Ahvaz on January 8, 2026. He was transferred to Karami Hospital and died the next day due to severity of injuries from blind shooting by security forces. Father of Qasem, owned a fruit shop in Golestan neighborhood, lived in Alavi neighborhood (Hay al-Thawra, Ahmadi Street).
Shot in the head during Friday night clashes on 19 Dey month on Ahmad Abad street in Mashhad. His body was found by his family at Behesht Reza morgue several days later
65-year-old from Tehranpars who died on 20 Dey

Mother of a young son, killed during popular protests by direct gunfire from government suppressive forces, and when her lifeless body fell to the ground, one of the agents came towards her corpse and fired a final shot to her heart

Shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Mohammadieh city, Qazvin. She was a photographer and guitarist. Her body was handed over to her family in exchange for 300 million tomans. She was buried in Hesar Khorvan cemetery in Qazvin. Her family remains under heavy surveillance by security agencies.

Shot with live ammunition by Islamic Republic forces during protests in Shahsavar (Tonekabon). She was participating in protests with her father and died in his arms. Negin had studied biotechnology engineering and was described as a cheerful girl interested in art and sports. She painted, swam, and read extensively. She had wanted to emigrate to Australia.
Described as 'martyr of the homeland path'. Had previously defeated cancer several years ago.
23-year-old elite philosophy student at University of Tehran, originally from Hamadan. Was a writer and authored books. Killed in the path of the homeland.
Killed by the regime. Worked as a barber in Tehran, was an only child who lived with and cared for his ill mother

Elevator installer, shot in the head by regime's repressive forces on the night of Thursday. His body was withheld from family under pressure and forced commitments, handed over early Sunday around 3:00 AM, and buried just two hours later at 5:00 AM without permission for any funeral or mourning ceremony. Buried under security restrictions in Shahbaz city, in the village of Bazneh. Family was denied the right to hold memorial ceremony.
Shot from the top of a telecommunications building. After the killing, authorities demanded 3 billion tomans as payment for their crime.

Kurdish young man from Kermanshah, shot with a war bullet by Islamic Republic suppression forces in front of his shop in Maskan neighborhood during popular protests on Friday evening 19 Dey 1404. Families reportedly forced to pay between 700 million tomans to 1 billion tomans to receive victims' bodies.

Shot by Islamic Republic security forces at Taleghani (Azadegan) Square in Karaj. Was targeted with direct fire from the top of a building and was hit by three bullets. The bullets hit her pelvic area, spine, and thigh, and she died due to severe bleeding.
Abducted by Islamic Republic forces in Teacher Square (میدان معلم) in Rasht, and family has been unable to find any trace of their child since then

Mother of a 7-year-old daughter, shot by suppression forces during protests in Nurabad Mamasani. After being hit by a bullet, she called her husband and brother saying 'come take me', but minutes later was targeted by more gunfire. IRGC-affiliated forces transported the wounded and killed together, and Parisa was among those transferred. Her body was returned to the family after several days under security conditions, including restrictions on who could perform the ritual washing, burial in early morning hours, and prohibition on chanting by relatives. Multiple bullets were found in her body, including a shot to the heart that evidence suggests occurred after her phone call.
5th-semester medical student at Mashhad University and graduate of Iran's elite talent schools, killed with military weapons during massacre
Shot in the side and neck during protests. Had previously helped save a girl during 1401 protests and returned to the streets again
Shot with three bullets, recently married (new son-in-law), resident of Andisheh

Shot by government sniper positioned on National Bank of Iran rooftop at Abshar intersection in Isfahan on Friday the 19th at 6 PM. Bullet hit his shoulder. Was hospitalized at Sadoughi Hospital in Isfahan under IRGC supervision. Despite being alive with only a shoulder wound, family was not allowed to see him. After one week of family pursuing his whereabouts, they were told they could go to Bagh Rezvan (cemetery). When family reached his body, they found he had been killed with a coup de grâce shot. While his shoulder was bandaged, there were traces of another bullet on his chest. Killed in hospital while wounded - a crime against humanity.
35-year-old citizen from Ilam, kidnapped by Islamic Republic agents on Friday 19 Dey month. No information available about his condition since then.
22-year-old sports science student in his 7th semester, killed by suppression forces in Shahriar

Shopkeeper from Shapour Jadid Isfahan area. Born in 1954 (Persian calendar year 54 likely refers to 1375/1996, but given context of being a shopkeeper, more likely refers to 1954 Gregorian or 1333 Persian = 1954). Commemorated as 'child of Iran, life-giver for the homeland'
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Dezful
Kurdish citizen killed during popular protests. One of 7 Kurdish victims confirmed by Kurdistan Human Rights Network in Kermanshah, Tehran, Karaj and Abadan cities.

Shot with live ammunition by plainclothes forces during protests in Yaftabad neighborhood around 11 PM. Shot from behind with war bullets while protests were being suppressed. Attackers were plainclothes but used a Samand car with IRGC insignia.
Shot with direct fire during protests. Was an only son and newlywed. From Zeinabiyeh neighborhood in Isfahan.
Shot directly in the heart by government suppression forces during protests
Shot directly in the head during the second day of the Shah's call for protest. Killed in front of the Razi Serum Manufacturing Institute in Hesarak with a direct shot to the head.
Killed by war bullet on Basij Boulevard
Fitness trainer (also known as Venus), shot in the throat and stomach

Kurdish citizen from Qoch Tepe village in Asadabad, Hamedan, father of two children. Shot in the leg by Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Saveh city in Markazi province on 18 Dey 1404. After being transferred to a hospital in Tehran, he died two days later due to severity of injuries. Security institutions did not allow transfer of his body to his hometown and family was forced to bury him in Saveh city.
Died on 20 Dey 1404 in Isfahan during 2025-2026 protests
From Abgashneh village, killed by war bullet at Education roundabout

Shot in the forehead area on the main street of Gohardasht sixth section during protests. Family was pressured to claim he was a Basij member but they refused. Body was returned to family after payment of fees.

37-year-old accountant and technology park employee from Shiraz, living in Tehran. Shot directly by government suppression forces in front of his wife's eyes during protests. His body was returned to the family three days later and buried in Damavand.

Shot by IRGC forces with three types of weapons (shotgun, Kalashnikov, and Dushka) while returning home after dropping off a friend in Baharestan Isfahan, around Baharestan Square. Dushka bullet completely destroyed his right arm, Kalashnikov bullet hit below his heart and tore his lung and liver, another bullet hit his lower back. He fought for 8 hours in his own blood before being transferred to Al-Zahra Hospital Isfahan where he died from severe injuries. He was a mechanical engineer, motorcycle courier, owner of a simple Pride car, and family breadwinner who was saving money to buy a house for his family.
Shot by bullet to throat and chest in Alahiyeh area of Mashhad during protests

Shot by IRGC forces on Basirat Street in Foulad Shahr, Isfahan at 8:30 PM while alone. Motorcyclist approached him, he sat on the ground and put his hood over his head pleading not to be beaten. They placed a gun on his back and fired pellets/buckshot, with a scatter pattern that resulted in 50 pellets entering his body, penetrating his spinal cord and heart. Died instantly from bleeding. Body delivered to family on the 26th and buried under security measures.
Victim documented in Iran International memorial database

Singer, musician, and talented artist who changed his name from Mohammad to Shahoo a year ago. Shot with two bullets to his heart by repressive forces of the Islamic Republic. Had requested that Ebi's song 'Maslakh' (slaughterhouse) be played at his grave, but oppressive forces did not allow his last wish to be fulfilled.

Shot by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic security forces during Iran's national uprising in Baharestan, Isfahan. He was a powerlifting athlete from Izeh and a two-time national champion in powerlifting. In one of his last messages to a close friend, he wrote 'I'm not here, take care of the family.'
Killed during protests on 20 Dey 1404. Sister contacted source noting his photo was not included among other commemorated victims.

Killed during protests in the coastal city of Chaf in Langarud County. Mother of two children. Protests occurred on Saturday, 20 Dey 1404, when the main square of Chaf was crowded with people chanting slogans and several locations including 'the house of a famous IRGC member' were set on fire. She followed Tavaana's educational materials and commented on them.
Shot directly by security forces near the police station in Rostamkola, Behshahr County, Mazandaran Province. Body returned to family after several days with severe restrictions

22-year-old final-year software engineering student shot directly from behind by Islamic Republic forces in Tehranpars area of Tehran. Family found his body among other corpses after five days of searching. He was also a guitarist and athlete alongside his studies.

17-year-old child from Shahriyar, Tehran, killed by direct gunshot from war bullets fired by government suppression forces on Zakariya Razi Street during popular protests. Buried on his birthday night on Sunday 21 Dey (January 11) in Behesht Zahra cemetery in Shahriyar.

33-year-old Kurdish man from Karzan in Ilam Province who was shot with shotgun pellets by security forces on Friday, 19 Dey 1404, during public protests. He was carrying his young child and crossing the street when he was directly targeted by suppressors. He was severely injured in both eyes and completely lost his sight. He is the breadwinner of his family and a simple worker. After 17 days from the injury, he still sees only darkness and general doctors have given up hope for treating his eyes. His family had to sell their sheep, which were their main source of income, to travel to Tehran and seek specialist medical opinion.
22-year-old from Izeh, resident of Fooladshahr, shot from behind by suppressive forces during people's protests
22-year-old computer engineering student at Birjand University of Technology, from Esfarayen, shot by Islamic Republic suppressors in the evening
Shot with war bullets by suppression forces during Isfahan protests on January 8, 2026. Despite 11 surgeries and 8 cardiac resuscitations and leg amputation, he died at Al-Zahra Hospital in Isfahan
Shot with war bullets on 19 Dey and arrested. A few days later, her lifeless body was returned to the family with signs of execution shots.
Shot in the heart with a war bullet while getting out of his car to help an injured person. He was an only child. His family is under severe pressure not to mention his name.
Shot by Islamic Republic mercenaries, bullet hit his neck and he died

Voice actor and film and theater artist from Isfahan, assistant director, member of the Glory Dubbing Group and the Tehran Dubbing Association, presenter and assistant director. Shot in the throat by the repressive forces of the Islamic Republic regime during protests in the city. Security institutions attempted to distort the cause of her death by claiming it was due to cardiac arrest, contradicting eyewitness accounts. Her last project was a film titled 'A Bridge Over a Dry River' where she worked as script supervisor, selected for the Tajikistan International Film Festival.

Shot directly by Karimian, former head of Sadeh Lenjan police station. Bullet hit under his armpit, entered his lung causing severe internal bleeding. He was unarmed at the time and had tried to prevent violence through dialogue, saying 'Come down, we have no business with you' to the police station chief. During the protests, he had been helping others and saving wounded protesters without protective equipment despite the danger of gunfire, successfully saving several lives from direct danger.
