Gilak citizen from Lahijan, died in the night of 19 Dey 1404 in Rasht in the area of Seighalan Square. His body was transferred to Lefmejan village in Lahijan for burial. He was married and had a 12-year-old child.
Gilaki citizen from Rostamabad and sports trainer, killed by gunshot wound to the neck by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government

Shot with direct gunfire by government forces on Naser Khosrow Street in Khorramabad. Death certificate recorded 'entry of multiple foreign objects to the abdominal area' indicating multiple bullet wounds and direct shooting with intent to kill. Body was delivered to family on January 11 after several days of pursuit and uncertainty. Family was under intense pressure to accept the government's false narrative and identify their son as a 'Basiji'. Was an engineer and his father is a retired police force member.
Lur ethnicity, from Shushtar, shot by suppression forces
16-year-old Lor child from Vilashahr, Isfahan, killed by suppression forces with direct gunshot to the head
From Dork Shapouri village in Naghan district of Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari province, killed in Isfahan
27-year-old Gilak citizen from Chamestan, killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during protests

Youth from Sistan and Baluchestan province, shot by military and security forces during suppression of nationwide protests in the Torq neighborhood of Mashhad. His family was pressured and threatened after his killing.

Shot directly in the heart by Islamic Republic forces during protest. Security forces prevented anyone from helping him for about forty minutes while he was bleeding, threatening anyone who tried to assist. After the killing, security forces collected and removed all CCTV cameras from homes and shops on 15th Street in Fardis to destroy evidence. He was an aspiring rapper who had built a small recording studio in his bedroom closet and wrote lyrics about the pain of his generation.
Shot several times in the head. Father of a one year old daughter.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial database
Identified as a child of Iran killed in the path of homeland
Shot directly in the head by Khamenei's forces. Nephew of the tweet author's aunt.
Died during 2025-2026 Iranian protests

First-team catcher of Iran's national baseball team, youth baseball coach in Mashhad who taught without payment. On 18 Dey (January 8) he smoked his first cigarette ever to counteract tear gas effects while having been hit in the head by a pellet. Despite this injury, he returned on Friday to join the national revolution protests again. Was killed by handgun fire in the Emamat area. Body was returned after 3 days and many commitments. Authorities did not allow a funeral ceremony to be held.
Shot in the head with a war bullet while returning home from work, targeted by suppressive forces
Final semester student at Tabriz Art University from Takab city, arrested while leaving his workplace in Tabriz bazaar area

Shot during popular protests on 19 Dey 1404 in Isfahan by direct fire from security forces. He was hit by two bullets from behind on Zeinabiyeh Street and was transferred to Gharzi Hospital where he died due to severe injuries and punctured lung. He had been married for less than two years.
Shot directly with bullets by Islamic Republic suppressors in Abpakhsh city, Dashtestan County, Bushehr Province
Killed by security forces in Shahrak Andisheh district of Tehran
48-year-old father of two children, resident of Isfahan, killed during people's protests by direct gunshot to the head by government suppression forces
Shot by suppression forces in Dezful
38-year-old resident of Narmak, Tehran. Monarchist protester who was directly shot with war bullets by suppressive forces in Haft Houz neighborhood during nationwide uprising.

University of Tehran graduate student (class of 2019, irrigation major, College of Agriculture and Natural Resources), shot with war bullets by suppressive forces. Was wounded on Thursday evening 18 Dey in Haft-Howz area of Tehran, died on 19 Dey. Had a tattoo on his arm reading 'For those I love I will sacrifice'. Secret burial ceremony held with extensive presence of security agents.

Shot by Islamic Republic regime forces on Thursday at Hafthoz, died Friday during brutal suppression of uprising. Had hand tattoo reading 'For those I love I will sacrifice'. Described as courageous young man under 25 who was brimming with joy during 10 days of protests and vowed 'Don't fear, I'll stand in front of you'
Shot dead by regime's security forces while protesting. He was a shop owner and worked on car audio systems.

Shot in the stomach with a military bullet on 18 Dey (January 8, 2026) in Parand. Despite undergoing two surgeries and initial recovery, doctors authorized his discharge. However, suspiciously on 20 Dey his family was notified of his death. His body was not returned to the family until Wednesday. He was 30 years old, born and resident of Tehran, married for 3 years, worked as a pharmaceutical visitor, was an only child, loved football and bodybuilding, had strong perseverance and rapid progress at his company, was cheerful and full of enthusiasm and hope for life and dreams of a free Iran, loved his family and the home and car he had worked hard to acquire two months earlier, was beloved by all and full of good memories.
Originally from Khorramabad, killed in Punak Tehran by direct shooting by Islamic Republic regime terrorists during nationwide protest suppression

22-year-old basketball player for Oghab Ashour club team, studied business management, worked as pharmacy technician. Shot with direct bullet to his heart at Kaj Square near his workplace and residence during Dey month.

42-year-old protester from Sarjoub Hesar area of Karaj, shot by government forces during protests. He was an only son in a 4-person family, worked in home repair and renovation with his father. His wife is 7 months pregnant and they were expecting their first child after 14 years of marriage. He was a supporter of Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi.
Shot directly in the head by Islamic Republic of Iran's suppressive forces during violent crackdowns
Shot with a war bullet to the heart on Abr Street, from Jey Street in Isfahan

22-year-old electrical engineer shot with war bullets by IRGC and Basij forces on Palestine Street in Qazvin. He was fleeing from agents with his cousin when directly shot with war weapons. Suffered severe bleeding and died before reaching medical center due to severity of injuries.
Shot and killed with gunfire
17-year-old 12th grade student shot in the head in Heravi area of Tehran. Family appears to be afraid and intimidated by the government to claim that terrorists killed him
Shot by regime mercenaries. Worked at Behman Diesel company as packaging department supervisor. Also had skills in art and photography. Family was charged 180 million for body delivery.

Shot with war bullets in Nazarabad, Karaj. After severe injury to his side, he made it to a neighbor's house but died from excessive bleeding. His body was returned to family two days later, with regime threats to limit funeral attendance to less than ten people

Shot in the head from behind while protesting in Tehranpars with friends. Had a twin brother Amirreza, owned a Kia parts shop in Cheragh Bargh, loved music and dancing. Was rushing to Aryashahr for safety after a relative called urging him to leave when he was hit. Rushed to Tehranpars Hospital where staff tried everything but he died from the headshot. Was supposed to have his birthday the following week.
Shot directly with bullets during popular protests

Shot and killed by plainclothes forces on Aban Street in Lab-ab area of Rasht. He was fleeing from plainclothes forces who had taken control of checkpoints and were firing indiscriminately. He was separated from his companions during the escape and was ambushed by plainclothes forces on Aban Street near Haj Hossein restaurant. He was shot twice - once in the heart area from the front that exited the other side of his body, and once near the neck area that also exited the other side. The bullets were likely fired from a Kalashnikov rifle at very close range. After being killed, one of the plainclothes officers repeatedly kicked his body while saying 'Seyyed Ali sarnegoneh, are?' (referring to Supreme Leader). His body showed no reaction to the kicks. His body was then placed in the trunk of a car and taken away. His body was found a week later in Bagh-e Rezvan cemetery in Rasht along with his uncle-in-law's body.
16-year-old who was murdered by the IRGC for daring to raise his voice during the revolution. The IRGC allegedly raided his funeral.
Shot from behind by Islamic Republic snipers in front of the courthouse building

Kurdish young man from Divandarreh, resident of Tehran. Shot with live ammunition by Islamic Republic suppression forces during protests. Killed instantly. Body not returned to family and unclear if buried in Tehran. Family held limited mourning ceremony in Kani Sefid (Kani Charmu) village with only close relatives, public ceremony not permitted. Father Jalal Qahramani is a worker, family has lived in Tehran for over 30 years.
Became martyred (جاودانه شدند) in Yazdabad Falavarjan, Isfahan (known as 'Silk City')

Worked in Tehran's bazaar in the perfume and cologne trade. Shot in the head by suppressive forces during people's protests on 19 Dey 1404. Transferred to Loghman Hospital and died 24 hours later. Body was delivered to family in Kahrizak.
From Homayounshahr in Khomeini Shahr, Isfahan province. Became eternal (died) on Friday 19 Dey
Shopkeeper from Ala-al-Din Passage, directly targeted by bullets during protests on 18-19 Dey
Former member of Iran's youth national taekwondo team, shot and killed by security forces during people's protests in Marvdasht as part of the Iranian national revolution against the Islamic Republic
Shot directly by government suppression forces during protests in Haft Houz area

Initially wounded by a war bullet to his leg on Friday 19 Dey (January 9, 2026) in Fardis, Karaj. When taken to hospital, security forces shot him twice in the stomach and he died. He was his mother's only child.

Kurdish man in his twenties from Divandarreh living in Tehran, killed by live fire from regime forces during protests. His body hasn't been returned to his family, and only a small private mourning ceremony with close relatives was allowed in his village, Kani Sefid.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial
Born in 1983, killed by gunshot to the heart from suppressive forces
Killed in Hamadan on 19 Dey (January 9th). Context indicates death during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests that began December 28, 2025.
Killed in Mashhad. Family searched for a week to find his body. Family is under severe pressure but wants his name to be remembered.
University student at Tehran University of Art (2024 admission), arrested by security forces on the evening of 19 Dey. No information available about his condition since arrest.
Memorial record from Iran International, no specific circumstances provided

Shot by Islamic Republic killers and suppressors in Shahroud. Was 20 years old with only 1 month left of military service. Family was able to retrieve his body under pressure and are under security pressure.
Shopkeeper from Ala-al-Din Passage, directly targeted by bullets during protests on 18-19 Dey

50-year-old athlete, mountaineer, and fitness coach from Esfahan, devoted mother to her 19-year-old son and 25-year-old daughter, gunned down with a direct shot to the head, dying in her son's arms on Bagh-e Daryacheh Street

Shot with three direct bullets to the head, heart, and chest, then his body was stabbed with knives. Gilaki citizen from Rasht. Family was pressured to falsely claim he was a Basiji member killed by protesters, which relatives say is untrue.

Shot with a war bullet in Elahiyeh neighborhood of Kermanshah on 19 Dey. Family was severely pressured and threatened not to speak about it. No ceremonies were allowed at home or during burial. The mosque mentioned for the ceremony was filled with plainclothes security forces. Funeral announcements were immediately torn down from walls.
Killed by direct gunfire from government suppressive forces during popular protests in Isfahan

Shot in the throat in front of his house in Fooladshahr. Originally from Ramhormoz. His body remained in his mother's arms until morning when authorities took it. Authorities demanded one billion in ransom for the body and said the family must declare he was a Basiji member.

Petrochemical worker shot by government forces around 10:30 PM in the area of the city's cultural center. His body was initially seized by security forces. Family was told they would only receive the body if they claimed in an interview that their son was killed by 'thugs and riffraff'. The family refused this condition. Security forces eventually allowed burial under pressure and after obtaining written commitments, with the burial conducted by security forces without family members present. Buried in Haft Tapeh village on Monday at around 3:30 AM.

Shot with direct gunfire to the heart area on Andarzgoo Boulevard on Friday evening. Family initially thought he was arrested and searched for him for days. They were directed to Kahrizak detention center on Sunday morning where they were shown albums containing photos of the killed to identify individuals. Among the first 500 images, there was no trace of Armin which gave the family brief hope, but when the second series of images was presented, Armin's lifeless body was identified among them.
Shot with live ammunition by government forces during popular protests in Fardis. Son of Omid Teymoori Rad, killed alongside his father and uncle Amir while participating as a family in the protests.
Kurdish citizen from Divandarreh, killed during popular protests in Tehran by gunfire from Islamic Republic military-security forces
Shot with two bullets to the heart and neck by Islamic Republic suppression forces during Vavan protests. Kurdish citizen originally from Divandarreh. Had recently completed military service.
18-year-old boxer from Baharestan in Isfahan, originally from Izeh in southern Iran, worked as a hairdresser in Isfahan, killed by security forces during protests in the city
Shot with direct gunfire by suppressive forces in Banafsheh neighborhood of Karaj. He was targeted when he was separated from his friends and was alone at the location.
Died in Rasht during the protests
23-year-old photographer and videographer from Tabriz, shot directly by government suppression forces during people's protests. Her body was handed over to the family under pressure 12 days later
Shot in the forehead with a bullet during protests in Fardis, Karaj. Body was buried in Kermanshah on Monday 23 Dey 1404. His mother, sister and fiancée attended his funeral ceremony.

Shot and killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic suppressive forces on Vakil Abad Boulevard in Mashhad. His car was targeted with barrage of bullets - dozens of war bullets were fired at his vehicle. He was a 41-year-old hairdresser and father of a 14-year-old daughter. The intensity of the shooting indicated clear intent to kill. Security forces forced his family to pledge not to publicize this crime after his death.

Hairdresser and father to a 14-year-old daughter, fatally shot by Iran's repressive Islamic Republic forces on Vakil Abad Blvd. His car was riddled with dozens of bullets in a deliberate killing. He was proud of his work, especially grooming grooms, and showcased his passion on his Instagram page.

Shot in the neck with military bullets by Islamic Republic forces in the Haft-Houz area of Tehranpars. After the bullet hit Ava's neck, suppressive forces cordoned off the area with gunfire, preventing people from approaching Ava.
Mother of a 10-year-old daughter, killed by direct gunfire with two military bullets to her heart
Shot directly in the heart region by government forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran during protests in Rasht. Father of two daughters. Gilaki citizen from Rasht.

17-year-old from Neyshabur shot directly by suppression forces while fleeing. Video evidence shows she was running away after hearing gunshots and was shot from behind. She posed no threat and was not in a position of confrontation, but was simply a teenager trying to save her life.

17-year-old teenager and follower of the Baha'i faith, shot directly by Islamic Republic forces during protests in Karaj, the capital of Alborz province. Directly targeted by security forces and died from the severity of his injuries.
Killed by Islamic Republic suppression forces in the street during Friday protests in Saveh city in Markazi province (Arak)

Shot by government mercenaries in the evening of 19 Dey in Sabzevar. His body was in the street gutter for several hours. He was transferred to hospital where he died from the severity of his injuries.
Person from Noorabad Mamasani mentioned in context of protests
Lur ethnicity from Dezful, targeted and killed by suppression forces in the city
Died in Andimeshk

Shot in the throat with pellets at close range, transferred to Afshar Hospital in Yazd by civilians. Authorities contacted his mother to confirm identity but secretly transferred his body to unknown corpses section of Khaldbarin Yazd without informing family. Family found him after several days of searching. Body remained in morgue for 10 days before burial in Tariqol-Reza block of Khaldbarin Yazd.
Shot by direct fire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during protests in Rasht. Citizen of Gilan province, ethnic Gilak.

Master's degree student in criminal law in Kermanshah, severely injured and died on the evening of 19 Dey after being pursued by government forces and attacked by IRGC plainclothes forces in Elahiyeh neighborhood of Kermanshah

Known as 'Bibi Rider', 19 years old from Gonbad-e Kavus in Golestan province, killed by Islamic Republic suppression forces during protests in Gorgan. She was interested in motorcycling and was targeted during the protests. Government officials made delivery of her body conditional on declaring 'death in accident', but family and friends insist she was present at protests and was killed by Islamic Republic forces.

Kurdish citizen from Saqqez, worker and father of two children. Shot by military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Tehran on 18 Dey 1404, and died the next day in hospital due to severity of injuries.

Shot with live ammunition by government forces during popular protests in Saadat Abad area, bullet hit heart region. Child of Afghan father and Iranian mother. Was a child laborer working as mechanic apprentice.

Shot directly in the head with a bullet on Setareh Khan street in Tehran during protests. He was a 35-year-old protesting citizen, originally from Qom, who owned a food preparation shop called 'Javanan' on Shadman street in Tehran. His father was also an old restaurateur in the same neighborhood and owned the 'Javanan Eslami' restaurant. Ehsan was unmarried and had been showing solidarity and opposition to the current situation through social media posts since the beginning of the popular protests. On the last day when internet was limitedly connected, he messaged a friend saying he was going to the street to participate in protests but never returned. A close friend identified his face in a video showing bodies of victims in the street, which was captured from the mobile phone of suppressive forces and shows a disturbing scene where after the massacre, suppressors are standing over the blood-soaked bodies of freedom-seeking people, laughing and celebrating.
Died in Mohammadshahr, Karaj
Shot in the heart by Islamic Republic forces during protests in Malayer

Foundry worker from Dehnavi, Isfahan. Injured in the thigh/leg area, initially in good condition but condition suddenly deteriorated and death was announced the next morning. Described as suspicious death without clear explanation. Family was forced to pay 1.3 billion tomans for his body.
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Torbat-e Jam
Gilaki citizen and father of two children from Khoshkbijar city, killed by direct gunshot from Islamic Republic of Iran forces to the heart area
Shot by government forces during people's protests
Shot with direct gunfire by government forces during popular protests
Listed in Iran International Memorial database as a victim

Shot by Khamenei's suppressive agents near Tajrish. Originally from Bandar Abbas but living in Tehran. Security agents threatened her family in Bandar Abbas, forcing them to tell relatives that the cause of death was 'cancer disease'
Teacher and mother of an 8-year-old boy, killed by Islamic Republic suppressors with a war bullet that directly hit her heart

Mother of two children, shot directly in the chest area with bullets by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic on Qazvin Street in Tehran. Her body was returned to the family after three days under security pressures. Burial ceremony was held at night under strict security measures in Behesht Zahra Tehran to prevent public gatherings.
Shot directly by suppression forces. Ethnic Lor from Jonegan in Isfahan Province.
Shot by suppression forces. 32-year-old Lor ethnicity from Yazdanshahr, Isfahan.

Shot with live ammunition by security forces during protest gathering in front of the governor's office. After forces attacked with tear gas, sound bombs, and then opened fire from rooftops of surrounding buildings, a bullet hit her from behind and exited through her abdomen. She was fleeing with her father when shot. Despite immediate transfer to clinic, she died due to severe internal and external bleeding.

17-year-old graphic design student shot with three war bullets by Islamic Republic armed forces during Friday protests on 19 Dey 1404 in Golshahr, Karaj. She was targeted in front of her house and died in her mother's arms.
Citizen from Darkola village in Ali Abad Katol county, Golestan province. Killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during nationwide protests in Gorgan.
Father of two children. Killed by shooting by government forces
From Mobarakeh, Isfahan
Shot and killed by suppression forces. From Bakhtiari province, ethnically Lur
Died during protests in Isfahan
Shot by suppression forces. Lur ethnicity.
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Fardis, Karaj during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests
Owner of 'Amadegan' bookstore. Killed by direct shooting by government suppressive forces
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial
Hospital nurse shot and killed by regime forces during protests. Last note found in his backpack read: 'By the order of the Shah of Iran, King Reza Pahlavi.'
Shot with bullet in Felvarjan, Isfahan during protests. Described as martyr on the path to freedom during bloody Dey month.
Shot directly in the heart with a bullet on Friday 19 Dey in the city of Shahrabad-e Abrisham, Isfahan
Shot by government forces during popular protest. Worker at Mobarakeh Steel metal frame unit. Father of a 3-month-old baby.

21-year-old from Mashhad killed during bloody suppressions by the Islamic Republic regime, joined the victims on the path to freedom as one of thousands of youth who became victims of government violence and crimes with dreams of a free and humane future for Iran

Kurdish Yarsan citizen shot with a war bullet from behind by Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Elahiye neighborhood of Kermanshah. Security forces did not allow his body to be buried in Kermanshah city, and the family was forced to bury him in their family village, 'Saraylan Toh Khaki'. The burial ceremony was held on 21 Dey despite the security atmosphere, with participants chanting anti-government slogans.
Shot while returning from his shop to his home on Alavi Street in Khorramabad. He was the target of direct fire by Islamic Republic mercenaries and was killed.
Shot by government suppression forces with direct gunfire to the chest and leg during people's protests

Killed on 19th of Dey month. Body has not been returned to family despite passage of time. Security agencies have threatened the family with severe pressure to refrain from any media coverage or publicity of this crime.

Shot directly from behind in the head while helping an injured protester during nationwide protests in Rasht. Died in his son's arms. Security forces withheld his body for three days and pressured family to claim he was a Basij member before releasing the body. Buried at night without ceremony in a cemetery behind Rasht airport.
Kurdish citizen from Kermanshah, shot by military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Tehran

19-year-old from Baghmalek county, shot directly by security forces during popular protests on Naderi Street in Ahvaz. This protesting citizen was targeted by Khamenei's mercenaries' bullets and killed.

Kurdish citizen from Zarrin Abad, Dehloran county. Shot by security forces during popular protests in Isfahan. Hit by war ammunition/bullet. Body was returned to family after five days and buried on 24 Dey (January 13, 2026) in Zarrin Abad city.
Shot by security forces during anti-regime protests on Sa'idi Street in old Mashour. Son of Jamal, resident of old Mashour who had become one of the field activists during the anti-regime protests.
Listed as victim in Iran International Memorial database

Football coach killed by Islamic Republic suppression forces after being beaten with batons in an alley, then shot directly with bullets to his body. He was a well-known sports figure in Arak, and his brother is a goalkeeper for Aluminum Arak football team.
Shot from close range in the back by Basij forces. He was a welder and had a 2-year-old son. Buried in Seyyed Mohammad cemetery.
Shot with a war bullet to the head during Iran's national uprising by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic. Jabbar was a Qashqai citizen.
Worker, from Zahedan living in Meybod, Yazd. Shot in the chest by government forces with a war bullet during people's protests in the city. His body was buried in his birthplace four days later.

Shot by security forces after throwing herself in front of regime forces to protect young protesters. The 66-year-old mother and grandmother courageously tried to shield protesters from being shot, but security agents opened fire anyway and killed the unarmed woman.

Shot with war bullet to chest from above police station in Tehran's neighborhood number two (Khalij Fars). Tailor and cheerful artist who always had a smile and was full of positive energy. From Ajin, Hamedan province. Family was forced to give commitment not to speak about his death.

39-year-old filmmaker, assistant director, and native of Hamedan, shot dead by Islamic Republic security forces on the streets of Tehran. Mr. Ganji was a respected behind-the-scenes professional in cinema and television, well known among directing and production teams with years of experience working on numerous films and TV projects.

Shot in the head with a military bullet by Khamenei's mercenaries in Fardis city. His lifeless body was returned by two friends who were with him, given to his family, and buried at night in one of the villages near Arak without a death certificate.
16-year-old killed in Baharestan, Eslamshahr on 19 Dey month. Described as being killed by Khamenei's child-killing regime and became a heroic youth of Iran.
University professor from Masjed Soleyman, shot by suppression forces in Haft Hoz area of Tehran
Body was missing for 4 days before being found. Mother searched for his body for 4 days and was not allowed to place his photo at his grave

Newlywed who was killed only one week after her wedding by direct shooting from Khamenei's agents. Security forces delivered her body to the family 10 days after the killing, only after receiving money and a written commitment not to hold public funeral ceremonies. According to the burial permit issued by the Sari forensic medicine office, cause of death was 'rupture of abdominal organs and fracture of lumbar spine' due to 'impact of hard high-speed projectile', clearly referring to being shot with war bullets by government agents.

Barber killed during protests on Friday 19 Dey 1404. Shot by suppression forces while operating his small barbershop in Bagh-Feyz neighborhood of Islamshahr. Was passionate about rap music and had posted a rap video on Instagram on 13 Dey expressing the pain of his generation. Buried in section 79 of Behesht Zahra cemetery.

Shot directly by Iranian Islamic Republic government forces in Jamaran neighborhood of Rasht, near a Basij base. The bullet hit his head and the incident occurred in front of his brother's eyes. He was a Gilaki citizen from Rasht.
Described as 'child of Iran and killed in the path of homeland'

Shot directly by government security forces with a war bullet hitting the back of his head during popular protests on Saheb al-Zaman road in Shushtar, near a motorcycle manufacturing unit. Lur ethnicity, from Shushtar city in Khuzestan province. Buried on Tuesday 23 Dey 1404 in Shushtar cemetery.

Two-time bodybuilding champion and coach shot and killed at a protest. Had posted on Instagram hours before his death: 'I just want my rights. A voice that has been silenced in me for over 40 years must scream. You took away our youth, hopes, dreams... I am here so that tomorrow I won't look at myself in the mirror and say that I had no vein, no honour ... I will pay anything for it.' Managed two charity organizations.

Shot and killed with three bullets during protests in front of the Shahroud governor's office. Security forces fired war bullets from the top of the governor's building at the crowd. He had not been outside on January 8th and was unaware of how chaotic things had become, but went out to the street on January 9th.

Shot with war bullets during the second night of the January 19th call for protests in Shahreza, Isfahan Province. Killed in the presence of his 15-year-old daughter. Father of 2 children. Family was not allowed to hold a funeral ceremony.

Shot with three live bullets by regime's repressive forces during protests in Yazdanshahr. He was a hardware tools shopkeeper who lived in northern regions of Iran and had traveled to Isfahan to visit his mother when he was targeted and killed during the protests.

CrossFit athlete and construction worker who was attacked in Marzdaran area of Tehran. First beaten and injured, then killed with a shotgun. Married with a child under one year old. Body has not been returned to family due to communication cuts and access restrictions.
Shot directly by government forces during popular protests in the Maskan neighborhood of Kermanshah. Kurdish citizen and resident of Kermanshah.

Mother of three children from Isfahan, died during popular protests on Nazar Sharghi Street in the city after sustaining multiple baton blows from government suppression forces. Her body was buried on Sunday 21 Dey 1404 without any ceremony and under security measures at Bagh Rezvan Cemetery in Isfahan.

Shot and killed at the Qazi intersection in Dezful while he was with his family. According to an informed source, they first shot his leg and then security forces went over him and shot him in the heart.
Shot and killed by the Islamic regime in Tehran

Baloch female student of biomedical engineering at Azad University of Kerman, daughter of Hossein, from Anbarabad county. Shot in the back by suppressive forces while participating in protests on Bahmanyar Street in Kerman. Died from severity of wounds. Body returned to family on Saturday 20 Dey 1404 from Kerman forensic medicine after family was threatened to remain silent and forced to sign commitment. Buried in her birthplace Anbarabad around 19:30 the same day under security restrictions without public announcement.
Shot by suppression forces in Dezful. Lur ethnicity. Body was buried in Adalat neighborhood of the same city.
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Pardis during the protests
Shot by direct fire from government suppressive forces during people's protests in Baharestan

Shot by bullet to the forehead during protests. He was the breadwinner of his family and worked as a cabinet installer. His father suffered from severe Alzheimer's and his brother had passed away due to cancer.
Killed during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests in Mashhad
Shot directly in the stomach by Islamic Republic terrorists in Sadeghiyeh, Tehran

Shot in the chest with a Kalashnikov rifle during suppression of protests in Charmahin city. Protesters had gathered in the city square, burned the Islamic Republic flag, and moved toward the Basij base. When they approached the entrance, suppressive forces stationed inside opened fire directly at the crowd with Kalashnikov weapons. Four known suppressors fired: Rahim Hedayati, Alamdar Jafari, Shirzad Mehdipour, and Sirus Pirkhili. Colonel Alamdar Jafari of the IRGC was identified as the one who fired the fatal shot. Mehdi had completed his military service just two months before this incident.

26-year-old tattoo artist and footballer from Babol, killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic forces during protests. Friends described him as gentle, artistic, and full of life who had quiet hope saying 'I know life will be good after 26'
Died on January 9, 2026 in Ariashahr, Tehran
From Gonbad-e Kavous, wounded by pellets on the first day but returned the next day, then shot in the heart and killed in Gohardasht

Shot in the head from behind with a war bullet by a plainclothes operative with a belt pistol while he was going to help an injured person on Ithar Street, Baharestan, Isfahan. His family found his body after one week.
Shot by security forces on Qazi Street in Dezful. Lur ethnicity.
Father of 3 children, worked as a shoemaker, loved singing and was often heard singing in his shop. Shot 3 times in the chest according to his wife.
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Saman, Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari province. Born in 1368 Persian calendar (1989 Gregorian).
Father of a young child, killed by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic
47-year-old protester and monarchist in Tehran, shot in the neck with pellet gun by Islamic Republic suppressive forces in Tehranpars neighborhood on Friday
Killed by Islamic Republic suppression forces in the street during Friday protests in Saveh city in Markazi province (Arak)

Shot with war bullets during protests in Isfahan. Family originally from Kerman, residing in Isfahan. Body was returned to family after six days with commitment for 'silent burial'. He was buried on Thursday, 25 Dey 1404.
Young freedom-seeking individual from Arak killed by Khamenei's criminal regime
Shot from behind with war bullets during street protests in Gohardasht, Karaj. Originally from Kangavar in Kermanshah province.

Gilan citizen from Rasht (Pirbazar neighborhood), shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during popular protests in Moalem Street near the governorate building. Family has been under severe pressure from security institutions after his death, not allowed to hold public mourning ceremonies, and no photos of him have been published. According to relatives, he was only three months away from his wedding ceremony.
Victim memorialized by Iran International
37-year-old chef from Gorgan who worked in hotels and restaurants. Father of a 5-year-old daughter. Died in Gorgan.
Killed during protests. Family had to pay $4000 'bullet fee' to authorities to retrieve his body after 8 days. Buried in Jalalvand Area, Kurdistan Region

Shot by security forces while trying to rescue his wounded cousin during protests. Despite warnings from agents not to approach, he continued trying to help his cousin who had been shot. After being shot, he attempted to reach his home despite severe injuries but collapsed in the courtyard. Security forces then removed his body from the scene. He was a worker at a company located on Karaj Special Road.
Shot dead by Iranian regime forces in Rasht city during protests in Gilan Province
Shot by suppression forces in Saadat Abad Tehran. Born in 1379, Lur ethnicity from Dorud, Lorestan

Gilak citizen from Sangar, athlete, footballer and goalkeeper trainer. Shot on Motahari Street in Rasht during nationwide protests by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran. After being shot, people and friends moved his body about 200-300 meters to Hajiabad Street area and placed him inside his personal car. To avoid sensitivity from security forces, those present contacted Milad's brother saying he was injured and had a headache, asking him to come take Milad home. The brother came with his wife and young child, unaware of the severity of the injury, but upon opening the car door found it soaked in blood.
Shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic agents during Iran's national revolution. He was a monarchist resident of Marzdaran Boulevard in Tehran.
Shot directly by Islamic Republic regime terrorists during nationwide protest suppression

Father of one child, from Marvdasht, resident of Tehran. Shot by government suppression forces during protests and killed after being transferred to detention center. Buried in his hometown 7 days later.
Kurdish citizen from Ilam, killed by being shot in the neck with a war bullet by Islamic Republic forces. Family was forced to pay 600 million tomans in cash as 'bullet money' to receive his body
Motorcycle delivery driver and father of two children, killed by direct gunshot to the head during popular protests in Falah district of Tehran

17-year-old protester shot directly in the head by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic. After his death, security agencies demanded heavy payments from his family including 50 million tomans for bullet costs, 20 million tomans for burial permit, and 200 million tomans for a six-level grave (initially up to 800 million tomans was mentioned). Family was threatened with burial in a remote cemetery due to their son being a protester. During burial, extensive presence of security agents was reported with severe restrictions on family and attendees. Agents prevented memorial services and any gatherings, and obtained written commitment from family not to hold any ceremonies.
Killed by government suppression forces during popular protests
Gilaki citizen from Babol, shot directly by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran during nationwide protests in the city

Killed by heavy machine-gun fire while standing with other innocent people, shielding behind a wall. His last words were 'I'll go so the next generation can feel freedom.' His family discovered more than 1,400 bodies in the same morgue from that night alone.

Shot with bullets while traveling by motorcycle with his close friend Mehrshad Ragbar. A traditional 'Hojleh' ceremony was held for him according to southern coastal customs, a ritual typically performed for young people who lose their lives in their prime.
Shot in the side while trying to flee. His body remained in his father's car overnight until authorities determined what to do with it.
Shot with war bullet to his eye
Killed by Islamic special suppressive forces after being shot with live ammunition. His family was forced to pay a 'bullet fee' to retrieve his body and hold his burial ceremony.
Shot dead by regime forces. Authorities held his body and banned his family from burial ceremony, from crying, or from mourning. On the day of burial, family was expelled from the cemetery.
Killed by regime agents during nationwide protests against catastrophic economic conditions and widespread repression in Hasar neighborhood, Karaj
Teacher, shot by suppression forces
Shot directly in the head by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government. He was a 23-year-old Gilaki citizen from Lahijan residing in Fardis.
Shot directly by suppression forces in Masjed Soleyman

67-year-old retired Air Force Colonel and war veteran from the Iran-Iraq war. Shot with two bullets during protests in Kaj Square, Saadat Abad neighborhood of Tehran on Friday evening. His body was found in front of a clinic with emergency medical equipment, including angiocath, attached to his body.

Student at Shahrood University of Technology, known as 'Mahan Mardani', master's degree student in industrial management, fitness trainer with coaching certificate, and goalkeeper of university futsal team with runner-up achievements. Shot with direct fire near his home around 21:30. Hit by two bullets in femoral artery of his leg causing severe bleeding. Despite injuries, dragged himself to his house door but collapsed upon arrival. Witnesses described the bleeding as so severe 'it was as if they had poured red paint on the street pavement'. Died around 23:00 the same night due to severe injuries and blood loss. Body was buried on January 12, 2026 after family pressure and follow-up.
Shot by suppression forces in Isfahan
Killed by mercenaries of the Islamic Republic in Khorramabad, Lorestan province
Shot directly with bullets by government forces during popular protests
Lor child from Isfahan, killed by direct gunfire from suppression forces

Shot by regime mercenaries during December protests in Tehran. Originally from Romeshkan, Lorestan province. Had lost his father and was working as a shop apprentice in Tehran to financially support his family (mother and two sisters aged 15 and 17)

Provincial and national champion bodybuilder. Shot with a war bullet in his leg on Emammat Boulevard in Mashhad on 19 Dey. Family received the body on Sunday with bruising around the neck, cause of death listed as suffocation with plastic. Has two daughters.

Shot by government forces in Golshahr, Karaj. He was a mobile phone shop owner from Gomrok neighborhood in Tehran who had moved to Karaj and worked as a taxi driver due to economic pressure. He had a 17-year-old daughter and a younger brother named Mohsen.

Shot in the stomach with a bullet on 18 Dey near Rasht municipality. Transferred to Arya Hospital where family was told he was bandaged and would be released, but on Friday he suffered bleeding. The bullet had not been removed and due to infection he died on 21 Dey. The medical examiner said 'no operation was performed at all and they were not allowed to operate'
16-year-old killed by Islamic Republic forces in Khorramabad on Naser Khosrow street
Killed in Khorramabad at age 16 by regime forces. The tweet emphasizes his youth and innocence, describing him as a child and calling for his name to be eternally remembered.
Shot directly by government forces during protests in Mashhad, targeted at close range with military-grade weapons
16-year-old Kurdish boy from Salmas, shot directly by government security forces during Tehran protests. Body was transferred to Qom and had not yet been returned to family.
Son, killed with war bullet in chest at 7 o'clock on Friday in Fardis Karaj alongside his 49-year-old father Behzad
63-year-old male from Isfahan documented in Iran International Memorial

Shot directly by IRGC forces' bullets in Abgarm city, Qazvin province. His body was handed over to his family only after three days under severe security pressure. He was married and had a 3-year-old daughter. Despite having a master's degree in physical education, he worked as a driver to support his family.
Shot with live ammunition in Maskan neighborhood of Kermanshah. He was a car bodywork mechanic. The bullet reportedly hit his leg and he died from severe bleeding.

Shot in the heart by bullets from Islamic Republic mercenaries. Was the breadwinner for his family. At his burial in Garmab village, according to his will, freedom slogans were chanted instead of holding religious ceremonies.
Father of two children, killed by the Islamic regime in Malayer
Fatally shot with pellet ammunition by Iranian regime guards
Died on January 9, 2026 in Mashhad during the protests
Father of two children, from Mashhad, killed by direct gunshot to the head by government forces during popular protests
Documented in Iran International Memorial database as a victim
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Kerman during the protests
Shot in the stomach with a bullet in the small city of Chamgardan, Isfahan province. Father of two children and employee of the Zobahan steel factory.

54-year-old protesting citizen from Fardis Karaj and originally from Malayer, shot from behind during protests, bullet hit his lung. The shooting occurred in front of his family. He was taken to a clinic but was refused treatment. He died in the car from the severity of his injuries while his head was on his wife's lap and his daughter was sitting in the front seat. After three days, his family was given permission to bury him and his body was buried in Behesht-e Zahra cemetery in Tehran.

Mechanical engineering student at Yazd University (admitted 2022), ranked 2nd in the mechanical engineering faculty, was among the top students eligible for direct admission to graduate school without entrance exam. Shot directly by suppression forces during the Iranian national revolution.
Shot by direct fire from state forces during protests in Sabzevar, targeted at close range with military-grade weapons
Shot directly by government forces during popular protests in Andisheh New Town Phase 3
Shot on Friday night January 9th in Mashhad. Family found his body after 4 days and had to pay 800 million to receive it

Father of two children, retired worker from Hormozgan Steel Industries, originally from Khorramshahr and resident of Isfahan. Disappeared on the evening of January 8, 2026 during protests in Fooladshahr Isfahan. Family searched for him for a week with no official response. Body identified at morgue on January 14, 2026 with severe head trauma and swelling that made identification difficult. Severe injuries indicate extreme violence. Body was hastily buried the next morning by order of authorities with no funeral or mourning ceremonies allowed.

Shot with direct gunfire to the heart by Islamic Republic of Iran Basij forces in Chitgar area of Tehran. Gilaki citizen from Nasafi village in Rudbar, living in Tehran. Body was buried in his birthplace, Nasafi village in Rudbar

Shot directly by government forces during popular protests in Isfahan. He was a hardworking hairdresser on Mofteh Street in Isfahan, known for his kindness, compassion, and family devotion. Father of two daughters who devoted his entire life to the peace and happiness of his family. Friends and acquaintances remember him as a calm, kind, and supportive person.
Shot directly by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during nationwide protests. Gilaki citizen from Rasht.

13-year-old Kurdish girl shot by Iranian government agents from approximately 5 meters distance while present in a park in Basij township, Keyhanshar boulevard, Kermanshah. She was a teenage champion in Wushu martial arts in Iran. Her mother had died three years earlier and she had no father, living with her aunt. Her body was buried on 21 Dey in Bagh Ferdows cemetery in Kermanshah.

16-year-old student from Bushehr who had a passion for ancient Iranian sports. Shot and killed by Islamic Republic regime forces near the Quran Mosque in Bushehr. He aspired to be a pahlevan (champion).

Also known as Mohammadamin Parsa, former student of the University of Bologna and Italian-language instructor on YouTube channel Nebia Academy, killed by live ammunition fired by government forces during protests near Vanak Square, had been publishing educational content free of charge on YouTube
Shot with war bullets by security forces in Baharestan, Isfahan. From Izeh, member of Kourkour tribe. Body was buried on January 10, 2026 at 5 AM in Ardal county, Dinaran village.
Student from Andimeshk, killed during popular protests in Parand city
16-year-old second-year student of Interior Architecture, shot and killed by security forces of Iran's Islamic regime
Shot by military-caliber bullet in front of his mother
Killed by motorbike unit suppressors during protests in the Khaneh Esfahan district of Isfahan. Shot with live ammunition.

Shot by sniper while present with his cousin. Father of a 3-year-old child. Body was returned to family after 10 days. Death certificate stated cause of death as 'impact with hard object and damage to kidney and spleen' with death date recorded as 20 Dey, while family and informed sources state he died on 19 Dey

Shot by security forces with Kalashnikov rifle during nationwide protests. Bullet hit the right side of his abdomen, causing his death. Worked as a hairdresser in Shahsavar. Was engaged but not yet married.

Shot by government sniper positioned on roof of Bank Melli Iran at Abshar intersection in Isfahan on Friday the 19th at 6 PM. Bullet hit his shoulder. He was taken to Sadoughi Hospital Isfahan under IRGC supervision where he was alive for one week but family was not allowed to see him. After one week of family pursuing, they were told to go to Bagh-e Razvan cemetery. When family reached his body, they found he had been killed by an execution bullet to the chest while his shoulder was bandaged from the initial wound. This constitutes execution of wounded in hospital, a crime against humanity.
Shot in the head with live ammunition by mercenaries of the Islamic Republic in the city of Lapouei, Fars Province, southern Iran
Shot by direct fire from security forces in Memsani
Killed by direct shooting by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government
Friend mentioned he always dreamed of becoming famous and appearing on television. Friend asked if his photo could be shown on Iran International so he could become famous at least after his death
Shot directly by suppression forces in Yazdanshahr, Isfahan. Kurdish ethnicity indicated by surname 'Lor'
20-year-old from Yasouj, killed by the Islamic Republic in Sar-e Abtaveh

Father of two children (16-year-old son and 8-year-old daughter), owned a shop in Arak. Shot directly with a war bullet by Islamic Republic forces in front of Vali-e Asr Hospital in Arak around 8:15 PM on Friday. The bullet hit his abdomen area and caused his death. Evidence of the bullet impact was clearly visible on his jacket - holes and burns from the war bullet remained on his clothes, indicating direct shooting from close range or with high power. After his killing, his family was pressured and threatened to confirm the government's official narrative about his death, with threats that his children would be deprived of continuing their education if they opposed or told the real story. Despite being from Arak, his body was not allowed to be buried in the city's cemetery. His burial ceremony was held three days later on Tuesday in Qaniaro village near Arak under special conditions and restrictions.
Originally from Shah-pasand but killed in Gorgan. Was wounded on the first night, but still went out the second night and was shot in the heart.
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Andarzgoo, Tehran
Died in Saveh during the protests
Killed during protests in Qir and Karzin county, Fars province. Described as a young protester.
Killed on 19 Dey in Isfahan. Was buried without notifying his family, who were informed later. Described as full of life and a nature lover.
Shot directly in the chest with a war bullet by suppressive forces in Shahrekord

39-year-old Kurdish citizen from Haji Abad village in Tuyserkan, Hamedan province, resident of Shahriar Tehran, killed during popular protests by direct shooting from government forces, with a war bullet hitting his neck area. He was the father of a young child.

Applied Mathematics student at Imam Khomeini International University of Qazvin, killed by regime suppression forces on the night of 19 Dey month. The regime is trying to present her as a victim of terrorist attacks and has put pressure on her family, while according to close ones Safoura was killed during the protests.

Book author and mechanical engineering graduate killed during violent arrest by Islamic Republic agents. Was returning from work to home when security agents arrested her on charges of 'participating in protests'. She resisted the arrest and agents severely beat her with multiple blows to the head area with batons, which ultimately led to her death. Family was pressured by security institutions to declare cause of death as 'suicide', but death certificate records cause of death as 'impact of hard object to head'.

Shot with shotgun that destroyed her face. Family wrote on her obituary that she became a gift to the homeland. Her mother's regret was that she could not kiss her face one last time because the shotgun had destroyed her beautiful face completely. One of her relatives said at her grave that she had many dreams and asked that she not be forgotten.

23-year-old women's football assistant referee, shot directly by suppressive forces during nationwide protests against the Islamic Republic in Isfahan. She was also active in track and field and physical fitness in addition to football. Her body was buried on Thursday 25 Dey.
Shot by direct fire from state forces during protests in Sabzevar, targeted at close range with military-grade weapons

Shot by government forces during protests. Government agents fired from the top of a bank building opposite the 'Chahar Baradaran' mosque on Motahari Street in Rasht. A bullet hit his leg, and he died at the hospital due to severe injuries and bleeding before receiving effective medical care. He was a Gilaki citizen of Rasht, 41 years old, father of a 16-year-old daughter, and worked as a worker in a supermarket. His family was pressured to sign documents and commitments to receive his body, and a public ceremony for him was prevented.

Shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic forces during anti-government protests in Marvdasht city, Fars province on the evening of 19 Dey. After being wounded, he did not go to the hospital in time due to fear of security forces and died from severe bleeding. He was a teacher. His father was an elder of the tribe and a well-known figure in Marvdasht. Security agencies agreed to hand over his body to the family on the condition that the burial ceremony would be with limited attendance and that the family would declare he was killed by 'terrorists' rather than government forces. The family agreed to the limited ceremony but refused to lie about their son's killers. Security forces prevented his mother from being present at the grave during burial, forcing her to watch from a distance.
Killed during nationwide protests in Rasht. He was a Gilaki citizen from Khasmakh village in Fouman suburbs

Shot by Islamic Republic suppressors on Navab Street in Tehran. After her killing, security institutions demanded 500 million tomans from her family to release her body and forced the family to sign a written commitment to declare the cause of death as 'accident' and refrain from any media coverage, interviews, or independent follow-up.

12-year-old Kurdish Yarsan student from Kermanshah, living in Hashtgerd. Shot with two war bullets to the back and back of the neck by Islamic Republic suppression forces using a Kalashnikov rifle. Killed instantly around 9 PM on Friday evening in the street opposite an intelligence center, in front of the governorate building on Ayatollah Khamenei Boulevard. Security forces had suddenly turned off street lights and launched a widespread attack on protesters when she was shot from behind.

Killed by Islamic Republic suppression forces while protesting. Died from being hit by a war bullet. Was a mountaineer who had climbed high peaks including Kamal peak (3700m) in Sahand region of East Azerbaijan province and Shah Moalem peak (3050m) in Gilan province.

Killed by Islamic Republic suppressors. Graphic design graduate who worked as a freelancer, described as kind, calm and beloved among friends. Had participated in most protest gatherings in Isfahan from early Dey month. Last seen participating in demonstrations on 18 Dey. Body was buried at 6 AM in Bagh-e Rezvan cemetery in Isfahan without public announcement and under strict security measures with security agents present. Mother was reportedly threatened by security forces and prohibited from making this case public.

19-year-old wrestler and resident of Shohada neighborhood in Andimeshk. Shot directly by suppression forces on Partou Street during popular protests. Was targeted by sniper fire from a rooftop. The shooting was direct and without warning, with no possibility of providing medical assistance. His body was buried at 4 AM three days after his death in the presence of his parents, without a funeral ceremony and under government surveillance. His family remains under pressure and threats to refrain from informing media about their son's killing. Known as a local athlete in Andimeshk.

Shot with direct gunfire during popular protests. According to eyewitnesses, two bullets hit him and he died on the spot. He was an unarmed protester participating in popular protests against the Islamic Republic. His body was retrieved by his family from Kahrizak on Saturday morning and buried in Lavasan next to his grandmother's grave. He was a barista working in a cafe, lived in Phase 1 of Shahrak-e Gharb. He died on the same night the Saadat-Abad mosque was set on fire. Before attending the protests, he told one of his friends: 'Either everything changes, or I die.'
Two-time national powerlifting champion from Izeh, shot in the chest by government forces during a protest in Baharestan Isfahan. Mohsen Rashidi was killed while trying to help him.
51 years old, father of three children, resident of Shiraz, killed by direct gunfire from government suppression forces during people's protests

Shot with two bullets to the neck and one bullet to the pelvis. While still alive, was thrown among corpses and died 18 hours later. Family was forced to pay 150 million (currency not specified) to receive the body after three days
Killed by the regime. Was a simple motorcycle courier. His father is a war veteran and his elderly mother pleaded not to let her son be forgotten.

Killed during street protests in Eram Boulevard, Mehrshahr, Karaj at around 22:30. According to witnesses, he was encouraging others by shouting 'If we don't stay, who will?' and motivating others to stay and not be afraid. He was among the protesters who remained in the streets despite the dangers.

Shot with live ammunition from behind while being pursued by Islamic Republic agents, killed when she had reached the parking area of her residence. She was interested in acting and pursued this interest seriously.
17-year-old killed in Rudbar

Shot directly in the head by security forces during protests in Yazdanshahr on Motahari Boulevard. Was transferred to Fateme Zahra Hospital in Yazdanshahr the same night and died there. Security forces only returned his bloodied clothes to his family and told them to go to Bagh Rezvan cemetery in Isfahan to collect his body. Family had to wait 5 days before the body was returned to them. He was described as an extremely kind and lovable young man who had returned from military service less than a year ago. He worked as an apprentice in car color identification, working from 5 AM to 5 PM. He was raised by his mother along with his two sisters under difficult circumstances.
Shot by suppression forces in Yazdanshahr

Shot and killed by Islamic Republic security forces during popular uprising. Was trapped in an alley with other protesters, surrounded from both sides by government forces who opened fire. A bullet struck his heart and lungs, and he lay on the ground for about half an hour before losing his life. Was an 18-year-old student set to begin studies in mechanical engineering, from a financially well-off family. His presence at protests was driven by awareness and solidarity rather than economic pressure. Two of his uncles were killed in the Iran-Iraq war, one was a well-known commander. The Golgoon family is among well-known families of the city, and a boulevard in Shahsavar is named 'Golgoon Martyrs'.

English language teacher and translator, shot directly from behind by Islamic Republic suppression forces in Rabat-e Sevom area of Malekshahr, Isfahan. Family found his body after five days of searching and he was buried in Bagh-e Rezvan Cemetery in Isfahan.
18-year-old student killed by special units of the Islamic Republic suppressive forces during protests. Sourena was a piano player and had a deep love for karting.

Uncle-in-law (shohar-khaleh) of Alireza Sahebdel, killed on Zarjoub bridge in Lab-ab area of Rasht on the same night. According to witnesses, he was first beaten unconscious with severe baton strikes, then shot in the back and killed. Two other people who tried to rescue him were also killed by plainclothes forces at the same location. His body was found a week later in Bagh-e Rezvan cemetery in Rasht along with Alireza's body.
Kurdish citizen from Dehgolan arrested by security forces and held without access to lawyer or family visits. Status unknown after two weeks of detention.
Shot with military bullet to the heart by IRGC forces during popular protests. Married father of two children. Shot at close range, bullet hit from behind and struck his heart area.
Killed in Saadat Shahr. Family is under pressure and no photos or names have been released about him.
Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppression forces in South Mehrabad, Tehran. He had about five years of experience in wrestling.

Shot by security forces in Tehran's 17 Shahrivar neighborhood of Shadabad. Shot first and left wounded on the ground, then agents approached and fired a final bullet straight into his heart. Was a professional bodybuilder. Authorities pressured family to declare him as Basij forces member before releasing body.

Killed along with her husband and child when Islamic Republic forces opened fire on their car during a peaceful protest in Karaj. She was a retired employee of the Social Security Organization from Karaj, originally from Sonqor. Their eldest son Davood survived despite being shot. Bodies were transferred to Sonqor and buried before 6 AM under heightened security.
Shot in the chest by armed motorbike units of suppressive forces during protests. Family had to pay a $4,500 'bullet fee' to receive her body. Buried on January 16, 2026.

Shot and killed in front of her 8-year-old daughter on the evening of 19 Dey. She had been sentenced to 1.5 years in prison in 2022 and recently received another 1-year sentence, awaiting appeal court.

Had MS and walked with a cane. At a protest in Bushehr, she couldn't run when security forces opened fire. Shot in the side, then killed with a bullet to the heart. Unable to flee due to her disability.
Official trainer of the federation, killed with a war bullet on 18 Dey
Driver, killed by direct gunshot to the heart

Shot in the leg with a war bullet, then arrested by forces who transferred him to a corner of a park adjacent to the street among trees where he was beaten with multiple baton strikes and ultimately died from the severity of his injuries. Known as 'Son of the Sea' among locals, he was a football coach who worked for years to develop football in the region.
Graduate student in IT field, killed by pellet shot and multiple stab wounds by suppressive forces

Mountaineer athlete and conqueror of several high peaks in Iran and Persepolis football team fan. Shot by security forces' war bullets on Thursday evening 18 Dey 1404 in Tehran. Initially told to family he was wounded and hospitalized, but family was later informed he had died. Authorities prevented delivery of his body to the family. His body was buried after three days.

38-year-old Gilaki citizen from Lafmajan village in Lahijan county, killed by Iranian regime forces during protests in the Seygalan Square area of Rasht. Family was under severe security pressure after his death and the body delivery process involved coercion, requiring written guarantees from the family. Body was delivered alongside several other victims. Eyewitnesses reported severe, multiple and unusual injuries on his body that were so extensive that determining the exact location of the fatal injury was not clearly possible. No official or transparent explanation has been provided by responsible institutions about how he was injured and died.
Kurdish Kurmanji youth from Esfarayen, North Khorasan province, under 25 years old. Shot directly with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests.
47-year-old worker, father's name Mir Ali, company worker/supervisor of two children and elderly mother, died during the early hours of the call on the eighteenth (18 Dey)

Father of two children, Ali and Roksana. Killed in Fardis. His daughter Roksana has not cried for her father in the 21 days since his death, believing that crying would diminish her anger toward Khamenei, the killer.

17-year-old from Sari city who was killed during popular protests around 10:30 PM in one of the city's streets by direct shooting from government forces with war bullets. His body was returned to his family after one week. He was only a few weeks away from turning 18.
Killed on Thursday night. According to locals, they were peaceful youth. His face was severely damaged.

19-year-old student from the Bakhtiari tribe, specifically from Dorki clan, Zarasound sub-tribe. Shot by government forces in Isfahan. Family kept his body on ice overnight fearing it would be taken by authorities. Buried in Dorak Shapouri village (Anari) in Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari province on January 10, 2026. Funeral held at 5 AM under heavy security presence with widespread government agents present.
Shot directly with a war bullet to the head during Dey month protests. The shooter was identified as Senior Sergeant Mostafa Amini, known as one of the recognized suppressors in Bijar city.

18-year-old Kurdish youth from Bijar, killed by direct shooting from government suppression forces during protests. His father was a street sweeper for the municipal office and was forced by government institutions to introduce his son as a Basij member.
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime during protests while completing mandatory military service. Originally from Jamalabad village in Shazand.
17-year-old killed by direct gunfire from security forces during protests in the small city of Qir near Kazerun. A memorial service was held for him where traditional surna music was played.
16-year-old youth from Qashqai tribe, shot directly by IRGC forces during widespread protests in Qir city

Taekwondo athlete and 2nd dan black belt holder, shot directly by suppression forces during protests at Mesbah intersection in Karaj. Had previously lost both parents and only had one sister. Was transferred home by friends after being hit by the bullet but ultimately died for his homeland.
Computer engineer and bodybuilder. First hit in the leg by pellet shots, then snipers positioned on nearby buildings shot him in the head and killed him. Also known as Masih.
Official bodybuilding federation trainer who was killed during the protests. His mother insisted that his name and photo be shared, wanting revenge and retribution rather than mourning.
Shot with two war bullets. He was a mechanic student and breadwinner for his family, from Seyedi neighborhood in Mashhad
Child killed by regime forces. Described as being from Sabzevar and killed by the child-killers/mercenaries of Seyyed Ali (referring to Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei).
Shot and killed on 18 Dey in Sari. Described as a hero and brave person (دلاور) who was 22 years old.
Died in Tehran during the protests
Professional bodybuilder/athlete from Jarquyeh, Isfahan. Shot in the back of the head by regime suppression forces (Basij and IRGC)
13-year-old killed by Khamenei's agents in Nazi-abad Tehran. His family found his lifeless body three days later at the forensic medicine warehouse in Kahrizak, Tehran

Kurdish citizen from Javanrud arrested by Ministry of Intelligence forces at his family home. Being held in Kermanshah Intelligence Department detention center without family visitation rights or access to lawyer.

Gilaki citizen from Chalus, shot by Islamic Republic of Iran's suppressive forces during people's protests in Chalus. After being shot and falling to the ground, regime forces prevented citizens from approaching to help and rescue her body by shooting, and anyone who attempted to provide aid was targeted. Several others were killed in this crime. Her lifeless body was left in the middle of the street.
Shot and killed, and anyone who tried to help her was also shot. She was a mother.

Final year architecture student at Ferdis University in Karaj. Shot in the neck by Islamic Republic mercenaries during events on 18 Dey. Was interested in mountaineering and was the only child of his family. Born on 1st Bahman

Taekwondo champion and sports coach, father of twin sons named Arman and Armin. Shot three times while participating in peaceful protest march with his family near a local police station. First shot to kidney, continued helping others despite injury, then shot twice more from behind and killed on the spot.
Killed during protests in Chamgardan, Isfahan. Perpetrators identified as Hassan Karimian (head of Basij) and Sheikh Hamid Gholami
44-year-old from Sabzevar in Khorasan Razavi province, resident of Tehran, killed by direct shooting from government suppression forces during popular protests in Mashirieh area

Shot on Piroozi Street. After being shot, he made it to an alley and gave his phone to someone, asking them to call the last person on his contact list. He died before his family could reach Piroozi Street. Due to security conditions and lack of ambulances around Piroozi Street, Ahmad Abbasi's mother held her son's body in the alley from night until morning to prevent security forces from taking it. His body was eventually transferred to Kahrizak Legal Medicine facility where plainclothes forces kidnapped the body. Authorities are demanding one billion tomans as 'bullet fee' to return the body to the family.
Architect who was shot from behind with a bullet to the chest during protests. Killed by Islamic Republic security forces with motorcycle units during the Thursday night protests of 18 Dey 1404.
Died in Karaj on 18 Dey 1404
Monarchist supporter, shot with direct fire by IRGC in Nimvar city, Markazi Province during protests on 18 Dey
Shot directly by government suppressive forces during people's protests

Shot in the neck by Khamenei's forces and killed on the spot in Shahriar. A family transported him by car to Nour Hospital. His body was found in a room in the emergency department when his family arrived, then taken to the morgue and later to Kahrizak. Born in Asadabad.

Basketball player and student at Sharif University of Technology, shot and killed by direct fire from Islamic Republic security forces while out on the street during nationwide uprising. He was a member of the Farzan Shemiran 3x3 basketball team which won the Tehran championship earlier that year, and was named Best Player of the Tehran Adult League in the same year.

Born in Mashhad, had two children (one son and one daughter). Owned a gym and was a bodybuilder and athlete with national championship titles in bodybuilding. Was so large he didn't fit in his coffin during burial. Was first shot in the leg with a war bullet, fell down, then tried to lean against a wall with his injured leg to stand up and escape. While he was trying to flee, suppression forces on motorcycles shot him in the head with a war bullet, killing him. Family was not allowed to bury him in Mashhad and had to bury him in a village. Family was also not permitted to hold memorial ceremonies.

Shot by Islamic Republic security forces on Daneshjo Boulevard in Gonbad Kavous with direct gunshot to spleen and thigh. Father Hossein Shah Ali, a veteran theater actor, was forced to sign documents stating his son was killed by terrorists in order to receive the body. Burial took place under security forces presence and they were not even allowed to print obituary notices. Ahmad was a professional bodybuilder and cafe owner whose business was also sealed.
University student (2020 entry cohort) studying manufacturing engineering at Noshirvani University of Technology in Babol, killed during Thursday night protests on 18 Dey

21-year-old medical student at Tehran University of Medical Sciences who was killed on the 18th (18 Dey). Her body was not allowed to be buried for nearly five days, and when finally permitted, it was done at night with only her parents present. Her parents were under heavy security pressure and did not inform friends or students about the burial until the students found out themselves.

Medical sciences student at the University of Tehran who entered the university in 2022/2023. Shot directly by Islamic Republic security forces at Sadeghieh Square during the nationwide uprising. Targeted during direct gunfire by government forces and killed instantly.
17-year-old Arab teenager, son of Faleh, from Ahvaz's Boroumi (Kareet) district, killed by direct gunfire from suppression forces during protests.

Shot in the leg on 19 Dey (January 8, 2026), then arrested. A few days later was shot and killed with a finishing shot. Family found his body a week later, confirming he had been killed. Father of 3 sons (oldest 16 years old) and breadwinner of the family. Resident of Parand, shot there but buried at night in Dezful, Khuzestan.
Was deaf (ناشنوا بود)

Former political prisoner who was shot in the chest and killed. Before his death, he expressed knowing he might not survive and said he was going for his people, for Mahsa Amini, for Nika Shakarami, for Iran.

Killed on 18 Dey in Kuhdasht, Lorestan. Posted a video on his page the same evening speaking in Luri language, saying they were going to the streets for Mahsa and Nika and the people of Iran, hoping Iran would be free by 10 PM that night if they stayed alive. Ended the video with epic Luri poetry.
From Salas-e Babajani living in Qeshm, killed by direct gunfire from repressive regime forces during protests. The regime demanded 1 billion tomans to hand over his body to the family.
Shot with direct fire by government suppression forces during people's protests. Originally from Miyaneh, resident of Tehran.

Doctor who left his home on Thursday January 8th, 2026 around 6:45 PM to participate in nationwide protests in Sari. After six days of enforced disappearance during which his family searched hospitals, police stations, detention centers and morgues receiving contradictory and misleading responses from authorities, his body was identified at the medical examiner's office. Examination showed he had been shot in the side area. It remains unclear whether he was shot and killed immediately on the street during protests, or whether he was wounded and then died from blood loss while in custody of security forces without medical attention, or whether the shooting occurred during detention.

Kurdish youth from Gilan-e Gharb (Gihelan) shot by IRGC forces with a war bullet in the upper right kidney area at 11 PM during protests on 19 Dey. Transferred to surgery by his mother, was in operating room until 5 AM on 20 Dey. Family found his body among hundreds of corpses wrapped in black bags at Kahrizak Tehran and had to pay 700 million tomans to retrieve his body
Shot from behind on Tous Boulevard in Mashhad
Died in Shahrak Andisheh
Arrested by security forces on January 8, 2026 and killed in detention. He was the head of the boxing committee of Poldokhtar county.
Shot on Bahman Street in Mashhad. Born in Ordibehesht 1390 (April-May 2011). Family may be afraid to share photos.
Killed on 18 Dey in Najaf Abad, Isfahan. Grew up in an orphanage and had no family.
From Sabzevar in Khorasan Razavi province, resident of Tehran, killed by direct gunfire from government suppression forces during popular protests in the Narmak neighborhood area

18-year-old Kurdish youth from Kermanshah, originally from Amirabad village in Eslam-Abad Gharb (Shabad) in Kermanshah province, residing in Shahin Shahr, Isfahan. Shot directly with live ammunition by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests on the evening of Friday 19 Dey 1404. Had 3 gold medals in bodybuilding and was preparing for competitions. Family was able to retrieve his body after several days and bury him in one of the cemeteries of Eslam-Abad Gharb, but were not allowed to view the body.
Shot with two war bullets to the chest by government forces

18-year-old teenager shot in the heart with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces on the evening of 18 Dey 1404 in Esfarayen. The Islamic Republic tried to portray Ali Asghar Khodadadi as a Basiji member, but the content of his last Instagram post shows that he was among the protesters.
Died in Mehrshahr, Karaj on the first night of the call/protests. The tweet suggests he became eternally remembered in Iranian history
Poet and member of Iranian Writers Association. Security forces raided his home and violently arrested him. Brother of Anisha Asadollahi, imprisoned labor activist.

Shot by sniper in the heart from the top of Saderat Bank building in Yaftabad area of Tehran District 18. Family was forced to bury him in a village due to pressure and threats. Security forces from Avaj repeatedly contacted and threatened his family when they wanted to bring the body to the village.
18-year-old footballer from the Sepahan team, shot and killed by security forces for participating in anti-regime protests
Shot with war bullet in the leg while on military leave visiting friends in Malekshahr, died from blood loss. He was a soldier from Dowlat Abad.

Shot with direct gunfire by government forces during popular protests in Neyshabur. He had recently gotten married. Security forces pressured his family to hold the burial ceremony in silence without public attendance.
Victim commemorated in Iran International memorial from Piroozi Street, Tehran
Hairdresser, resident of Varamin, shot in the leg and stomach by security forces during popular protests
Shot directly by suppression forces to the head and neck, originally from Khorramabad

21-year-old player for Sepahan youth football team, shot with war bullets by government forces during popular protests in Isfahan. He was unarmed and posed no threat to security forces when directly targeted. A promising football talent whose life and dreams were violently ended as a result of the bloody suppression of popular protests.
Shot in the head. Father of two young daughters, one aged one year and the other two and a half years old.
Shot with live ammunition by security forces during protests in Qaemiyeh neighborhood of Islamshahr
Son killed alongside his father Hossein Javanbakht by the Islamic Republic
Father who died alongside his daughter Shiva Javid. Buried in Behesht Reza cemetery, Block 50, Row 30, Section 15

27 years old, single, pharmaceutical company employee, resident of Felvarjan Isfahan. During people's protests, was first severely beaten by government suppressive forces and then shot in the forehead with a fatal bullet.
Shot with a final bullet to his face. His family is under pressure, and authorities did not allow him to be buried in Behesht Zahra cemetery.
Killed near Fallah area, Baharan Square, during clashes near Abuzar Mosque which was set on fire
