Shot in the neck with a war bullet by government forces during suppression of popular protests. Born in 1388 Persian calendar. Had posted an Instagram story with a song by Hichkas titled 'They Can't Kill Me' a few months before his death.

2-year-old child from Dahaq, Isfahan, shot in the side with a war bullet by Khamenei's beasts while sitting on his father's shoulders. Body was kept in snow from that night until morning and buried the next day. Family is under severe security pressure.

Shot with war bullets by government forces in Tehranpars district of Tehran. Originally from Borujerd, born 1366 Persian calendar. Killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic suppression forces, demonstrating the use of war weapons against unarmed people during bloody suppression of popular protests.
Butcher by profession, shot in the head in one of the districts of Karaj, father of three children aged 2, 8, and 13
17-year-old child from Arak, killed by direct gunfire from government suppression forces during popular protests in Arak

Shot with bullets in Ariashahr district of Tehran on the evening of 18 Dey. When his body was delivered to the family, severe injuries, bleeding, and signs of the body being dragged on the ground were visible on his face. He was a father of three children who had recently become a grandfather and owned a takeout restaurant. Security forces forced the Oruji family to bury his body the next day before 5 AM.
Victim from Fardis, Karaj area in Tehran province
Killed by direct shooting by government forces in the area of Bagh Rezvan Isfahan

21-year-old only child of his family, died in custody after arrest by security forces. He had taken shelter in a residential house with several others when a neighbor reported their location. Security forces arrested everyone present. Family was told not to worry and that he would be released in the morning, but the next morning his body was found beside one of Tehran's highways in the Imam Ali highway area. Death occurred after arrest and while in custody of security forces.
Shot in the back of the head with a bullet
34-year-old young man shot in the head by direct fire from Khamenei's agents in Gorgan
Shot directly by the Islamic regime forces
Architect and mathematics talent, shot directly by bullets from Islamic Republic forces while in his wife's arms in Tehranpars
Persepolis football fan who died (specific cause not mentioned in text)
Shot by snipers who targeted tall individuals with headshots during protests near the city television/screen. The incident occurred near Lahijan governorate.
Died in Shadabad, Tehran on 18 Dey 1404
Slain by regime forces in Lahijan. Brother of Ali Shoosh who died in 2023 from torture injuries sustained in 2022.
Turkish citizen following Yarsani religion from Takestan, killed while standing with friends next to their parked motorcycle in the Grand Bazaar. A complaint message was sent about him as a rioter.
19-year-old computer science student at Najafabad University. Shot in the head with a war weapon during protests in Falavarjan

26-year-old killed in Malayer on 18 Dey month. He was the breadwinner of his family. He saw officers beating some people and went forward to stop the officers, and the beasts of the Islamic Republic shot him in the head from the rooftop.
26-year-old electrical engineering student killed by regime forces

Electrical engineering student shot with war bullets from behind and side in Emamiyeh Square in Mashhad. Father Hassan is a war veteran from Iran-Iraq War with 8 years of service, is a war-wounded and chemical warfare victim

23-year-old final year microbiology student shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces in east Tehran. Transferred to Shahid-e Tajrish Hospital immediately after shooting, died on 19 Dey due to severe bleeding. Family believes blood was not transfused during treatment. Body was not returned to family for three days and was transferred to Kahrizak. Family had to search among thousands of unnamed corpses to find their daughter's body. Family was under severe security pressure, not allowed to post mourning notices in their neighborhood, forced to hold limited funeral at home.
Shot with live bullets during popular protests in Shahrekord by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran

Father of two children, shot in the chest with pellet gun by government forces around 19:30 in Fardis area of Karaj. His body was transferred to Kahrizak after being killed. He was a well-known businessman in Fardis who supported both his own family and elderly parents, known for his good behavior and responsibility. Photo shows him at the grave of Pouya Bakhtiari, a victim of November 2019 protests, indicating he was a protester seeking justice for victims of the freedom movement.
Killed on Saltanat-Abad Street in Tehran (Passdaran area) on the night of 18 Dey
Shot directly in the heart by regime suppression forces during protests

17-year-old teenager shot with five bullets from behind on the night of 18 Dey. Khamenei's mercenaries abandoned his body in a secluded place after killing him, and his corpse was only found the previous night. His mother suffered a heart attack following these crimes.

Shot during clashes at IRGC headquarters in Shah-pasand on Thursday 18 Dey. Protesters had burned police vehicles, Basij base, courthouse, governorate, municipality and banks before reaching the main IRGC base where 'real war' began.
Battery maker for heavy vehicles. Shot in the neck by security forces and killed in Golpayegan.
Shot in the head with a bullet on Hezar-o-Yek Shab Street in Kerman. His daughter was supposed to have her wedding the following week. Family is under pressure.

Shot directly in the head at close range by forces affiliated with the Islamic Republic at 8 PM in Ariashahr area of Tehran during the revolutionary uprising. He was the cousin of Ali Javaheri-pi who was among the victims of PS752 flight. He had been married for only six months.
Shot in the head from behind by government forces while passing through an alley in the Ariashahr (Sadeghiyeh) area. He was killed on the spot. He had been married for only six months.

Shot by Islamic Republic suppression forces during national uprising. Had two bullet wounds on his face - one in the eye area and another in the chin area. Also had wounds on his body that resembled machete strikes according to his relatives, and the injuries were crudely stitched. Body was identified at Kahrizak forensic medicine after 13 days of searching by family through hospitals, police stations and security centers. Brother identified the body through tattoos. Family was prohibited from holding any public mourning ceremonies.
Shot directly by regime suppression forces during protests in Meymand, Fars Province
Died in Piroozi area of Tehran

Shot by government forces in Shahrak Andisheh. 21-year-old kickboxing champion and IT student at Semnan University. Mother called him on the evening of 18 Dey but another person answered his phone. When family arrived, they found Alireza unconscious and he died before reaching the hospital. Government forces threatened his family that they would be 'destroyed' if they published news about his killing or spoke to media.

Shot with two live bullets from behind, hitting his neck, by regime's repressive forces. Fruit seller with a pickup truck and sole breadwinner of his family. Family was forced to pay 300 million tomans to retrieve his body. Security forces pressured family to falsely declare he was a Basij member despite having no affiliation. Buried without funeral ceremony under heavy security restrictions in remote desert area in Salehiyeh.
Died in Chenar-Shahijan, Fars province
32 years old, killed by Islamic Republic forces in Narmak, Tehran on 18 Dey
Shot in the chest with a war bullet on Thursday 18 Dey. Taken to a nearby clinic but mercenaries did not allow entry
Shot three times in the side, chest and heart while on a motorcycle. Was an orphan (had no mother or father). From Andarzgou.

Shot with shotgun pellets by government forces during protests in Ariashahr district. Pellets hit his body and side area, causing severe internal bleeding and lung damage. He was vomiting blood and died from his injuries despite being taken to a private hospital. Family searched for his body for a full day before finding it in Kahrizak among three warehouses full of victims' bodies. Funeral was delayed until January 10 due to restrictions and held under severe limitations. He was unmarried and worked as a car expert.
Shot directly in the chest by security forces, died from internal bleeding
Shot with four bullets by Islamic Republic forces around 21:00 on Thursday evening. He was the target of direct shooting by suppressive forces and died after being hit by multiple bullets.
Shot directly in the heart and chest by suppressive forces in Fardis, Karaj. Born 1376 (Persian calendar). Died in his mother's arms in his final moments.
Kurdish child from Abdanan, worker, shot by Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Tehran
Shot by suppressive forces in Farrokh-shahr
Shot by suppression forces during people's protests. 43 years old, from Ahvaz, residing in Fooladshahr, Isfahan
Shot by suppression forces during protests in Fooladshahr, Isfahan
Shot with live ammunition on Haft-e Tir Street in Mashhad by Islamic Republic security forces. He was an athlete and mountaineer.
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Tehran during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests

Shot in the head by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran in the vicinity of Bagh Melli Lahijan. His body was held by security agencies for a period, and his family only managed to retrieve the body after paying 500 million tomans. He worked at a restaurant and lived with his mother. His body was transferred to Isfahan for burial.

Shot in the head in the vicinity of Bagh Melli (National Garden) in Lahijan. His body was held hostage and then handed over after receiving 500 million tomans. He worked in a restaurant and lived with his mother. Family buried him in Isfahan.

Website designer, programmer and 19-year-old computer science student at Najafabad University and resident of Isfahan. Killed by gunshot to the head by government suppressive forces during protests. His body was returned to his family after one week and buried at night with large crowds present despite pressure from security institutions.

19-year-old mechanical engineering student at Tabriz University. Shot in the head with a military bullet around 8 PM in the area of Milad intersection in Andisheh city, Alborz Province. Died at the scene or shortly after being transferred. The incident occurred during the national revolution.
Shot by direct fire from suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic in Azimiyeh area of Karaj on the evening of 18 Dey
Shot in the stomach by government forces during popular protests
Shot with war bullets by suppressive forces during protests. Was the breadwinner for his family and elderly parents.
Shot with direct fire by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during nationwide protests on Sam Street in Rasht. Gilak citizen from Rasht.
Shot with three pellets and one war bullet in the upper heart area, in front of Azadi Square in Kerman, died from severe bleeding. Father of two children: a 2-year-old son and a 3-month-old daughter.
Business owner in the Elahiyeh neighborhood who was shot by state agents during popular protests
Civil engineer and construction worker from Khorramabad, resident of Parand city. Recently married (only 10 months). Killed during suppression of popular protests on Friday night.
Killed during protests in Shahreza on bloody days of 18-19 Dey by direct gunfire with war bullets or pellets
Killed in recent days during recent protests. Further details including age and location of death were not available at time of reporting.
Killed in Tehranpars, Tehran

23-year-old biology student at Payame Noor University Mashhad, shot by government agents in the area of 7-Tir Square in Mashhad. Shot from behind while moving away from the scene. Bullet wounds observed in throat, shoulder and arm areas. Family was not allowed to bury him in Behesht Reza cemetery and had to use Behesht Javad instead. Burial ceremony was held under heavy security presence. There were attempts to present him as a Basij member which the family opposed.

17-year-old boxing athlete killed in Chalous. According to relatives: 'One person was shot, he went to help rescue them, they shot Amir too. They took him to the hospital, after surgery we lost him, he had a lot of bleeding unfortunately, the bullet entered from one side of his waist and exited from the other side'
Shot and killed by direct gunfire from war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces in Kermanshah Housing Complex
Mentioned in context of Iran massacre with physical description - curly hair, navy blue hoodie, charming smile

17-year-old teenager killed with war bullet during protests. Intelligence forces pressured the Heydari family to write in the obituary that he died due to 'falling from height', similar to the killing of Nika Shakarami

Shot and killed on the evening of Thursday, January 8th, on Kashan Street in the Elahiyeh neighborhood. He was targeted with live ammunition loaded in an AK-47, fired directly by the Islamic Republic security forces, and died on the spot. After killing the teenager, the forces seized his body and later handed it over to the family in exchange for one billion tomans. The family was previously pressured to list the cause of death as 'fall from height' but refused, yet the death certificate was issued with that claim.

Shot with war bullets from behind by Javidan terrorists. He was an only child from Bistjan village in Isfahan. The regime has put his grieving family under severe pressure - no ceremonies were allowed, no obituary or photo publication was permitted, and even holding ceremonies in the village mosque was prevented.
9-year-old boy killed in Talaiyeh neighborhood, Qarchak, along with four others during incident on the night of 18 Dey
17-year-old shot with sniper war bullet by IRGC terrorist forces of the Islamic Republic on the night of 18 Dey in Qarchak, killed by Khamenei's mercenaries

Art university student and life coach/healing practitioner. Born in 1369 (Persian calendar), resident of Majidiyeh neighborhood in Tehran. Shot directly in the head in Majidiyeh neighborhood in front of his sister's eyes.

Shot with bullet by Islamic Republic forces on Moallem Street in Rasht. Cause of death officially recorded as 'bullet impact' and registered in his burial records, clearly indicating he was killed by direct gunfire.
Arrested in Nowshahr on 18 Dey 1404 along with two other young men
Father of a 9-year-old son, killed by regime forces in Marlik, Karaj
Lost his life in Manjil protests. Had written on his Instagram: 'You must have the courage to continue, not the hope of arriving.' One of the 12,000 people.
Shot by suppression forces with a bullet to the neck area in the evening in Najafabad
Killed on 18 Dey in Kaj Square, Saadatabad. Was a friend of the poster's nephew. Had recently wanted to give them sweets for his new car.
Shot in the heart with a war bullet in Ariashahr
Shot in the leg at Sadeghieh Square on Thursday 18 Dey, was arrested, died in custody a few days later, family found his body in Kahrizak
Killed on 18 Dey in Tehran. Young person whose memory will not fade.
Shot in the heart with a war bullet in Tehranpars, Tehran
Shot in the neck with a war bullet by suppressive forces during Thursday protests in Kianshahr, Tehran. Buried in Behesht-e Zahra Cemetery in Tehran, section 327, row 183, number 123
Gilaki citizen from Koochsefehan killed by direct gunfire from Iranian Islamic Republic government forces
Shot by regime suppression forces on Toos Boulevard during the Sun and Lion Revolution
Shot with war bullets in Qaimiye neighborhood, Islamshahr

17-year-old shot in the leg during Shahinshahr protests on the night of 18 Dey. After being wounded, agents arrested him. Family searched for 20 days without finding him in police stations, hospitals, and forensic centers. According to an eyewitness, he was ultimately killed by a gunshot to the forehead. His body was identified at Shahinshahr forensic center after 20 days and buried in Chaghakhor county of Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari province.

Shot from behind on Keshavarz Boulevard in Karaj. Lost his father several years ago. Family was forced to pay one billion [rials/tomans] to receive his body and were not allowed to hold a funeral ceremony for him
Shot in the heart on 18 Dey, bullet exited through his back. Body was missing for three days after being shot before being buried in Darab
Worker and caretaker of his elderly parents from Eslam Abad-e Gharb, killed by direct gunfire from government forces during popular protests

Shot with war bullet during protests. Originally from Zahedan, owned a cafe called 'Be Vaght-e Cafe' (Coffee Time Cafe) on Daneshgah Street in Zahedan, then moved to Tehran and opened the same cafe on 17 Shahrivar Street in Tehran. Has a 10-year-old son.

Student at Islamic Azad University of North Tehran, studying microbiology, admitted in 1402. Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppression forces in Haft Howz area of Tehran, hit in the neck from behind. Had previous severe tendon injury in foot and walked with difficulty but went to the streets to join the people. His last message before going to the street was 'I'm going so that I can at least take a step for all of us'

Shot with 2 bullets to the heart and neck on Golsorkhi Street in Chalus. He had gone looking for his younger brother who had participated in protests because he was afraid something would happen to his brother
Shot by direct fire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces in Qaleh Hassan Khan area. Citizen of Talesh from Anbaran (Anaban). His body was buried in Anbaran.
Gilak citizen from Lowlman (suburbs of Rasht), killed during nationwide protests in Rasht city by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces
Shot and killed by plainclothes armed officers during protests. Gilaki citizen and protester from Lahijan, North Iran.

Killed alongside his brother Omid Teimouri and 19-year-old nephew Armin Teimouri on Sar-e Canal area of Fardis (main street) by gunfire from war weapons by Islamic Republic's suppressive forces. Family was pressured and threatened by government forces to receive the bodies and forced to bury them secretly.
Shot directly with war bullets by Islamic Republic mercenaries. He was unarmed and targeted simply for being present at protests or near gathering locations.

17-year-old teenager from Mashhad who worked at a jewelry shop and was the breadwinner for his family. Shot with military bullets by Khamenei's suppressive forces during street protests. Died from severe injuries sustained from the shooting.
Killed by government forces on Haft-e Tir Boulevard in Mashhad, buried behind Ferdowsi's tomb in the city of Tus
15-year-old killed in Azadshahr, Golestan province
Listed as a commemorated victim from Rudbar Gilan
Shot during protests while trying to help his brother Aryan. Part of a family that lost two children. One brother was shot, the other went to help him and was also shot.
20-year-old mechanical engineering student from Kermanshah province, living in Karaj. Shot with live ammunition by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic during protests in Karaj.
23-year-old with Down syndrome who was killed by a military-grade bullet fired into his family's car while returning home from the hospital where he had been treated for a seizure
Died on Thursday 18 Dey in Tehran. Described as a local neighborhood youth whose name hadn't been widely publicized.
Arrested in Manjil on January 8. Described as missing detainee with no family to follow up on his case.
Arrested on 18 Dey and his lifeless body was handed over to his family a few days later

Shot in the neck with a bullet during protests in Najafabad, Isfahan. The tweet notes that direct shooting at protesters constitutes a clear violation of the right to life and prohibition of lethal use of force against citizens.
Died on his path to freedom (در مسیر آزادی به جاودانگی رسید), from Karaj. Described as 'janfada' (life-sacrificer)
Musician, singer, and guitarist shot in the head by forces of the Islamic Republic regime
16-year-old Afghan national who died in Mashhad

Kurdish citizen shot in the head with war bullets by military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Kernachi district of Kermanshah. Family identified his body in one of the city's morgues after several days of uncertainty. Funeral was held at Brimond cemetery in Kermanshah. Security agencies did not allow the family to hold a public memorial service.
Killed in Tehran. Family was threatened by authorities, and if his friend who went to the street with him hadn't been there, no one would have ever found out about his death.
Shot and taken to hospital where he was killed with a finishing shot

20-year-old student from Kermanshah shot and killed with three war bullets from a Kalashnikov rifle by government forces on Thursday evening around 20:30 on Maskan Street in Kermanshah, Bahner intersection area
Killed by a punch to the back of his neck by Islamic Republic forces

Shot with live ammunition by government forces during protests on his first night on the streets. Shot from very close range (less than 10 meters) with bullet entering his chest and side and exiting the other side. Body showed signs of severe beating before being killed with what was essentially an execution shot. Body was found buried under several other corpses in the fifteenth warehouse at Kahrizak morgue after family searched for hours. Related to Nika Shakarami, a victim of the 2022 protests.
Among 40-50 people who lost their lives in the city of Alvand, Qazvin province on the night of 18 Dey
17-year-old tailor worker from Arak, shot by government forces during popular protests at Shora Square. His body was delivered to his family the next day and buried.
17-year-old footballer shot and killed by suppression forces with two war bullets during protests in Zibashahr area of Qazvin

Shot in the head with a bullet. From Tou'ali village in Khodafarin (East Azerbaijan), living in Tehran's Khak Sefid neighborhood in Tehranpars. Islamic Republic agents have demanded one billion tomans from the family, which they cannot afford due to financial circumstances.

Kurdish child from Harsin, shot by Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Moalem neighborhood of Kermanshah. His burial ceremony was held on January 10th in Pariwah Sofla village.
Shot with 2 war bullets directly fired at him around Khayam Square in Neyshabour city. His Instagram shows his last business page post was about strikes/protests

Shot in the lung during protests in Fardis, Karaj. He was standing in the front row with friends, arms linked to protect the crowd. His face was full of pellets. Only son of family, father previously deceased, mother under pressure to remain silent about his killing.
Shot with military bullet by security forces during protests in Ramsar. His family held a henna ceremony at his grave.

Shot with Kalashnikov war bullet in Kiu Square, Khorramabad. Security institutions initially refused to hand over his body, which was eventually delivered and buried on 22 Dey after continuous follow-ups and pressure.
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime in Narmak, Tehran

Shot directly in the heart by security forces' bullets. Mining engineer who had always dreamed of becoming a journalist and was passionate about telling the truth. Despite having a wealthy father who was a trader aligned with the Islamic Republic, chose to live a simple life in a small rented room. After his death, there were attempts to register him as a 'security martyr' but part of his family resisted and prevented this distortion of his story. He was a passionate fan of Naser Hejazi and like Hejazi never bowed down, stood by his principles and beliefs until the last moment.
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Fardis, Karaj
Shot by security forces while participating in protests. Came from Mohajeran neighborhood to Arak to take part in the protests and was killed by gunfire from criminal forces.

Shot directly in the heart by Islamic Republic mercenaries on 18 Dey in Neyshabur. He was wounded and transferred to Hakim Hospital. Amirreza arrived at the hospital alive but doctors were not allowed to treat him and he died

Shot by government forces with two bullets to the heart and shoulder area during protests in Yaft Abad, Tehran. He was reportedly throwing back tear gas canisters toward security forces when he was shot. He was unmarried and had only two months left of military service, and was on leave participating in protests with friends. His body was buried under security conditions in complete silence at Darolsalam Cemetery in Islamshahr, with family not allowed to take photos or videos. Security pressures also prevented holding traditional third and seventh day memorial ceremonies.

17-year-old student from Shandiz who was arrested on January 5 amid the protests, released, then returned to the streets. Shot by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic regime forces to his head on January 8 in Shandiz city. The gunshot reportedly left his face unrecognizable. His mother is Raheleh Khalili.
17-year-old child killed during popular protests by direct gunshot from J3 rifle fired by government forces. His face was reportedly disfigured during the identification of his body.
Kurdish citizen killed by gunfire from Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Esfarayen city
Young Qashqai woman killed on 18 Dey in Chenarshahijan. Her body was buried in Elyasabad, Chenarshahijan. Killed by the Islamic Republic while fighting for freedom.
Killed in recent days during protests. No further information available at the time of reporting.
37-year-old bodybuilder, killed by regime forces in Sadeghieh, Tehran
Shot by snipers during celebrations after police were driven out of an area. Victims had gathered to dance and celebrate when snipers came and shot everyone present.

Married young man shot with two bullets - one to the back of the leg and another to the lower abdomen - on Naser Khosro Street at the beginning of Tehran Street in Bandar-e Anzali. Died before reaching the hospital.
Shot with live ammunition directly to the heart area on Piroozi Street in Tehran
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime in Narmak, Tehran

Shot in throat area by war bullets during protests in Chalous. He was targeted by barrage of gunfire from Islamic Republic forces in the upper bank area of Chalous. His mother searched for his body from around 9 PM until 8 AM and after hours of uncertainty, found his body. Gilak citizen from Chalous, law student and hairdresser.
Worker killed during protests in Saveh. He was a follower of the Yarsan faith and from Dalahu city in Kermanshah province. He had three children named Danial, Mardin and Bania.
Killed by direct shot to the head in Fars Province. Had a case file from the Mahsa Amini uprising but continued to protest and gave his life for Iran's freedom.

Killed by Ali Khamenei's mercenary forces with war bullets, batons, and machetes. His mother found his body frozen in the morgue after 9 days and buried him with her own hands after 33 years of raising him.
26 year old from Andika in Khuzestan Province, killed by the Islamic regime of Iran in Dargahan, Qeshm

Shot by security forces during protests. First shot in the side while still alive, then executed with a shot to the head. This method constitutes a deliberate execution and extrajudicial killing. Family was forced to pay 750 million tomans as 'bullet fee' to retrieve her body. Her body was buried eight days after her death at 6 AM under strict security measures.
Shot with war bullet during nationwide protests in Lahijan. Mother Mojgan Tahvildari published a video on Instagram saying goodbye to her son.
17-year-old Kurdish child from Kangavar city in Kermanshah province, killed during popular protests by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic of Iran's suppressive forces
Killed after leaving home when he heard gunshots and became worried about his brother Amirhossein. 14-year-old brother of Amirhossein Eshghi. Both brothers were buried together in a two-story grave.

Shot directly by suppression forces during protests in Borujerd. She was a 23-year-old psychology student who worked at a cafe and loved reading. Security forces withheld her body from her family for four days. The family refused to accept presenting Ariana as a 'Basiji' or burying her outside their city. She was buried early Monday morning (22 Dey) in Borujerd cemetery with several family members and dozens of security agents present.
Died in Tehran
Shot in the heart with a bullet on 18 Dey. University student (brother refers to him as a fellow university student).
Fatally shot in the chest by Islamic Republic forces

Shot with military bullets by government forces in Karaj Square on Thursday January 8, 2026. He was severely injured and immediately arrested by suppression forces. His body was delivered to his family several days later showing evidence of two bullet wounds. He was unmarried, had no children, and worked as a bazaari (merchant) in Tehran. Despite being wounded at the scene, he was arrested and his fate remained unclear until his body was returned after three days. His body was transferred to Sakineh Cemetery for burial.
36-year-old artificial flower vendor from Shush, shot and killed in South Mehrabad. Authorities forced his elderly mother to sign papers stating he died of natural causes before returning his body.
Victim of state violence during Iranian protests
Rapper shot in the leg on 18 Dey in Isfahan and died from severe bleeding
Shot by security forces during popular protests in Shahin Shahr, Isfahan Province
Petrochemical worker killed at 10:30 PM near the Mahshahr Cultural Center after being directly shot with live ammunition by Islamic Republic forces

Shot in the head with a war bullet at Felakeh-ye Sevom (Third Circle) in Tehran-Pars area of eastern Tehran around 11 PM while participating in protests. His body was taken to a hospital and family was contacted at 2 AM. He was a worker who had previously worked in mechanics and recently changed his profession to building painting. He had posted a story before the protest saying 'This Thursday-Friday we're going to walk the city with friends. If there's a one percent chance I go and don't return, celebrate for me in the upcoming festivities.' He was buried in Behesht-e Zahra cemetery in Tehran.

19-year-old nephew of Amir Teimouri, resident of Falah neighborhood in Tehran who had gone to visit Amir's house in Fardis for a gathering. Killed alongside his uncles Amir and Omid by gunfire from war weapons by Islamic Republic's suppressive forces on Sar-e Canal area of Fardis (main street). Family was pressured and threatened by government forces to receive the bodies and forced to bury them secretly.
17-year-old child from Tehran, killed during popular protests at the beginning of Piroozi Street by direct shooting from government forces, struck by war bullet

22-year-old only child from Arak. Parents had waited 18 years to have a child. Authorities demanded either 1.5 billion rials or would falsely register him as a Basij member on his death certificate. Father paid the money to retrieve his son's body.
Polymer engineering student at Science and Research University, killed by Islamic Republic forces during the suppression on Thursday 18 Dey
17-year-old child from Mashhad, Khorasan Razavi province, killed by direct shooting from government suppressive forces on Thursday evening

English language education student, national fitness champion, international Kyokushin champion, and official trainer for the World Dog Federation. Shot with a military bullet by Islamic Republic suppressive forces in the kidney area during suppression of popular protests in Zanjan. The severity of injuries from the military bullet led to the death of this young athlete and student.

Shot directly in the head with a war bullet on Ferdows East Boulevard between Ali Hosseini and Erik streets. He was a 26-year-old resident of Thailand, born in Jannat Abad neighborhood of Tehran. He had only been in Iran for two days from Thailand to visit friends and family. As a supporter of Prince Reza Pahlavi, he participated in the protests in response to calls made for building a better future and life for the people. His family found his body after three days of searching, and authorities demanded 2 billion tomans (compared to the usual 700 million tomans) for the release of his body due to his family's good financial situation.

Killed by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic regime during protests in Lahijan. His mother had not seen him for years due to immigration and was planning to travel to Turkey in the coming months to see her child after 7 years, but the regime left the longing for this reunion in their hearts forever
Shot by regime forces in Yousef Abad area of Tehran. Family is under pressure to claim he died of heart attack instead of being killed by gunfire.
Rapper and composer, resident of Shahrak-e Gharb area of Tehran. Joined protests in Naziabad area. Was targeted with two war bullets to his throat and back and was killed.

25-year-old Kurdish man from Saqez, resident of Kish, killed by direct shooting by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Kish, Hormozgan province. His body was handed over to his family after receiving 700 million tomans by security institutions.
14-year-old brother of Amirhossein, killed by the Islamic Republic alongside his brother

20-year-old Lor protester from Rostam Babameydan shot by Islamic Republic suppressors. Bullets hit his heart and side. Body returned to family with conditions of no media coverage and no use of banners in the city (which is Lor mourning custom). Buried in his native village of Nogak in Rostam county with large attendance at funeral.
Younger brother of Mohammad Rahmani, arrested together by security forces on 18 Dey 1404 and transferred to an unknown location. No information available about their condition or whereabouts.
Shot in the neck by Islamic Republic regime forces during protests. He was a young barista, bartender, and flair artist who had recently obtained a professional certificate.
Shot from behind and killed by regime forces in Andisheh neighborhood of Shahriar. His family was not even allowed to hold a memorial ceremony.
Shot with four war bullets during protests - one to the heart, one to the shoulder, one to the shin, one to the wrist. Married father of two daughters aged 1 and 7 years old.
Died in Narmak district of Tehran. Persian birth year 1398 indicates born around 1398 + 621 = 2019, making age approximately 27 years old in 2026.

Female protester and mother of a 9-year-old child, killed by direct gunshot to the head by government agents in front of the governorate building in Gorgan, in front of her family members during protests. Agents were shooting at protesters from inside the governorate building.
Shot when Iranian armed forces opened direct fire into the crowd during protests in the Sargol Square area of Rasht, North Iran
Shot directly from behind in the heart area by IRGC (Pasdaran) forces during the national uprising
Listed in Iran International Memorial database, died on Saadi Street in Rasht, Gilan province

Shot dead with live ammunition by the regime's security forces. Born in Karaj, later lived in Hamedan. Youngest in his family, described as kind-hearted nature enthusiast and passionate hiker who deeply loved the earth.

Shot directly in the chest with a war bullet in front of Rajai Hospital in Tonekabon (Shahsavar). Shot by suppressive forces. Brother of Farzali Ashkurqorbani who was killed as a fighter in the Iran-Iraq war in 1987 in Sumar region.

Shot in the chest by live ammunition fired at close range by suppression forces directly in front of Rajai Hospital. Struck in the chest by live ammunition, resulting in immediate death at the scene. Brother of Farz-Ali Eshkevar-Ghorbani, a veteran killed in 1987 during the Iran-Iraq War.
Killed by the suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic in Farrokh-shahr city
Shot with war bullets by regime mercenaries during protests. Born in Arak.
Gilaki citizen killed by Islamic Republic armed forces during protests in Rasht, northern Iran

Owner of the 'Smoke Burger' restaurant, shot straight in the heart by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic terror forces during protests. Killed by a regime sniper. He loved cooking, nature, and playing the guitar. He was not a threat, not armed, and was living his life.
Murdered by Islamic Republic while fighting to liberate Iran. His parents were forced to declare he died in a car accident.
Killed during protests in Kazerun
Shot with a war bullet in the head area in Rasht, Golsar

Shot directly by government forces from behind during popular protests in Tehran, with a military bullet hitting the spleen area. Originally from Mazandaran province, resident of Rudaki neighborhood in Tehran. Body was handed over to family after payment of fees, and security agencies prohibited any ceremonies. Buried in his birth village under strict security measures without public ceremonies.
Shot by sniper from above Qasemabad police station around Imamiyeh square area in Mashhad

33-year-old Kurdish citizen from Kermanshah, resident of Daredarez neighborhood. Shot with live ammunition by Islamic Republic suppression forces during evening protests in Daredarez neighborhood. His body was handed over to family after extensive follow-ups on Saturday 20 Dey 1404 (January 10, 2026) and buried on Sunday 21 Dey 1404 (January 11, 2026) in Anjirbane Avarehali village cemetery in Sarpol-e Zahab. He was married and father of two daughters.
Kurdish Yarsan citizen killed by gunfire from military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Tehran
Gilaki citizen from Astaneh-ye Ashrafiyeh, killed by gunfire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces in the city

14-year-old Gilaki citizen from Sangar, shot directly by security forces in the municipality area of Rasht. Bullet hit his leg causing severe bleeding that led to his death. Body was returned to family after several days upon payment of money. Buried at midnight with security forces present and only his parents allowed to attend. Family was not permitted to hold a funeral ceremony.
16-year-old from Fallah, Tehran, killed by gunshot. A notice was posted at his grandmother's house door. His father had recently passed away. The exact date is uncertain but was around 18 or 19 Dey.
Died in Esfarayen during protests

Father of Danial Mostafavi. Shot and killed along with his wife and son while sitting in their private car during peaceful protests when government forces opened fire on their vehicle with a barrage of bullets.
Shot in the head by sniper fire. Death certificate states cause of death as 'impact of high-speed projectile objects to the body'
Top law student at Razi University in Kermanshah, gunned down by regime forces in his hometown

24-year-old law student at Razi University Kermanshah, killed by regime suppression forces in his birthplace Kerman. His mother was photographed holding his photo and crying out: 'Khamenei, now rule! Khamenei, now rule over the blood of our children that you killed.'

Shot directly in left side at Haft Howz, bullet entered left side and exited right side destroying all internal organs, died instantly. Body was left in a garden where friends found him and brought him home. Family attempted first aid including applying pressure to wound, CPR, and heart massage but he had died from internal bleeding. Was wearing a shirt that read 'A soldier for life'

19-year-old student from Sonqor, resident of Karaj. Shot along with his parents while sitting in their private car during peaceful protests. Government forces opened fire on their vehicle with a hail of bullets. Their bodies were transferred to Sonqor and buried before 6 AM under strict security measures with enforcement by authorities.
28-year-old car electrician from Ramhormoz, residing in Qazvin. Killed during popular protests by direct gunfire from government suppression forces to his chest area.
Shot by suppressor forces on Thursday 18 Dey 1404. Body was kept at home until morning so they could bury him. Bakhtiari ethnicity.
From Bazoft in Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari province, shot directly by suppression forces in Baharestan, Isfahan

Young footballer and resident of West Baghestan, Karaj. Shot directly with war bullets by Islamic Republic security forces during protests. Shot in the abdomen in the Shahin Karaj area near 10th Street. Was alive when transferred to Alborz Hospital in Karaj but died due to delays and lack of timely medical care from severe bleeding. Was unarmed and participated peacefully in protests demanding freedom, human dignity and end of Islamic Republic rule. Security forces pressured his family to prevent public disclosure and media interviews.
Died at 8:10 PM in Marlik. Described as becoming eternal/martyred ('جاویدان شده')
Shot directly by suppression forces in Shahin Shahr, Isfahan

Teacher and father of three 3-year-old triplets named Alma, Pasha and Gersha. Shot directly with bullet to his side. His body was returned to family after six days of custody under pressure and threats, with authorities demanding the family declare the cause of death as 'being a Basiji' and 'killed by terrorists'
Victim documented in Iran International memorial database from Shahinshahr, Isfahan
Father of two young daughters, shot in the eye during protests in Fardis

19-year-old Kurdish man from Dehgolan living in Tehran, killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests. His body was buried at night under heavy security conditions, with mourners singing 'O Martyrs' and chanting 'Kak Diako is a hero, martyr of Kurdistan'.

18-year-old Kurdish citizen from Salas-e Babajani in Kermanshah province, resident of Qeshm, shot directly by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during popular protests. Family received his body three days later after paying one billion tomans

Kurdish dentist from Islamabad-e Gharbi (Shabad) in Kermanshah Province, shot and killed with live ammunition by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests on Thursday evening 18 Dey 1404. He was a well-known and respected figure among the people of Islamabad-e Gharbi (Shabad). His killing caused a wave of anger and grief among the people of the city.
Anesthesiologist shot in the head by regime forces in Haft-e Tir area of Mashhad
Gilaki citizen from Bandar Anzali shot with a war bullet. Exact location uncertain with conflicting reports between Bandar Anzali and Rasht.

Futsal coach and father of two children, shot directly by Islamic Republic suppression forces at 21:30 while driving his car towards security forces in the main square of Neyriz, Fars province. He was targeted with shotgun fire from approximately 20 centimeters away while behind the steering wheel. Despite being transferred to Neyriz hospital, he died about half an hour later due to the severity of his injuries. He was married and father of a young daughter. Security forces held his body for two days and threatened his family not to hold any gatherings or protests. His body was finally buried at 2 AM on 22 Dey in complete silence under security forces siege, alongside the body of Amirmohammad Kohkan. He was a close friend of Amirmohammad Kohkan who was killed on 13 Dey in Neyriz.
Lor citizen from Khorramabad, Lorestan province. Killed by direct gunshot to the head by government forces during popular protests in the Masur area of the city.

Shot by security forces while trying to help an injured person during nationwide protests in Kalachai, Gilan. He was shot from behind by a security officer while attempting to move the injured person away from the conflict area. His body was buried three days later around 5 AM under strict security measures. Family was not allowed to hold public ceremonies and were prevented from visiting his grave even for the third-day memorial. The area around his grave was closed off with armed officers stationed there, and strict restrictions were imposed including preventing vehicles from stopping near the mosque.
Shot with bullets by Islamic Republic suppressors during protests in Babol
From Saqqez, worked as a caretaker in Tehran. Shot in the forehead by a sniper in front of his young child.
Died during the 2025-2026 protests in Tehran. Birth year listed as 1393 (Persian calendar).
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial

Shot directly in the throat and several other parts of his body while engaged in hand-to-hand combat with several suppression forces. Died from bleeding caused by throat wound. Was single and had been supporting and caring for his brother who had cancer, covering his medical expenses.

Shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic security forces during popular protests in the evening of Thursday 18 Dey 1404 in the Falkeh Qahramanan Miyanrud area of Shiraz. He was hit in the neck with a war bullet, also shot in the arm, and his hands and feet were severely wounded with pellets. Born in Firouzabad, residing in Shiraz, had a diploma degree and owned a leather bag production unit. Had returned to Shiraz only one year ago after about 20 years away from family. After being wounded, he gave phone numbers he remembered to someone present to contact his family with his mobile phone. His body was only handed over to the family about a week later. Security forces pressured the family to hold the funeral quietly without announcements and only in early morning hours within a family framework. He was buried in his birthplace next to the grave of Raha Bahloulipour.

Dual Iranian-Swedish citizen who had traveled to Iran to visit his family. Shot on the street and taken to the hospital. While still conscious, he gave his name to the medical staff, then disappeared. Twelve days later, his body was found in Kahrizak. Due to severe swelling, the body was no longer recognizable, and his family was only able to identify him by a tattoo on his hand.

Employee at Kowsar Clinic and former security guard at Valiasr Hospital. Shot during events at Shora Square after going to investigate reports of a fire at his former school. Struck by both pellet rounds and live ammunition in the abdomen, heart, and temple. Body released to family after 4 days. Family rejected authorities' offer to attribute the killing to protesters in exchange for monetary payment.

Nurse at Imam Ali Hospital in Kermanshah who was wounded by a military bullet shot from behind by military-security forces during protests. She was transferred to hospital and underwent surgery but died due to the severity of her injuries.

30-year-old English and German language teacher who was directly shot by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic during the national uprising in Tehranpars neighborhood. Despite his mother's warning not to go to the streets, he had left home. Government agents shot a bullet into his side at close range. After being hit, he managed to reach a nearby house but died from severe bleeding. The family was contacted through his phone and transported his body.

Barista and Gilak citizen from Lahijan, killed during protests by direct shooting with four bullets fired by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces. Had been previously arrested in 2022. His brother Ali Shush was also killed by government forces during 2022 protests.
Shot directly in the heart by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic during suppression of protests in Ariashahr area of Tehran
24-year-old citizen from Lumar city in Ilam province, killed during popular protests in Varamin, Tehran after being shot with live ammunition by security forces

Shot and killed by direct fire from security forces. Four bullets hit his head area and one bullet hit his leg. After his death, security agencies demanded 800 million tomans from his family to hand over his body. Family faced extensive pressure, threats and harassment during the process of receiving the body and holding burial ceremonies.

Shot by direct gunfire from security forces. Four bullets struck his head and one hit his leg. Security agencies demanded 800 million tomans from family for releasing his body. Family endured extensive pressure, threats, and harassment during body retrieval process and funeral arrangements.
Kurdish young man from Kermanshah shot by direct fire from Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Jafarabad neighborhood

Shot by three bullets in Tehran's Persian Gulf district, fired by forces of the Islamic Republic regime. Body retrieved by family from Kahrizak three days later on January 11. Was a dedicated athlete and wrestler, former champion in youth category with passion for professional motorcycling.
Shot twice in the neck near Police Station 196 during protests. After seven days of searching among the piled-up bodies at the Kahrizak Forensic Center, his family found his body.
Shot with two direct bullets to the neck by government forces in front of Mashiriyeh police station 196. His body was found by his family at Kahrizak after seven days of searching and uncertainty.
Building electrician who loved movies and cars. Shot in the head during protests. His funeral was held under his legal name Ali at Agha Seyyed Mohammad Lahijan.

Killed during popular protests in Lahijan. Real estate consultant, described as a healthy, athletic, and energetic young man. His family was forced under pressure to bury his body at night and in silence to prevent public ceremonies and popular protests. Described as a protesting young man who was tired of existing conditions, not a terrorist or rioter.
Shot with a war bullet to the heart near Sohrevardi area in Isfahan
Shot directly in the heart with a bullet during the Iranian National Revolution protests in Gohardasht, Karaj

Shot during clashes at IRGC headquarters in Shah-pasand on Thursday 18 Dey. Protesters had burned police vehicles, Basij base, courthouse, governorate, municipality and banks before reaching the main IRGC base where 'real war' began.
Targeted and killed by suppression forces in Khorramabad. From Delfan.
Shot dead with a barrage of bullets in front of his parents for the crime of sheltering protesters

Kurdish citizen shot with war bullets by Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) during popular protests in Eslamabad Gharb city, Kermanshah Province. Burial ceremony held on January 10, 2026, at Cheshmeh Khani Chikan Mansouri cemetery.
Barista at Cafe Melo, Gilak citizen from Sari. Injured on the same night as Mohammad Ebrahimi, hospitalized for several days, died two days before this report due to severity of injuries
Shot by Islamic Republic terrorists in Punak neighborhood. Friend of a friend who wanted to share his photo but was afraid to do so themselves.
Murdered by the Islamic Regime on Taghbestan Boulevard in Kermanshah. His body was taken by authorities who allegedly planned to falsely claim he was IRGC
Shot by police on the evening of 18 Dey in Fardis, killed in front of his brother. Brother emphasized he was killed by police bullet and refused to sign martyrdom consent form
Suffered brain death from multiple baton strikes to the head and was killed by Khamenei's criminal regime
Shot after he had already died, including shots fired at a royal crown tattoo on his hand. The extent of fear was so deep that even this young man's death did not bring them peace.
Shot in the heart with a bullet on 18 Dey in Isfahan. His wife is pregnant with triplets.
Building drafting engineer shot in the heart with war bullets fired from Khorozouq police station in Isfahan on Thursday. His wife is pregnant with triplets
Killed in Mashhad
Shot directly by suppression forces. Body was buried on 29 Dey (January 19, 2026) under strict security measures.

37-year-old Kurdish man from Kermanshah, mechanical engineer, shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Kermanshah on the evening of Thursday 18 Dey 1404. He was directly targeted and killed by suppression forces.

Killed during violent suppression of people by forces affiliated with the Islamic Republic through direct gunfire. According to relatives, three war bullets hit his leg, heart and head, and a shotgun pellet also hit his face. Relatives and eyewitnesses remember his bravery and consider his killing a clear example of Khamenei's suppressors' crimes against protesters.
Mother of two children. Shot with bullets to the neck and leg. Her last words to family were that she was going to get her children's rights.

Shot three times in the neck, heart and shoulder while giving shelter to protesters in Kooh-chenar neighborhood of Fars Province. Ambulance arrived three hours later but it was too late. Officials demanded 400 million tomans from the family to release the body.
Hairdresser who was shot and killed with direct gunfire. The shooting targeted unarmed protesters, specifically aiming at the head and vital organs, showing clear intent to kill.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial

Shot by Islamic Republic forces with two war bullets - one to the heart and one to the leg. Shot from behind, with the first bullet hitting her leg. She was the youngest child in her family, had been married for 1-2 years, and worked in the clothing industry for over 20 years before marriage. Family considered her the 'light of the house' and emotional pillar of the family.
Killed by regime agents in Karaj. Mother of a 10-year-old child. Buried in Behesht-e Zahra cemetery in Tehran

Dental assistant shot directly in the heart with a war bullet by government suppression forces during popular protests in Fallah neighborhood of Tehran. She was targeted by a sniper positioned on top of a mosque near the gathering site at 7:30 PM and died from her injuries at the hospital despite medical staff's efforts.

Shot by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during protests near Rasht municipality. First hit by shotgun pellets in her leg, then after being moved to a nearby alley for potential medical transport, security forces arrived, beat her, and shot her in the genital area. She was hospitalized in critical condition and unconscious for two days before dying from the severity of her injuries. She was a Gilaki citizen from Sangar.

Shot in the heart by special forces during protests near Farhang Street in Rasht. She was a fourth-grade elementary school teacher and mother of an 8-year-old son. Special forces cornered protesters in an alley and opened fire. Her body was returned to family after signing commitments, with authorities demanding the family declare her a Basij member, which they refused.

Kurdish citizen from Esfarayen city in North Khorasan province, killed by direct gunfire from government forces during popular protests on one of the city streets. Hours before being killed, she had written in her last social media story: 'Tonight I'm going out for my children, because they have the right to have a good life.'

Shot by Islamic Republic forces during protests in Isfahan. She was the accountant of 'Bargh Sepehr' shop on 'J' Street. Was targeted with weapon fire in front of her young daughter. Islamic Republic forces targeted her head with their weapon. The shooter was from Basij forces.
Shot directly in the head by government forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran. Citizen of Talesh from Anbaran village. Body was buried in Anbaran.
Singer and pianist killed by three bullets fired by Islamic Republic forces, just five days before his 24th birthday. Described as having a peaceful, poetic, and artistic life.

Shot with over 100 pellets, then killed with two war bullets from a Kalashnikov rifle. One bullet hit him from behind and the second was fired directly into his heart from the front as a coup de grace shot. His body was held by security agencies for several days before being returned to family under security conditions. Burial was restricted to between 2 AM and 7 AM, and he was not allowed to be buried in Shushtar city cemetery.
Shot in the head with a war bullet in Ferdowsieh, Shahriyar

Off-road racing champion and protesting citizen shot directly in the head by Islamic Republic forces during crackdown on national uprising. Father of a young daughter, described as honorable, kind, and deeply responsible. Was actively involved in humanitarian work and had devoted himself to helping victims of the Kermanshah earthquake.

31-year-old Kurdish student from Mahabad killed in Tehran. Body returned to family for 700 million tomans. Security forces and IRGC buried her body themselves in the black bag without allowing family to wash, shroud or conduct proper burial rites. Family only allowed 3 minutes to see her face. IRGC special forces stationed outside family home with vehicles and weapons. Several people arrested during funeral ceremony. Family charged 250 million tomans per bullet. Authorities pressuring families to register their deceased children with government Martyrs Foundation.
Emergency medicine doctor at Hasheminejad Hospital. Arrested in front of her home on 18 Dey (January 8, 2026). After arrest, she contacted her husband several times but now there is no news of her.

Young man from Shirvan who was either executed by the regime or was previously arrested and killed in detention on 18 Dey month. In a video he had posted on Instagram, he said: 'Come out, what more do you want? Worse than this? Come, I have one life to sacrifice for you.' These words were his last message to the people to continue the struggle.

Shot by direct sniper fire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces. The incident occurred on the first night of protest calls in the area of Qaleh Hassan Station 1. He had only gone to a shop to buy something and was targeted for shooting because he was wearing a mask. The bullet hit him and caused his death on the spot. He was a worker and had a young child.
Basketball player and champion of Iran's university competitions, shot in the chest and killed by regime forces

Shot in the head while trying to help someone who had been hit by pellets in front of the Shahrqods governor's office. He was buried two days later in his birthplace Tuyserkan. He owned a barbershop on Imamzadeh Street.
Died in Mashhad on 18 Dey 1404 during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests
40-year-old from Arak, killed by Islamic Republic suppression forces during protests on 19 Dey in Golestan Eslamshahr. His body was buried in his birthplace, Arak
13-year-old girl killed by Islamic Republic forces. Family is under significant pressure and requested that her name not be forgotten.
Killed at Seyyed Heshmat and Shahrestani intersection, mostly with heavy machine gun (doshka). Part of 61 people killed in one incident over two days.

Manager of Azam company in Rasht, shot on Saadi Street. According to witnesses, bullet hit artery in his leg. He came home and rang the doorbell, his wife took him to Pars Hospital but bleeding was severe. Authorities told his mother to tell them where to go until they extracted her son from the ground and took him to the desert.
Shot in the throat on Barazandeh Street. Resident of Parvin Street, Isfahan.

Father of a 6-year-old daughter. Shot by sniper during protests in Fardis, Karaj and died from facial injuries. Two of his friends tried to transport his body by car but Islamic Republic forces prevented them and transferred the body to the coroner's office. His family faced pressure and threats when trying to retrieve the body. They were told they could only bury him if his name was registered as a 'Basiji' or if they paid 1 billion tomans. The family refused these conditions and after four days, through persistence and contacts, they retrieved the body. The family was warned they had no right to hold mourning ceremonies and were denied permission to bury him in their preferred location. According to authorities' orders, Hamed Basiri could only be buried in Eshtehard, Karaj.
Shot directly in the throat and received two bullets to the waist by security forces
Athlete and gym owner, father of two daughters aged 7 years and 4 months. Shot by IRGC forces in front of Mas'oudiyeh police station - received 3 bullets to the side and from behind the head
Shot in the neck area near the overpass in Ashrafi Isfahani, Tehran. Buried in Shiraz.

Shot while trying to help an injured citizen in front of Chalus police station during nationwide protests. He was a souvenir shop owner from Talesh, living in Chalus, working in the Sardabrud area (opposite Amir Hall). His body was handed over to his family on January 9th and buried in Masal, Gilan. He was the father of an 8-year-old son.
Killed when he was alone in Haft Tir area of Mashhad on 18 Dey. He had a seven-year-old daughter
Killed during protests in Chamgardan, Isfahan. Perpetrators identified as Hassan Karimian (head of Basij) and Sheikh Hamid Gholami

42-year-old father of three young children, owner of a furniture factory, resident of Tehran. On 18 Dey 1404 during popular protests in Tehran Pars neighborhood, he was severely injured by a bullet to the head. His brother sat beside him to help when he was targeted by two bullets. Both brothers were taken to hospital. Hamid died after 3 days of unconsciousness. Security agencies demanded 1.5 billion tomans from the family to hand over the bodies of the two brothers and forced them to sign a commitment stating the cause of death was 'brain stroke'.
Father of a daughter, shopkeeper, killed during protests by direct gunshot from government suppressive forces
Shot by security forces in Phase 4 Mehrshahr, Karaj
Firefighter who spontaneously went to provide aid to injured protesters. Shot in the throat by security forces while helping wounded protesters in front of Haft Tir police station in Mashhad

Kurdish citizen killed during popular protests in Eslamshahr, Tehran Province. Shot with two war bullets by Islamic Republic military-security forces. Security institutions forced his family to pay 200 million tomans to receive his body.

Shot and killed during protests in Chamestan along with 24 others on night of 19 Dey. Personnel at Safari Elimarat tourism complex, migrated from Radkan (Chenaran County, Razavi Khorasan) to Chamestan for work. Shot from very close range with war bullets and buckshot, targeted from waist up. Buckshot completely damaged both lungs, both kidneys, spleen and liver, four fingers of right hand were severed. Father of two sons aged 18 and 8. Wife forced to sign document claiming he died in accident to receive body and threatened not to reveal truth about his death. Authorities wanted to present him as a trained leader who came to incite unrest in Chamestan due to being non-local.
Shot by regime forces in Shahr-e Rey. Described as 'dear brother' by the poster who is mourning his death and asking people not to forget his name.
Shot by Islamic Republic suppressors during protests. Originally from Javarsan village in Arak
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Shandiz, Mashhad during the protests

Student from Likak city in Kohgiluyeh and Boyer-Ahmad province, studying foreign languages at Isfahan University in his final semester. Son of Saeed, an English and German language teacher. Abducted during protests on 18 Dey 1404 (January 8, 2026) in Isfahan and killed in detention. After several days without any official information about his whereabouts, his lifeless body was delivered to his family. Authorities claimed cause of death was 'heart attack' but severe trauma was visible on his body. Buried on 25 Dey (January 15, 2026) in Likak city under security measures.
Shot and killed by Islamic regime forces in Nazi Abad Tehran. His family was left in the dark for 10 days until his body was found in Kahrizak on January 19 and returned the next day.

Shot directly in the head by Islamic Republic suppressive forces in the 45 Metri Golshahr area. Had a master's degree in civil engineering and was unmarried. Family initially thought he was arrested and imprisoned for a week before friends informed them his body was in a Tehran morgue. Security forces did not return the body to family but transferred it to a remote cemetery in Karaj with only parents allowed to attend ceremony. Family was forced to remove the word 'Javidnam' (eternal memory) from death notices by security agents.

Son of Shapour Shirazi, resident of Anjamabad village in Shahriar. Longtime supporter of Taj Football Club and fan leader. Shot with two Kalashnikov bullets by Basij forces in abdomen and right leg during protests in Phase 1 of Andisheh around 9:00 PM on January 8. Arrested by Basij and IRGC forces and held for 12 days in IRGC detention without medical care. Died on the twelfth day of detention due to severity of injuries. Body showed severe signs of beating, bruising, and torture, especially to head and face - face was unrecognizable. Family forced to pay 600 million tomans to receive body. Buried on February 2 in cemetery of Anjamabad village, Shahriar.
History student at Farhangian University of Isfahan, killed by direct shooting from Islamic Republic suppressors

Shot and killed with war bullets on 18 Dey in Qazvin. Family is from Naserabadi village. Their voices were not heard and they were under severe government pressure and forced to make forced confessions.
Shot with war bullets by special forces, was wounded but doctors said she would recover, however they were not allowed to treat her and she was killed with a finishing shot

Kurdish citizen from Kermanshah, 54-year-old worker, shot by military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Mashhad. After several days of searching and family visits to medical centers, courts and security institutions in Mashhad, they were informed that his body was buried in one of the cemeteries in the city.

Shot in the heart on the night of 18 Dey month. His sister and niece took him to the hospital, but the hospital said he was finished. They brought him home and he was in his mother's arms until the next afternoon

Kurdish athlete from Islamabad-e Gharb (Shabad), Kermanshah Province, residing in Karaj. Shot directly by government forces during popular protests at Mosbah intersection in Karaj. War bullet hit his leg area, was taken to hospital by his wife, and died from his injuries. His body was handed over to family on Sunday 21 Dey. Due to government restrictions preventing burial in Karaj or Islamabad-e Gharb, he was finally buried on Monday 22 Dey in his paternal village in Tohlelilan county, Ilam Province.

Shot in the chest with a war bullet at the first roundabout of Fardis. Born in Zanjan. Before leaving, he told his wife: 'After I'm gone, be proud of me and hold your head high. I'm going for my daughter and girls like my daughter.'

Former footballer and football referee from Delijan, killed during protests in the Fardis area of Karaj by the criminal forces of the Islamic Republic. His body was laid to rest in his hometown of Delijan.
Gilak citizen from Ramsar, born 1376 Persian calendar (1997 Gregorian), killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces
Shot by Khamenei's agents in Satarkhan, Tehran. Resident of Simon Bolivar Boulevard, Tehran.
Kurdish citizen shot by Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) forces during popular protests in Kermanshah. His body was handed over to his family after payment of 600 million tomans.

Shot in the throat by regime mercenaries' war bullets during the popular uprising in Dey month. He held two master's degrees and had achieved rank 16 in the national technical university entrance exam. A symbol of Iranian elites who sacrificed their lives for freedom and justice despite their talent and scientific position.
Killed by IR security forces during protests in Tehranpars district. Body was released for burial but exact time, location of death, and circumstances of body release are not available.
Shot in the head by IR armed forces during protests at Haft-e-Tir Square in Mashhad. Father of a two-year-old child named Arnika. IRGC agents are trying to portray him as a state martyr.

Veterinary PhD student at Chamran University of Ahvaz, cousin of Kourosh Jalil (former political prisoner). Arrested by security forces with violence and beatings in Kianpars area of Ahvaz. Transferred to Sheiban Prison in Ahvaz where he is being held.

Shot by armed forces during suppression of popular protests in Mehrshahr area. Originally from Sarasiab neighborhood of Karaj but was targeted and killed in Mehrshahr. Was serving mandatory military service in Fordo, Qom. Had difficult family circumstances - his mother had died previously and conditions were not good after his father remarried.
Died in Gonabad during the protests

23-year-old Kurdish man from Sanqar (Kermanshah province), resident of Qarchak Tehran. Shot and killed by direct fire from government forces with war bullets during popular protests. Killed near Baqerabad police station in Qarchak by direct gunfire from forces stationed at this police headquarters.
Injured on the night of January 8, 2026 in Sari and died in hospital
Shot by direct fire from repressive forces at Haft-Hoz square in Tehran
Shot directly from behind by government suppression forces during protests in Haft Houz Square, Tehran

Shot below his left eye in Afsariyeh and taken to Baasat Hospital by his friend. During a phone outage, his friend left the hospital to inform Hossein's family. When they returned, the hospital staff said Hossein had been transferred to [text cuts off]
Father killed alongside his son Ali Javanbakht by the Islamic Republic
Kurdish citizen arrested during December protests in cities of Lumar Sirwan, Sanandaj, Kermanshah, Marivan and Urmia

Shot in the femoral artery in his leg during protests in east Tehran. Before joining the protests he had said: 'I am at peace about the security and welfare of my children and it doesn't matter what happens to me. I'm going to the protests for a better future for the next generation.'
Died in Mashhad on 18 Dey 1404

Shot in the head with a bullet in Tehran. He was from Bandar Abbas and was a graduate student in electrical engineering in Tehran and was his mother's only support. Friends have not been able to retrieve his body so far.
Shot directly with a war bullet by Islamic Republic suppression forces in Salasabil area of Tehran

Shot with 3 bullets to the heart, shoulder, and side during the national revolution around Meraj Square. Family was charged 500 million tomans to retrieve his body, which was eventually buried in Shirhasar village next to his mother's grave.
Shot by sniper on Piroozi Street
Killed in Parand

32-year-old musician and computer science graduate who was shot during protests in Narmak neighborhood. Security forces were shooting from the top of Haft-Houz Narmak mosque toward the crowd. He was hit by a bullet, likely from there, targeting the eyebrow area and completely destroying his left eye. His body was identified through fingerprints after his father searched through morgues including Kahrizak. He was a guitarist, pianist and singer who had a music shop in Narmak.
Arrested in Nowshahr on 18 Dey 1404 along with two other young men

Kurdish citizen killed during protests in Razavi Khorasan and North Khorasan provinces. Identity verified by Hengaw Organization for Human Rights as one of seven Kurdish citizens killed in the regional protests.

Shot with a bullet in the Shishehgaran area of Lahijan. Killed through deliberate shooting of unarmed protesters with direct gunfire using military weapons, specifically targeting the head and other lethal parts of the body.

11-year-old Baloch child shot directly by government forces with a war bullet that hit his chest area during popular protests in Rajaei township of Mashhad. His body was transferred to Behesht Reza cemetery in Mashhad without informing the family and was handed over to the family after four days. He was finally buried on Monday 22 Dey (January 11, 2026) in Dastgerdan cemetery in Mashhad.
Kurdish young man from Sanandaj city in Kermanshah province, resident of Qarchak in Tehran. Shot with direct gunfire by government forces during mass protests near Baghrava police station in Qarchak.
Kurdish citizen from Dehgolan arrested by security forces and held without access to lawyer or family visits. Status unknown after two weeks of detention.

30 years old from Saveh, killed by Khamenei's forces on 18 Dey (January 8, 2026). His brother Reza Badrekhani committed suicide on the third day of the memorial ceremony due to the pressure of grief from his brother's absence and their mother's wails.

Father of two children from Surak city in Mazandaran province. Was injured on Thursday January 8, 2026 during popular protests in Sari's Martyrs Square when government forces shot him directly with a live round that hit his leg. Died two weeks later on February 21, 2026 due to delayed hospital transfer and severe infection. Had avoided seeking timely medical treatment due to fear of arrest.
Shot with a live bullet below his left eye by government forces during protests in Afsarieh neighborhood of Tehran. He was severely injured and his friends immediately took him for medical treatment.

Baloch citizen working as a laborer at Marjan Dock on Kish Island. Shot directly in the chest by security forces during the suppression of popular protests. Son of Keydi, from Dastgerd Sourg village in Gowharan district, Bashagard county. His body was transferred to his hometown after 9 days and buried in Dastgerd Sourg village.

Wrestler and fitness trainer from Khorramabad, shot directly by mercenaries of the Islamic Republic during the national uprising. Authorities removed the mourning ceremony announcement banner and prohibited his family from holding any funeral ceremonies.
18-year-old only child of his family, killed in Gohardasht. Parents are now restless and very distressed.
Factory worker killed by gunfire by regime forces. He had lost his father three months earlier.
From Pirbakran city in Falavarjan, Isfahan. Commemorated by Isfahan Voice account.

20-year-old wushu athlete shot in the abdomen by Khamenei regime forces on 18 Dey in Naeen, Isfahan. Died in Isfahan hospital after authorities prevented urgent surgery. He was supporting his mother and brother financially due to his father being imprisoned for debt.
Shot in the head during protests in Nazi-abad. His body was delivered to family after five days from a warehouse in Behesht-e Zahra cemetery and buried there

Killed by anti-riot vehicle near Bagh Melli Square in Arak on Thursday night. His daughter Hiva was beside him when he died. His family is in shock and poor condition. His daughter wouldn't change her clothes for days saying they had her father's blood on them.
Killed at Seyyed Heshmat and Shahrestani intersection, mostly with heavy machine gun (doshka). Part of 61 people killed in one incident over two days.

Shot with direct bullet fire in Esfarayen. After three days, was buried in a completely security-controlled environment after family members were forced to give written commitments. Family members are under pressure. His last words were: 'Don't be afraid and publish my photo.'
Killed at Seyyed Heshmat and Shahrestani intersection, mostly with heavy machine gun (doshka). Part of 61 people killed in one incident over two days.
Shot by Islamic Republic forces with military bullets that hit his neck and eye during protests
Victim from Fardis, Karaj in Alborz province
Shot by snipers during celebrations after police were driven out of an area. Victims had gathered to dance and celebrate when snipers came and shot everyone present. Was less than 13 years old.

Shot with pellets on 19 Dey in Golshahr, Karaj. Initially wounded lightly but was arrested and taken to Qezelhesar Prison. Killed inside prison. Family was forced to declare him a martyr. Family was deceived for 2 weeks with promises of release in exchange for salary slips, but he had already been killed.

Kurdish citizen shot in the leg by Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps forces during popular protests in Islamabad-e Gharb, Kermanshah Province. Died in hospital due to severe bleeding. Buried on 20 Dey (January 10, 2026) in Ban Ganjab village.
18-year-old killed by Islamic regime forces in Mashhad

Shot with live bullets by police forces at Emamiyeh police station in Mashhad. Was a bakery worker in the Meaad neighborhood, Qasemabad district of Mashhad. Family was not allowed to hold funeral ceremonies in the local mosque.

Shot with 12 war bullets by the Islamic Republic. Had made a will requesting to remain anonymous and said he was going so that strangers far from home and orphans of the homeland could achieve their rights. Chanted freedom slogans until his last moment

Shot with approximately 120 pellets in the back on 17 Dey (January 6, 2026) in Kermanshah. Despite this, came to the streets again on 19 Dey (January 8, 2026) where he was targeted from behind with war bullets by Islamic Republic forces and died in his mother's arms who was with him. His body was buried in Saraeilan village.
First casualty in Khorramabad on the evening of 18 Dey month. Father of two children. From a large tribe and they will certainly avenge his blood.

Shot with war bullet to the heart at close range on Siman Road in Mashhad, leading to immediate death. After three days, his family found his body and security forces forced them to bury him in his father's village in Sangan, Razavi Khorasan province
17-year-old student from Zanjan shot and killed by government security forces

21-year-old soldier who was on leave. Was outside on Thursday 18 Dey (January 8, 2026) when he fled from suppression forces but they caught up with him in Hammam Sheik alley in Shahroud where he was hit by a war bullet. Was taken to hospital too late to save his life.

Shot directly by Basij and IRGC forces during popular protests. Bullet hit his heart area, causing his death. From Babameydan, a suburb of Noorabad Mamasani. His gravestone bears the inscription 'For what sin were you killed?' representing the family's quest for justice and collective conscience of society.
Among 40-50 people who lost their lives in the city of Alvand, Qazvin province on the night of 18 Dey
Died with Iran's name on his lips according to his brother's testimony. Brother states he will not let his blood remain on the ground, suggesting he was killed.
Killed at Seyyed Heshmat and Shahrestani intersection, mostly with heavy machine gun (doshka). Part of 61 people killed in one incident over two days.

18-year-old first-semester mechanical engineering student, originally from Quchan and residing in Mashhad, killed by gunfire from Islamic Republic mercenaries on Haft-e Tir Boulevard in Mashhad. He was targeted and shot in the evening and died from his injuries. Authorities prevented his family from holding a funeral ceremony.

Kurdish citizen from Javanrud arrested by Ministry of Intelligence forces at his family home. Being held in Kermanshah Intelligence Department detention center without family visitation rights or access to lawyer.
