Shot by Islamic Republic forces during protests in Mamasani. He was a boxer. His mother had previously lost 5 other children for reasons unrelated to protests.

Shot with direct gunfire to the head with war bullets on Pasdaran Street in Tehran. The Shahid Foundation approached his family offering blood money and a 5-day trip to Mashhad in exchange for declaring him a martyr, which the family rejected.
Killed by Islamic Republic's suppression forces and Velayat-e Faqih mercenaries in Milajerd, a suburb of Arak
Shot directly by Khamenei's forces during people's protests in front of the governorate building in Bandar Ganaveh, Bushehr
Mother of a 10-year-old child from Neyshabur. Shot directly by government suppression forces during people's protests in front of her house.

Shot in the heart with a war bullet in the evening in Shahin-Vila neighborhood of Karaj. He was a student who loved rap music and writing lyrics. He had recently started a Telegram channel where he published his rap videos. He was passionate about styling, studied, and worked at the same time.
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Shahrqods, Tehran. Born 1369 (Persian calendar).
Kurdish citizen killed during popular protests in the provinces of Ilam, Tehran, Alborz, Markazi, Kermanshah and Isfahan
Sunni student from Larestan residing in Bandar Abbas, killed during protests by regime mercenaries

University student originally from Harmoud village and resident of Bandar Abbas, shot and killed by direct gunfire from government forces while returning home with his brother on the evening of Thursday, January 8, 2026
46-year-old veteran wrestling champion and father of two teenagers from Fereydunkenar, Mazandaran province, shot directly in the neck with a bullet during popular protests

Shot directly by security forces while protesting with hope in his heart and empty hands. Authorities did not allow a funeral ceremony to be held for him, and he was buried in silence under government pressure.
Listed in Iran International Memorial database as a victim

Kurdish Yarsan citizen from Sahne, 38 years old and father of one child, shot by military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Fardis, Karaj. His funeral was held in the village of Dele (Dahlaq) in Sahne

Shot in the heart with a war bullet. Her last written words on paper were shared by her mother on social media. Described as an innocent and honorable child who was killed and then labeled as a terrorist.
Killed on Haft-e Tir street in Mashhad. Was a 25-year-old tattoo artist described as brave and fiery in opposition to the regime
Died on Thursday 18 Dey in Tehranpars area of Tehran. Described as someone who sacrificed their life for freedom and the homeland.
Father to a thirteen-year-old son, killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic regime forces
Killed during protests in Chamgardan, Isfahan. Perpetrators identified as Hassan Karimian (head of Basij) and Sheikh Hamid Gholami
Death on 18 Dey 1404 in Rasht, birth year 1357 Persian calendar
Shot by military weapons in Qasemabad, Mashhad. Body was buried in block 67 of Behesht-e Reza cemetery.

Kurdish citizen from Takab residing in Karaj. Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Fardis, Karaj on Thursday evening 18 Dey 1404. His young child who was with him was also injured in the incident. His body was handed over to the family by security institutions after receiving 400 million tomans and was buried on 24 Dey 1404 in his birth village 'Guyaghaj' in Takab county, West Azerbaijan province.

Shot dead at point-blank range by regime security forces during protests on the evening of Thursday, January 8, 2026. Her body was returned to the family under heavy pressure; the funeral took place in silence and fear.

Kurdish citizen from Javanrud arrested by Ministry of Intelligence forces at his family home. Being held in Kermanshah Intelligence Department detention center without family visitation rights or access to lawyer.

21-year-old Kurdish citizen, follower of Yarsani faith from Dalahu in Kermanshah province. Killed during popular protests on one of the streets in Dowlatabad neighborhood of Kermanshah by direct gunfire from government forces, with a war bullet hitting his heart area.

Internationally renowned sculptor with 15 years of experience in sculpture and teaching, winner of numerous awards, father of two children, killed by regime's repressive forces with direct gunfire. Next to his self-made lion statue, he had written: 'My Iran, my love, I love you, wake up…'
Arrested on 19 Dey in Shahnaz area of Tabriz, forcibly disappeared, family and friends unsure if they should search for a body or hope she is still alive

21-year-old second-semester psychology student from Khartut, North Khorasan, living in Tehran. Shot directly in the side by government suppression forces during people's protests. Family transported her body 800 kilometers from Tehran to Khorasan on ice to return her to her birthplace for burial.

Student shot by security forces with war bullets during protests in Tehran. Her body was transported approximately 800 kilometers under unusual conditions with ice placed on the corpse to be buried in her family's hometown, Khartoot village in North Khorasan province.

Oil company engineer working in Asaluyeh. Arrived in Mashhad on Thursday morning January 8th, went out at 7 PM, phone stopped responding at 8:30 PM and was turned off. Body found a week later at Behesht-e Reza morgue. Shot with one bullet to the head and shotgun pellets (at least 40 pellets) to the stomach at close range. Rope marks visible on hands and neck indicating he was tied up. Originally from Radkan city, Chenaran county, Razavi Khorasan province. Had a 7-year-old daughter and owned a company in the new technologies park on Mashhad-Chenaran road. Inventor with patents for high-pressure oil well pumps.
Shot in the head by regime security forces on Palestine Street in Qazvin
17-year-old child killed by direct gunfire from government forces during popular protests in Parand city. War bullet hit his head.
Shot by government mercenary forces during the violent suppression of popular protests. Originally from Kuhdasht county.

Shot by suppressor forces on Thursday 18 Dey 1404. Family was told they had to pay a large amount to receive the body, but they couldn't afford it. Body was declared by Basij forces. Bakhtiari ethnicity.
From Bazoft, Bakhtiari province. Shot directly by suppression forces in Isfahan on 19 Dey 1404, was wounded and taken to hospital where agents abducted him and executed him with a coup de grâce shot
Killed during uprising on 18-19 Dey in Mashhad. Restaurant manager of Solo restaurant in Hashemieh district of Mashhad.
43-year-old father of one child, shot directly by government forces during peaceful protests and gatherings with economic demands in Isfahan
Shot directly by suppression forces. From Gahrow in Bakhtiari Province.
Killed during protests on 18 Dey in Arak. Body was returned to family only after threats and guarantees from family members. Had gotten married 4 months before his death.

25-year-old worker from Ab-Motor neighborhood, employee at a shop in Bagh Sepahsalar area of Tehran. Shot directly by government agents in Piroozi Street while trying to help another wounded young man. Was shot in the neck and died hours later.
45-year-old unmarried resident of Varamin, killed by direct gunshot to the chest by government suppressive forces during people's protests at Qarchak Police Station Square

Shot with bullets in Rasht. He was known as Mehyar Sanse, an actor, comedian, blogger, boutique owner, social media activist and charity worker. Father of two young children, Melor and Eihan. Killed for standing with the people against the criminal and oppressive regime.

Student of dramatic literature at Iqbal Lahori University in Mashhad. Shot directly by a sniper positioned on top of Emamiyeh Qasemabad police station in Mashhad around 23:00. Died from gunshot wound. Initially pronounced dead at the scene, then rushed to nearest clinic but died before receiving medical treatment. Plainclothes officer at clinic mockingly told companions 'You deserved it'. Body withheld from family for four days with condition to identify him as 'Basiji' which family refused. Family eventually received body without accepting this condition. Shahid Foundation later contacted family to identify him as 'martyr' which family rejected.
Killed by agents/authorities on 18 Dey. From Khorramabad, Lorestan province.

Shot with war bullet by government forces during national revolution in Shahrak Moalem neighborhood of Kermanshah. Economics student and professional tanbur player from Yarsan religious minority. Had previously lost her mother and was caring for her younger sister. Buried in her hometown of Karand-e Gharb on January 10, 2026 with traditional Chamari mourning ceremony.

16-year-old Kurdish girl from Karandgharb in Dalahu county, Kermanshah province. Shot with live ammunition by Islamic Republic suppression forces during protests in Kermanshah's Shahrak Moalem neighborhood on Thursday evening, January 8, 2026. Buried in Karandgharb on January 10, 2026 with traditional Kurdish mourning ceremony (Chamari) with drums and zurna.

Radiology specialist who was killed on 18 Dey while going to her daughter's house for her daughter's wedding. Shot with pellets that riddled her body like a strainer. The bride and groom each also received 27 pellets. She was killed on the spot and authorities requested her husband to register her as a martyr, which he refused.
17-year-old from Doroud, Lorestan. Killed in Eslamshahr on Thursday 18 Dey

Had just turned 18 in Azar month (November-December). Told his family that security forces were shooting at girls' feet with pellets and that he and others were going to stand in front of them to protect them. The day before, he excitedly told his sister he wanted to buy a motorcycle and was saving up money.

13-year-old Lor child from Chenarsofli (Sheikh) village in Asadabad, Hamadan Province. Shot with direct fire by government forces with a war bullet in front of his family home during popular protests.
Shot in the heart by government forces during peaceful protests in Fardis, Karaj

Father of two daughters aged 17 and 13. Arrested on Thursday night 18 Dey in Afsariyeh neighborhood of Tehran according to friends. Family was kept unaware of his fate for two weeks until Shahid Foundation called to inform them of his death. Shot in the heart. Face was destroyed and daughters were not allowed to see their father's face for the last time.
Bodybuilder shot directly by suppression forces in front of Aligudarz Seminary in Lorestan province during the national Iranian revolution against the Islamic Republic
Shot in the head by a bullet in Saadat Abad, Tehran. Described as leaving her story unfinished

Went to Mehrshahr, Karaj on Thursday for a protest call and has not returned. Her aunt is asking people to share her photo to help find where she was killed and where to search for her body. No authorities have provided any answers about her whereabouts.

Shot in the neck with a war bullet in Sa'adat Abad area of Tehran. Transferred to Bahman Hospital where she died. Single, worked as a nail technician. Buried on 20 Dey 1404 in Behesht-e Zahra cemetery section 327, row 141, number 117.
Shot directly in the side while in Rasht, died on the way to hospital

21-year-old Baloch student shot in the back of the head with war bullets by suppressive forces. She was from Anbarabad. After her killing, her family was pressured to remain silent. She is the eleventh identified Baloch martyr in the nationwide protests.
Shot directly by government suppression forces during popular protests in Isfahan
Shot by security forces during anti-regime protest. Originally from Dehloran city but killed in Tehran.
Killed during the 2025-2026 protests. The poster learned of his death through friends' Instagram stories and is the poster's cousin (son of poster's uncle).

Known as 'Masoud Fanar', athlete in bodybuilding, gymnastics, parkour, free-running and ninjutsu. Shot with two bullets by Islamic Republic forces while helping wounded people on Mesbah Street in Karaj. Security forces prevented people and his brother from approaching to provide aid and stood over his body and about 10 other wounded people for some time to prevent assistance. Was a provincial and national champion in various sports disciplines and worked as a trainer teaching martial arts to children and teenagers in the Mesbah neighborhood.

37-year-old Kurdish man from Sarpol-e Zahab county in Kermanshah province. Shot with military bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Tehran on Friday evening 19 Dey 1404. Body was identified and retrieved by family after one week of follow-up in Tehran. Scheduled to be buried on Thursday 2 Bahman 1404 in Kose-hai Pataq village cemetery in Sarpol-e Zahab county.

Shot and killed in Dovom Square in Fardis, Karaj. Security forces prevented his burial at Behesht-e Sakineh cemetery and forced burial in Mahdasht without any ceremony. Condolence banners were torn down by security forces.
Shot by snipers during celebrations after police were driven out of an area. Victims had gathered to dance and celebrate when snipers came and shot everyone present.

Renowned bodybuilding champion and son of veteran coach Majid Zatparvar, shot directly by government forces. Asian Youth Championship winner in Japan in 2011, world champion in 2012 and 2013, 2012 Overall Champion, 2013 national team selection championship winner. Body was taken to Kahrizak after death and was supposed to be moved to Behesht-e Zahra for burial.

Shot on Khaqani Street in Isfahan during a night operation involving closing off the street on 19 Dey and trapping people from both sides. 10 other people were also killed at the same moment. Body was returned after one week.
Murdered by the Islamic Regime during protests demanding freedom

24-year-old protester from Talash shot with war bullet during protests. Family received his body after two days in exchange for payment. Had sent messages to relatives before joining protests expressing hope for the end of the Islamic Republic and return of the Pahlavi monarchy.

Shot in the chest during protests in Shahroud. Had traveled from Gorgan with friends to participate in protests. Was in contact with family until around 8 PM on the day of his death. The bullet completely destroyed his heart tissue. His body was returned to family after four days on Monday 22 Dey and transported to Gorgan, buried on Tuesday without religious ceremonies. He had a private business in bodybuilding and intended to migrate to Turkey.
Shot and killed during protests in Shahroud. Family member from Gorgan alongside Sinahaq-shenas.
Shot with war ammunition while operating a home appliances store with his brother in Gorgan. Described as polite, well-behaved, and truly human. His mother and aunt were customers of his store.
Gilak citizen from Sangachin village in Bandar Anzali area, killed by direct gunfire from forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran in Bandar Anzali on either 18 or 19 Dey 1404
Killed during government forces' attack on Thursday Bazaar in Astaneh-ye Ashrafiyeh. Body was transferred to Lahijan and buried there. Gilaki citizen from Lahijan.
Shot in the chest (اصابت گلوله به سینه). Body was returned to family with conditions of no public ceremony and no banner installation, buried in Firouzabad cemetery
Killed by security forces during protests in Fardis, Karaj
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Shahreh Qods, Tehran during the protests
Killed in Sidi district of Mashhad. Family was pressured by killers to claim he was a Basij member, but he had clearly declared his views on his social media page
Shot by suppressive forces on Piroozi Street in Tehran during protests. Single resident of Tehran who protested against the Islamic Republic's tyranny, inflation, and suppression.
Killed by Khamenei's mercenaries in Rasht on 19 Dey
Bodybuilder and gas pipeline worker from Shahreza, Isfahan Province. Came to the streets following Prince Reza Pahlavi's call. Shot in the head by suppression forces.
Died in Mashhad on January 8, 2026 during the Iranian protests
Machinist who was wounded by live ammunition on Friday in Fardis, Karaj and died in hospital on Monday morning
17-year-old boxer shot from behind the head with a bullet in Zanjan
Shot by suppression forces. Person is from the Lor ethnic group.
26-year-old from Hamedan. His hands were tied and he was shot with a final bullet.
Lur ethnicity, from Yazdanshahr, targeted and killed by suppression forces

Kickboxing athlete who was shot by suppressive forces after leaving a sports club with his students, trying to protect them from the protest chaos. Died in hospital from severe injuries and internal bleeding

Shot and killed by suppression forces in Nazi Abad, Tehran, across from the police station. He was hit by 7-8 bullets, with two bullets hitting his head. He had recently completed his military service and had studied accounting.

Shot with a war bullet in the waist from behind in District 19 of Tehran, Khaniabad, in front of Shekar Banu pastry shop. Despite the possibility of survival, agents prevented his rapid transfer to hospital, and this delay caused him to die from the severity of his injuries. His body was eventually handed over to his family after receiving a 'bullet fee' and was buried on Sunday in Behesht Zahra, section 225. Family and friends described him as a peaceful, kind person who loved animals and nature, who died innocently and in silence.
Shot in the leg on 18 Dey (January 8, 2026). Due to fear of being arrested if he went to the hospital, he went home instead. He bled so much that he died a few hours later. Father of two children.
Shot by suppression forces. From the Lor ethnic group.
Single, athlete and student. Died from direct fire in Tehranpars.
Shot while bending down to pick up a stone during protests. Was the youngest child of his family.
Shot by regime forces while bending down to pick up a stone. He was the youngest child of his family
Medical student arrested on 18 Dey in Tabriz. Held in central prison with no case file or clear legal status. Described as in limbo, defenseless, behind bars. This is an illegal detention.

Youth football coach and founder of the 'Mahan Novin' football school, known to those close to him as Milad. Shot directly with live ammunition by Islamic Republic forces during protest in Narmak (Dardasht neighborhood) on Thursday evening. Wounded after heavy gunfire by security forces, died on the way to hospital. Family was forced to transfer his body to Kahrizak where agents demanded 400 million tomans in exchange for releasing his body.

Shot with war bullet from behind by Basij mercenaries during the Lion and Sun Revolution in Malakshahr neighborhood of Isfahan. His body was buried in Behesht-e Masumeh cemetery in Shahin Shahr, Isfahan after one week of uncertainty

Shot in the heart with a bullet. He was from Arak but living in Tehran, an only child and caretaker for his mother, working as a hairdresser. After his death, security agencies pressured his family to declare he was a 'Basiji' member, but his mother refused to accept this forced narrative despite threats, unwilling to let her son's true identity be distorted.
Killed during attack on Thursday market in Astaneh on 18 Dey 1404. His full name was Mehdi (Mohammad Javad) Pourkarim and he was buried in Lahijan.
Shot with 3 bullets in Tehranpars. Father was seen at Behesht-e Zahra cemetery wearing a photo of his son pinned to his chest

Recently married man (newly wed) from Khvansar, Isfahan, killed by direct gunshot to the head. Despite authorities preventing and taking pledges from the conscienceless officials from the family and making many threats without media coverage, around 5-6 people from the community participated in a very magnificent funeral ceremony for him.

Father of Mani Shafiei, killed simultaneously during protests by direct gunshot to the heart area. Government institutions demanded 500 million tomans from the family for returning the bodies of both victims.
Sculptor killed by the Islamic Republic regime in Iran
Among 40-50 people who lost their lives in the city of Alvand, Qazvin province on the night of 18 Dey
Shot by suppression forces in Larahel, Isfahan. Name indicates male gender (Mehran is a Persian male name).
Killed during popular protests by baton strikes from government forces. His body was handed over to his family one week later at 4 AM and quickly buried.

37-year-old from Isfahan, arrested on the street in Isfahan and killed under torture by the Islamic Republic regime on 18 Dey. Under torture, his skull and ribs were broken and a rib entered his heart, causing death from internal bleeding.
Barber from Lahijan, killed during the protests in Lahijan near Enqelab Square. Originally from the village of Zemidan.

Young barber from Zemeydan village near Lahijan who loved nature, animals, and motorcycling. Shot in the side during protests at Enghelab Square while rushing to help a wounded woman. Bullet exited through his stomach. Authorities withheld his body but his father forcibly took it and drove to the cemetery.

Young artist and hairstylist who worked in music production and accessory sales at AS Man boutique. Gunned down by bullets of Islamic Republic forces in his own city. Remembered as joyful, nature-loving, energetic, and fiercely loyal companion. Grave photo inscription reads 'Soldier of the Path of Light'.

59-year-old civil engineer who worked for an oil company, from Tehran. Shot in the chest by suppressive forces during people's protests in Sadeghiyeh Square. His body was handed over to family in Kahrizak and buried in Behesht-e Zahra cemetery.

Shot with two war bullets while providing aid to the wounded during the brutal massacre at Rasht Bazaar by Islamic Republic's suppressive forces. Has two children. His body was not delivered to his family for four days and was finally buried on Sunday night at 9:30 PM. Family is under security and psychological pressure.

Father of a 6-month-old daughter. Killed by direct shot to the head from half a meter distance while attempting to rescue and transport an injured girl. His body was identified by family after 8 days among many victims in Bagh Rezvan Isfahan and buried in silence after giving undertaking without permission for announcement

Born 25 Bahman 1386, shot in the side while returning home, killed by gunshot. Family was unaware until the next day when the hospital called saying their son had been shot, and when they went to the hospital he had already died.
17 years old, taekwondo practitioner with 3rd dan black belt. Targeted with direct fire in Tehranpars and killed.
Shot in the head by security forces in Qaleh Hassan Khan, Tehran. Family is under security pressure to prevent information dissemination.

Chemical engineering graduate with master's degree, PhD candidate, from Dorud in Lorestan province, resident of Tehran. Shot by Islamic Republic forces during protests. Body was eventually retrieved from Kahrizak. Burial ceremony in Dorud was held under heavy security presence and strict controls, with attendees chanting 'Death to Khamenei'.

Shot and killed by Khamenei's criminal forces with bullets in the city of Saveh, Markazi Province. Government spokesperson Fatemeh Mohajerani had previously referenced his case during election campaigns, saying they wanted to ensure no more Mehrshads would be killed.
Lor freedom-seeking youth from Mamasani. Killed by direct gunfire from security forces. Body was buried in his birthplace, Moraskhooon village, Mamasani county.

3-year-old child killed by blind shooting and shotgun pellets by security forces on Taghbostan Boulevard. Security agencies pressured her family to blame protesters for the killing, claims that were denied by witnesses.
Shot by Basij forces affiliated with the Islamic Republic of Iran government in the city of Kiashahr. Gilaki citizen from Bandar Kiashahr port in Gilan province
Married, resident of Tehranpars, Amin Street (Khaksefid). Owner of a pickup truck and mobile cafe. Shot with bullets in Amin Street, Tehranpars during direct fire by suppressive forces.

Kurdish citizen from Kermanshah, killed by live ammunition fired by state agents during protests on Taq-e Bostan Boulevard. He had celebrated his engagement ceremony only four days prior to this incident.
Bodybuilding champion killed by suppression forces in the evening during the Iranian national revolution in Shahed Shahr, Karaj
Died in Qeshm (Dargahan area) during protests
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime

Shot with war bullet (Kalashnikov) during popular protests in Ilam city. Burial permit listed cause of death as lung and heart rupture due to bullet impact to chest cage. Memorial ceremony held on 24 Dey (January 13, 2026) at Behesht-e Reza Ilam cemetery.

22-year-old mechanical engineering student and teacher from Rasht. Shot directly by IRGC suppression forces around 8 PM on one of Rasht's streets during the massacre of people in Rasht. Hit by bullet and killed during popular protests. Described as good-natured, popular, responsible and committed person who earned trust and respect through honesty and purity. His body was buried at night on Sunday under security atmosphere.
Shot in the side/flank in Tehranpars

From Kermanshah, had come to Tehran for work, killed by Islamic Republic regime suppression forces. Family under severe pressure and forced into silence by regime threats and intimidation to prevent disclosure of crime details

30-year-old son of Hooriyeh Faraj Zadeh, sister of the late Shahram Faraj Zadeh who was killed under police vehicle wheels during Ashura in 2009. He was one of the signatories of the 14-person statement and was arrested and imprisoned on 18 Dey. Family is under severe threats.
Shot with live ammunition in Maskan neighborhood of Kermanshah. He was a car battery maker who worked in Karaj and had returned to his hometown during the national uprising.

Kurdish citizen from Kermanshah, shot directly with war bullets by government suppressive forces during popular protests in the Maskan neighborhood. His body was buried on Sunday 21 Dey at Bagh Ferdous Cemetery in Kermanshah.
Shot directly by regime suppression forces during protests in Meymand, Fars Province

Location of Death: Nowsher village, Khoshkbijar district, Gilan province
Notes: Shot directly by Islamic Republic forces during local popular uprising. Targeted with live ammunition by forces from the Nowsher Basij base and killed instantly after being shot in the throat.

Shot directly in the stomach from a rooftop in Nazi Abad. The bullet went through his body. Body was not returned to family initially. Kept for 5 days on the ground in the courtyard at Kahrizak. Authorities demanded 1.7 billion (tomans) as 'bullet fee' to return the body, threatening to bury him as their own martyr if family couldn't pay. Family was threatened that if they protested, the body would be taken somewhere no one could find it. Described as someone who loved life, worked, and was very kind.
Judo champion, shot and killed by plainclothes security officer using unlicensed Samand car

Football coach shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces during protests in Narmak. He lived in Pasdaran but went to visit family in Narmak and then planned to join protests with friends. He was shot and initially survived when family reached him, but died in the car on the way to hospital.
Shot in the heart by gunfire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces. Gilaki citizen from Bandar Anzali
Shot and killed, four bullets hit his body from the direction of Qasem Soleimani statue. From Khorramabad. Funeral held on January 22 in a security-controlled environment.

Worker from Kermanshah. Family was in severe financial distress. Parents are elderly with no access to social media. Authorities forced family to either declare him a Basij member or pay 1 billion tomans for the bullets that hit him to receive his body. Family could not afford the payment.

Son of Naser, resident of Shahr-e Rey, Salehin area. Shot directly in the neck by government forces in Nazi-abad neighborhood of Tehran. The bullet to the neck caused his death. Part of the deadly use of firearms against unarmed citizens during suppression of popular protests.

Kurdish young man from Salmas who was injured and arrested by security forces during protests on 18 Dey (January 8, 2026) in Tehran. His body was returned to family after 12 days on 30 Dey (January 19, 2026) without any explanation from security institutions. It remains unclear whether he died from severity of gunshot wounds or was killed under torture after arrest.

Gilak citizen living in Karaj and father of two daughters, shot directly with live ammunition to the forehead by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran during nationwide protests in the Sarasiyab area of Karaj on Enghelab Boulevard. His body was buried anonymously in Behesht Zahra and his family was prevented from holding public ceremonies and freely informing about how he was killed.

Shot from behind with direct gunfire by Islamic Republic forces while going to help an injured person during protests. Body identified in Kahrizak. Family confirmed baton marks on his head, but body was not wounded elsewhere - cause of death was gunshot from behind. Was unmarried and described as kind, passionate, good-hearted and humanitarian who stepped forward to help an injured person instead of fleeing.
Killed during protests in Shahreza on bloody days of 18-19 Dey by direct gunfire with war bullets or pellets
21-year-old Kurdish man shot with direct fire from IRGC forces during popular protests in Zarneh city on the evening of Thursday 18 Dey 1404

Young footballer originally from Khoy. First shot and wounded in Tehran, then taken to hospital by his father. While his father was away getting medication, security forces came and shot him in the forehead.
Shot directly by Islamic Republic forces with an AK-47 during the national uprising. Died after being struck by a bullet.
Kurdish youth from Ilam residing in Golshahr Karaj, shot directly in the heart with war bullets by Islamic Republic criminals during protests

Shot directly by suppressive forces during popular protests in the Haft-e Tir area of Karaj. His body was transferred to Hasankad village in Asara district of Karaj, his family's birthplace, and buried under security restrictions.
25-year-old killed on 18 Dey. Tweet mentions decorating his car like a wedding car and scattering sweets and congratulations at his grave.

Lur citizen from Nahavand, Hamedan province, residing in Tehran. Shot with war bullets during protests on Thursday 18 Dey by government suppression forces. Died Friday 19 Dey from injuries sustained from the shooting.
35-year-old computer science student killed by war bullets fired by Islamic Republic suppression forces on the first day of Prince Reza Pahlavi's call
Shot by suppressive forces during people's protests
33-year-old wrestler shot directly in the forehead with war bullet by security forces
Commemorated by someone referring to him as 'brother' (داداش), suggesting he died during protests. The phrase 'جواب خون با خونِ' (blood will be answered with blood) indicates violent death

Killed during nationwide protests in Tehran. Gilak citizen from Gurab Zarmikh, resident of Tehran. After his death, security agencies attempted to portray him as a 'Basiji' member, but a close relative protested stating that Mohammad Aftabi was a protester and freedom seeker who was killed by government forces. His family was put under pressure and not allowed to publicly or through media report about how he was killed. His body was buried in his birthplace, Gurab Zarmikh.
Shot with Kalashnikov rifle in the waist area by Islamic Republic suppressive forces in the evening
Shot by government forces during protests in Mahshahr. Government agents forced his family to hold the burial ceremony before 6 AM and did not allow them to hold mourning ceremonies afterward.
From Shushtar, became eternal on 18 Dey (martyred/killed). Social media post asks for sharing as he has no one

17-year-old student who worked at a car wash to support his living expenses, killed by direct gunfire from government forces during popular protests in Fouladshahr, Isfahan. His body was buried on January 19, 2026

Also known as Mohammad Molayeri. Originally from Malayer county, Hamadan province. Shot directly by regime snipers while riding a motorcycle in Marlik, Karaj. His body was returned to his family several days later on condition that he not be buried in Karaj. Family buried him in his paternal birthplace, Dahnau Ali-Abad village in Malayer county.

Kurdish citizen who owned several clothing stores in Kermanshah. Shot in the chest with a war bullet by Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Kermanshah. Funeral held on 23 Dey at 'Bagh Ferdows' in the city.
Shot in the stomach with military bullets by regime mercenaries. Described as Iran-loving, very polite, kind and beloved. Family requested his name and photo to be shared.
Kurdish citizen killed by direct gunfire from IRGC forces during protests on Fermandar Boulevard in Malekshahi, Ilam province, while passing in front of the Basij Resistance building
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Alvand, Qazvin during the protests

42-year-old coffee shop owner in Sari, Mazandaran, shot at close range with military weapons by Basij forces who entered his coffee shop demanding closure and claiming he intended to shelter protesters. After he refused and requested a judicial warrant, an argument ensued and Basij forces shot him directly with military bullets. Father of a daughter named Ava, known to friends as 'Ava's father'.
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime in Narmak, Tehran

18-year-old high school senior was filming protests with his mobile phone at Behesht Square in Nazi Abad when he was shot from behind by military and security forces with a war bullet. The bullet entered through his lower back and exited through his heart. He died two days after his birthday. His family is under severe pressure and has been threatened that his grave will be opened and his body removed.

25-year-old from Valiabad village in Gonbad-e Kavous. Injured by Islamic Republic government agents on the night of 18 Dey 1404, then arrested and transferred to an IRGC detention center where he was killed during detention. Was alive when transferred to detention but died as a direct result of IRGC forces' treatment during detention. His death occurred within a recurring pattern of protester suppression involving arrest, violence, and physical elimination with complete impunity for perpetrators.

Shot and killed by four war bullets in Nabard neighborhood, Piroozi district of Tehran. His family is under pressure from security forces. His will was simple: Say my name so much that my little son will be proud of me.
Father of two, died due to suffocation caused by inhalation of chemical substances and tear gas

Shot directly in the heart in Doroud, Lorestan. At least 17 people were killed in Doroud on 18-19 Dey, but due to the small size of the city and extremely tight security conditions, only a few names have been made public.

Shot directly with bullet by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic in Sabzeh Meydan (Green Square) Rasht during suppression of popular protests. Died due to severity of injuries from bullet impact.
Arab citizen from Ma'sho (Mahshahr), son of Jamal, shot in the heart by Iranian Islamic Republic security forces during nationwide protests
Described as having given his life for others, referred to as having put his life on the line

Shot in the forehead with a war bullet during protests on Vakil Abad Boulevard, Haft Tir area in Mashhad. Employee of Academic Jihad (Jahad Daneshgahi) in Mashhad. His body was found after 10 days of persistent family searches. Regime forces only allowed burial in his hometown Kashmar if he was introduced as a 'martyr', which the family refused. He was ultimately buried in Behesht Reza cemetery in Mashhad.

24-year-old barista shot directly with a bullet in front of his workplace door. The legal analysis notes this as a clear violation of the right to life and prohibition of lethal force against citizens, constituting direct criminal responsibility for commanders and perpetrators. Part of a broader pattern of systematic killing of citizens across different cities.
Café owner killed by regime assassins
15-year-old boxer from Khorramabad killed in the Masour neighborhood, shot dead by Islamic Republic security forces during protests
Young man killed in East Tehran
Died in front of the courthouse in Qazvin during Dey month
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Tehran during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests

15-year-old boxer from Khorramabad shot directly by suppression forces in Masour neighborhood during the national revolution against the Islamic Republic. Security forces returned his body to the family on condition that no funeral ceremony be held, to be buried in media silence.

Azerbaijani compatriot from Karaj who stood alone and defenseless against security forces to protect others' lives. He did not flee or retreat; he used his body as a shield for others' lives. The regime's response was shooting from close range - a bullet from about one meter away that took his life. This murder was the result of one person's courage and a government's terror.

Kurdish citizen from Kermanshah, shot directly by government forces during popular protests on Golsarkh street. Was targeted from behind with a war bullet while being chased by government forces and died.
Shot in the head with a military bullet while inside a car at 8 PM on the 19th of Dey. Originally from Pashaki but residing in Fardis, Karaj
Killed in Astaneh, Gilan province

MMA athlete shot directly by suppression forces while helping a wounded protester at 9:30 PM in Pasdaran neighborhood of Masjed Soleyman. Security forces later buried him as a 'martyred Basiji' with security arrangements at Behesht-e Zahra cemetery in Charbisheh on Dey 25, 1404 at 4 AM. His Instagram photos and videos were removed by security forces.

63-year-old Iran Air employee who was first wounded in the hand during confrontation with suppression forces in Tehranpars on 19 Dey, then killed with two direct shots to the heart. His body was buried three days later in Behesht Zahra cemetery

Kurdish citizen from Ashkhaneh village in Samalqan, 21-year-old worker, shot in the heart with a military bullet by Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Bumehen city, Tehran province. Family identified his body in Kahrizak after a week of being unaware and searching. Burial ceremony held on 24 Dey in Chekhmaqloo village, North Khorasan province.

24-year-old Lor citizen from Lendeh city in Kohgiluyeh and Boyer-Ahmad province, shot directly by suppressive forces during Friday evening protests in Bushehr. Government institutions extorted 450 million tomans from his family in exchange for delivering his body and pressured them to cover up the government killing of their son and blame protesters for his death.

Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppression forces on Keshavarzi Street in Isfahan. The bullet hit his heart area causing immediate death. After this crime, security forces put his family under pressure and threats.
Father of 2 children. Shot from behind with a war bullet in Malekshahr, Isfahan

Kurdish youth from Kermanshah, son of Mahmoud, shot and killed with live ammunition by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests on Taghbostan Boulevard. His body was buried on Saturday 20 Dey 1404 at Bagh Ferdous cemetery.

Shot with direct gunfire by government forces near the Isfahan Metro Bridge. Two military bullets hit his side and one bullet hit his chest cavity. Family was forced under threat to claim he was a Basij member or they would not receive his body. Body was withheld from family for one week until they complied with forced interview. From Barsian village in Isfahan suburbs.
Killed in Azimiyeh, Karaj area
Died in Shiraz
Electrical engineering student at Ferdowsi University of Mashhad. Killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic forces on 18 Dey 1404.

Killed in Sadeghieh area of Tehran

Computer engineering student at Yazd University who had transferred to Isfahan University and was in his 7th semester. Shot with pellets to the artery by Islamic Republic forces in the streets of Isfahan during protests following Reza Pahlavi's call

Computer engineering student who recently transferred from Yazd University to Isfahan University. Killed by shotgun pellets fired by suppressive forces during protests. Was active in web design and user interface work, focusing on making digital product user experiences simpler and more practical.

Shot in the chest by gunfire from rooftop at northern Arg area in Neyshabur. Described as a 40-year-old man who was handsome, tall, kind-hearted, always smiling, brought joy wherever he went, had 3 children who loved each other, was friends with his children, and helped anyone however he could.
Shot directly by regime suppression forces during protests in Meymand, Fars Province
Shot by the Islamic regime. Described as a young athlete.
Shot in the neck by direct fire from IRGC forces during protests. Family had to pay billions in toman just to retrieve his body.

Shot in the stomach with a war bullet on 18 Dey street (around Clock Square) in Sari. Was a 37-year-old unmarried man who worked in building installations. His body was buried two days later on 20 Dey in Zeyd Alya village in Sari suburbs.

Owner and model of Alpha Collection clothing store and professional bodybuilder from Zaid Aliya village in Sari, Mazandaran province. Killed by direct shots from Islamic Republic agents during national protests. Shot for shouting for rights.
Not satisfied with shooting him due to his height and stature; they attacked him with batons and kicks until he died. Described as a child of Iran killed for the homeland.

Shot from behind by Islamic Republic suppressive forces during protests. He was the only child of his family and parents had all their hopes in him. He went to the streets to voice people's demands and was killed in an ambush by forces hidden around a police station. His body was returned after one week and his burial took place on the same night as his birthday, turning his birthday into eternal mourning for his family.
Killed during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests

Rock climbing coach shot in the heart at Chahar Rah Shahnaz intersection in Tabriz. After four days of no news, his body was only returned to family on Sunday with conditions of complete family silence and prohibition of any ceremonies.
17-year-old killed in Esfarayen
Arrested on 19 Dey (January 8, 2026) in Tehran and disappeared for over two weeks with no information about his whereabouts or transfer location
Arrested along with his younger brother Aryan Rahmani by security forces on 18 Dey 1404 and transferred to an unknown location. No information available about their condition or whereabouts.
Engineer, shot during protests in Najafabad along with dozens of others. Limited media coverage due to families not being active on social media.
Shot directly in the head by suppression forces on the evening of 18 Dey. Father of one child and owner of a car parts shop.
Killed by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran during protests in Gorgan. Citizen of Gorgan.

16-year-old Kurdish child from Salmas killed by direct gunshot from government suppression forces during popular protests in Tehran. His body was transferred to Qom and has not yet been handed over to his family. He is the third Kurdish citizen from Salmas whose identity has been confirmed as killed in Tehran.
Shot directly in the head and killed by a sniper during the protests, near Ibn Sina Hospital in Tehran. Shot from above, from the Pardis building. The bullet hit his head.
Shot in the head with a bullet and died instantly

Shot by suppressive forces in Haft Howz Narmak area of Tehran. He was a young athlete and parkour champion who also worked in theater. In one of his Instagram posts he had written: 'hoping for a day when we can fly with our skates'
Shot by government forces. Shot from behind with a military weapon in front of a Basij base of the Islamic Republic of Iran

Shot from behind near the neck in the Haft-e Howz area of Tehran. He was 34 years old, single, worked as a carpenter in a cabinet-making workshop, and was described by those close to him as very kind, hardworking, and always smiling and cheerful.
Died in Maali Abad area of Shiraz during the 2025-2026 protests
Died on January 8th in Karaj during the protests. Family is under pressure not to speak about it or write anything. Father only made one Instagram post without explanation.
Shot directly by Islamic Republic forces in Qods (Qaleh Hassan Khan). Family is under severe suppression.
Documented as victim in Iran International Memorial database
Shot with war bullets during protests on Setareh Khan Street in Tehran, then killed with final shots by Basij forces after falling to the ground
27-year-old cafe owner from Najafabad killed by direct gunfire from government suppression forces during protests. His body was delivered to his family 5 days later under pressure.
Kurdish citizen killed during protests. Originally from Sarpol-e Zahab. Family required to pay $4500 as 'bullet cost' to receive his body
Killed during protests in Khorramabad
Killed during protests. Buried in Behesht-e Zahra cemetery. Authorities are burying victims in different sections of the cemetery to prevent concentration of large numbers of killed protesters.

Shot in the head by suppressive forces during Iran's national uprising. Born in 1370 (Persian calendar) and from Bumehen. Family searched for 3 days continuously before finding his body in Kahrizak, identifying him only through a tattoo on his hand. Burial ceremony was held under strict security measures with security forces prohibiting any gathering, ceremony or public expression of mourning.

Wounded by pellet shot during night of January 7-8, 2026 (18 or 19 Dey). Owned a woodworking workshop in Tehran. After being wounded, was taken to hospital by a neighbor while others were afraid to help due to fear of authorities. His lung was severely damaged and essentially destroyed by the pellet impact, leading to his death.
Fitness trainer killed by direct gunshot to the heart during protests. Local sources report the bullet was fired by plainclothes agents using a Colt pistol.
19-year-old Gilan citizen from Gourab-e-Zarmikh village (Tataf village) killed during nationwide protests. Had recently migrated to Tehran for work and was employed at a restaurant.
Shot directly by suppression forces in Yazdanshahr, Isfahan
Young man from Kashmar city killed in Pakdasht on 18 Dey
Shot by snipers during celebrations after police were driven out of an area. Victims had gathered to dance and celebrate when snipers came and shot everyone present.
Young patriot from Chamestan city, Mazandaran province, killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic terrorists during patriotic protests
33-year-old resident of Marvdasht, killed during people's protests by baton blows and gunshot execution by government suppression forces
Killed by repressive forces of the Islamic Republic regime while working in his family's cafe business. Described as a kind, empathetic young man deeply cherished by friends and family.

Shot directly in the head by an Islamic Republic sniper. Was with his family at protests, lit a cardboard on fire to reduce the effect of tear gas so people could escape, when Islamic Republic snipers targeted him with a laser in front of his brother and sister. Family was threatened not to have any social media activity and could not hold any ceremonies for him.

20-year-old Baloch citizen killed during popular protests in Karaj by direct gunshot from military and security forces to the head. Son of Maulavi Abdul Hadi from Gosht city in Saravan county. Body buried on 23 Dey 1404 (January 12, 2026) in his birthplace.

Shot with war bullet by Islamic Republic forces during suppression of popular protests in Alvand city, Qazvin province. He was directly targeted and died from the severity of his injuries. Born in 1363 (Persian calendar), single.
Shot by mercenaries of the Islamic Republic. Family was forced into silence and told they must sign a document stating he was a Basiji member
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime in Mashhad, buried in his hometown Arak
Killed by security forces on 18 Dey (January 8, 2026) in Khorramabad, Lorestan province
Shot by gunshot to the left leg, death certificate confirms he was killed by gunshot
Father of two daughters aged 16 and 21, shot in the throat by government forces during public protests

Shot three times with war bullets in Baharan Square (Falah neighborhood), District 17 of Tehran. Was unmarried and unemployed at the time of death. Family was forced to bury his body outside Tehran in Jolfa city near the Armenian border rather than in the capital. Authorities offered money to the family to declare him a 'martyr' but his father refused this offer.

Christian citizen shot by security forces with a military bullet while attempting to help his wounded friend Shahram Maghsoudlou during a protest in Baharestan Isfahan. After being shot in the thigh and bleeding severely, security forces stationed at the hospital prevented him and his companions from entering the emergency room and accessing medical services, causing him to die from severe blood loss. His family searched for him for five consecutive days without knowing his fate. Authorities offered to return his body only if the family signed a form falsely claiming he was a Basij member killed by protesters, which the family refused. His body was eventually returned after payment of one billion tomans. He had a 4-year-old daughter and two teenage stepdaughters.
Died in Shahrak Andisheh during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests
Died in Baharestan district of Isfahan
33-year-old Gilaki citizen shot by direct fire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during nationwide protests in Rasht

Shot in the stomach with a bullet in Haft Howz area of Tehran. He owned a beautiful cafe. Killed through deliberate targeting of unarmed protesters via direct shooting with military weapons, specifically targeting the head and other vital parts of the body, showing clear intent to kill as part of a widespread and organized attack against civilian population.
Described as martyr (شهید) from Isfahan. Died on 18 Dey (January 8, 2026) during the protests.
Shot directly by security forces near the police station in Rostamkola, Behshahr County, Mazandaran Province. Body returned to family after several days with severe restrictions
Killed during protests. In his last Instagram story he had written: 'If my body is returned, hold a celebration for me'
Killed by the Islamic Regime in Afsariyeh, Tehran. He was a cook who gave his life for Iran's freedom.
Shot in the leg on 18 Dey in Baharestan, Isfahan and taken to hospital. His lifeless body was handed over with a fatal shot to the forehead while medical pads were still attached to his body.
Professional football player in Iranian league, brutally shot and killed by the thugs of the Islamic Republic Regime along with his wife. They leave behind two daughters.

From Kermanshah, had come to Tehran for work, killed by Islamic Republic regime suppression forces. Family under severe pressure and forced into silence by regime threats and intimidation to prevent disclosure of crime details
Shot in the heart from behind during protests in Rasht. Left behind a young son who keeps asking why there are no photos of his mother anywhere.

Shot with a military bullet to the heart at Selsabil, Tehran. Was a barber who often cut hair for free for disabled people or those with Down syndrome. Was known as a kind and energetic person who loved his two cats.
Shot in the heart during protests. Described as a hero who loved his homeland and was targeted in the heart.

Brother of the tweet author, appears to have been killed. Tweet mentions wanting revenge for his blood and refers to him as 'Jan Fashan' (soul-sacrificing). Context suggests he died during protests but specific details are not provided.

Shot in the chest area by police officers from Mashiriyeh police station in the Mashiriyeh neighborhood. His body was identified two days later on 20 Dey (January 10, 2026) in Kahrizak among approximately three thousand corpses. Officials from the Martyrs Foundation told his family that Morteza Shaneh-ai had become a 'martyr' and did not charge the family for the bullet cost.

Shot with three war bullets from behind during protests on the evening of 19 Dey 1404 around 8 PM after leaving home to join street demonstrations called by the Prince. Owner of a carpentry workshop in Siah-sang industrial area and known designer in classic furniture production. Told his mother he was going to the streets for the future of his 12-year-old daughter and Iran's children, leaving his watch as a memento for his daughter
Brutally attacked by regime forces using batons and pellet guns. 34 pellets hit his face. Part of a young couple with a school-aged child who were both attacked together.

Young married man returning home with his wife in Daneshgah Square when attacked by Basij forces with batons and pellets. 34 pellets fired at his face, head and face completely destroyed with batons in front of his wife. Regime took the bodies and held memorial services claiming them as their own martyrs, even circulating announcements around Daneshgah Square and conducting their own burial ceremonies. Couple was monarchist, not regime supporters. Left behind a 9th grade child.
Farmer who loved his country, killed by the Islamic Republic on the night of 18 Dey in Borujerd. He was a student of Majidreza Rahnavard and like that hero.
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime
Killed at Seyyed Heshmat and Shahrestani intersection, mostly with heavy machine gun (doshka). Part of 61 people killed in one incident over two days.
43-year-old athlete and father of two children killed in Islamshahr during the bloody Dey month protests

Killed during nationwide protests. Was married with two children and had previously been active in protests including demonstrations following Mahsa (Jina) Amini's killing. After his death, family was forced to comply with imposed official narrative due to security pressure and family circumstances including advanced age of parents and proximity of relatives to government institutions. Family was told they would have to pay 'cost of the bullet' if they refused official claim, and body would be buried in undisclosed location otherwise. During burial ceremony, his mother openly stated her son had been killed by the Islamic Republic. Family emphasized he had no affiliation with government institutions or Basij, and his social media reflected critical stance toward authorities.

Shot with bullet. Known by the nickname Shahin. 24-year-old tattoo artist from Mashhad who loved music and was always cheerful, even when life's burden weighed heavily on his shoulders. He just wanted to live.
Shot while walking hand-in-hand with his wife on the street. Family is under pressure.

Shot from behind in Narmak neighborhood at around 9:30 AM (had his last phone call with his brother at 9:30, and 10 minutes later a woman answered his phone). People were carrying bodies to residential parking areas, and Mostafa was carried to the end of the alley.
Shot in the heart with a bullet on the night of 19 Dey. Family was forced to steal his body and are now under severe security pressure.
Shot with pellet bullets and one war bullet during protests in Nour city. He was a barista at Saeedinia Cafe (Rouyan branch) at the time of his death. Originally from Nowshahr.
Killed in Noor-Mazandaran. His father brought his body from the hospital to his grandfather's yard where the family performed funeral rites. He worked as a barista at S'aedi-Nia.

Shot in the heart with a war bullet on Siman road in Mashhad. Family searched for him for three days before finding his body. Forcibly buried by security forces in Sangal village, Khorasan province. Family is under pressure from security agencies not to publicize his death.
Killed during protests in Shahreza on bloody days of 18-19 Dey by direct gunfire with war bullets or pellets
Shot by government suppression forces during the current national revolution in Tehran
Shopkeeper on Farhang Street in Sari, Gilaki citizen from Sari, died during protests in the city. There is uncertainty about the exact date - unclear if the incident occurred on 18 Dey or 19 Dey 1404

Child of Bijan and Mrs. Mostafavi. Shot and killed along with parents while inside their personal vehicle during peaceful protests. Government agents opened fire on their car. Bodies were transferred to Sangar and buried before 6 AM under strict security measures.

Wife of Bijan Mostafavi. Shot and killed along with her husband and child while inside their personal vehicle during peaceful protests. Government agents opened fire on their car. Bodies were transferred to Sangar and buried before 6 AM under strict security measures.
Father of three children (two daughters and one son), killed by direct shooting by Khamenei's forces. Body was buried in Khomeini Shahr cemetery

Slain by the brutal forces of the Islamic Republic regime. Her parents had already passed away, leaving her to grow up with her brother. She had only just reached the age where she could begin working and planting a future of her own. Her death occurred seven days before what would have been her birthday.
Death occurred during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests

Married mother of two children killed during protests in Tehran amid a widespread crackdown and mass killings of citizens by Iranian government forces in the Sadeghieh area. Shot in the neck by Iranian government forces and died instantly. Due to fears that authorities would prevent the handover of her body, her husband was forced to carry her body himself for more than an hour.

Baloch citizen and municipal street sweeper in Qeshm. Shot directly by military and security forces during suppression of nationwide protests. Bullet hit his neck and carotid artery causing fatal injuries. Son of Abdolghader, from Ahmad Abad village in central district of Iranshahr county.
Mother of two children, shot by Islamic regime with one bullet to her neck and one to her heart, died in her son's arms
Arrested in Nowshahr on 18 Dey 1404 along with two other young men

Young Kurdish man from Islamabad-e Gharb (Shaabad), killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests. His body was buried on Sunday 21 Dey 1404 in Imam-zadeh Hassan cemetery in Islamabad-e Gharb (Shaabad).
Shot and killed. Had told his father that if he was killed, he wanted to be buried near Cyrus the Great's tomb. His mother wrote that she and Navid were playmates and grew up together.

24-year-old nurse from Paveh who worked in medical centers in Kermanshah. Shot by military forces while at his workplace during the popular uprising. From the village of Mazidi in Paveh County. Lost his father at six months old and grew up facing many hardships. Graduate of medical imaging (radiology) who worked at Farabi and Imam Reza hospitals in Kermanshah. Investigations are ongoing regarding the exact circumstances of the incident inside the hospital.

Shot by security forces' pellets in Qeytarieh, Tehran. Was taken to Qeytarieh Clinic alive and receiving treatment when security agents abducted her. Her body was later found at the forensic medicine office with a fatal gunshot wound to the chest. Born in Bojnord, was a monarchist supporter who fought for years for Iran's freedom and the return of Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi.
17-year-old from Qazvin killed by security forces' gunfire during popular protests
Killed by the Islamic regime of Iran during a peaceful protest. From Zibad village, Gonabad in Razavi Khorasan Province.

Shot in the neck by Islamic Republic mercenaries on the night of 18 Dey 1404 (2026-01-08). A war bullet hit her neck and after several days of hospitalization at Panj Azar Hospital in Gorgan, she died on Wednesday evening 24 Dey.

35-year-old Gilaki citizen from Shaft, Gilan province, arrested by Islamic Republic of Iran security forces during nationwide protests on 19 Dey 1404. No official information has been released about the reasons for arrest, detention location, or his physical and legal status.
Killed in Fardis, Karaj. Birth year 1364 Persian calendar (1985 Gregorian).
Killed during protests, no media coverage of his death
Gilak citizen from Lowlaman, Rasht district. Shot directly by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during nationwide protests in Rasht.
