Shot directly in the neck by government suppression forces during people's protests
Shot with war bullet during protests in Shahin Shahr. Had two children. Authorities demanded 1 billion [tomans/rials] in exchange for his body and refused to allow a funeral ceremony.

Shot directly by government forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran around 10 PM on Namjoo Street in Rasht. The bullet hit his head and heart area, and he was killed at the scene. Gilaki citizen from Rasht.
Shot in the chest while leaving a pharmacy in Felakeh Sevom Khazaneh Bokharaei where he had gone to get medicine for his daughter. Killed instantly upon exiting the pharmacy.

Shot by suppressive forces during popular protests in Tehran-Pars neighborhood. From Sanandaj, Kurdistan province but resident of Tehran. Government forces demanded 700 million tomans from his family for return of his body.

Brother of Amir Teimouri, resident of Falah neighborhood in Tehran who had gone to visit Amir's house in Fardis. Killed alongside Amir and nephew Armin by gunfire from war weapons by Islamic Republic's suppressive forces on Sar-e Canal area of Fardis (main street). Family was pressured and threatened by government forces to receive the bodies and forced to bury them secretly.

Shot with live ammunition in the side of her body at 7:00 p.m. in Shora Square by security forces. Was taken to hospital and placed in ICU while fully conscious, but security forces expelled her family from the hospital. Her lifeless body was transferred to the morgue of Bagh-e Jannat in Arak that same night.
Shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic forces in Rasht. Body was buried without family members present. Had two daughters.

Shot directly by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during protests in Rasht. Security forces prevented her family from holding any funeral ceremonies and her body was buried at dawn around 3 AM without family members present. She was the head of household and had two young daughters. She was a Gilaki citizen from Rasht.

20-year-old cashier at Daily Market store on Shamshiri Street in Tehran. Shot with war bullets by security forces at her workplace at 7 PM. Her body was buried at 5 AM. Her family printed her name in an announcement without the martyr title, but security forces attached a paper with the martyr title to her name.
Second-year interior architecture student. Shot from behind with war bullets by Khamenei's bloodthirsty mercenaries on the night of 19 Dey in Baharestan county. Born on the first of Farvardin 1388.
Killed during protests
Memorial entry from Iran International, no specific circumstances provided

Shot during attack on Thursday market (Panjshanbeh Bazaar). He was with his father when he was hit by bullets. From the Abyazi family of Komoleh (Langrud). He loved veterinary medicine and worked at his father's clinic, Dr. Abyazi's clinic. His body was buried at night in Langrud.
Killed at Fifth Circle (Felakeh-ye Panjom) in Fardis, Karaj. Only 17 years old.

Shot with war bullet at 9 PM at home in Isfahan, Felkeh Nobahar area. He was an only child and his parents were severely harassed by authorities for the return of his body, with threats that if they disclosed information, their son would be buried anonymously. He was a mechanic who repaired foreign cars and had 5 apprentices. His garage was located at the beginning of Razmnandegan Street from the Isfahan house side, across from the first intersection. He was planning to return to his own home that week, with his belongings remaining at his father's house. Buried in Behesht Masoomeh Cemetery, Shahin Shahr, section 11.

Shot directly in the head with live ammunition by government suppression forces on Kashani Street during popular protests. The 17-year-old had told his mother he wore two jackets so that if he was hit by bullets he would only be wounded, but government forces shot him in the head from behind. His father is a veteran of the Iran-Iraq war who had to use his veteran card because authorities refused to return his son's body. The family remains under security surveillance.
51-year-old Gilaki citizen from Lahijan, killed by direct gunshot to the back of the head by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government in Lahijan

Kurdish Yarsan citizen from Qasr-e Shirin, killed by war bullet from Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Andisheh, Tehran province. Funeral held on January 10, 2026 in Andisheh city. Family was threatened and pressured by security agencies regarding holding the funeral ceremony.
Education teacher and mother of two children who was shot and killed during popular protests when government forces opened direct fire and a war bullet hit her heart area

35-year-old man who entrusted his two-year-old child to his sister to participate in protests in Chalus with his wife. Shot with war bullets around 9:30 and died. Before dying, he entrusted his child to his family.

31-year-old Kurdish Yarsani dentist shot directly with live ammunition by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in the Maskan neighborhood of Kermanshah. His clinic was located in the Maskan neighborhood. His body was buried on January 17, 2026 in Sarab Tiran cemetery. Son of Foroud.

31-year-old dentist shot during protests after intervening to protect another individual being assaulted by security forces. Shot from two directions - one bullet from behind and another from the front. Taken to private hospital where he fell into a coma and died. Adherent of the Yarsani faith. Authorities pressured family to pay one billion tomans or identify him as Basij member to release body; family was compelled to accept regime supporter designation due to inability to pay.

Father of two children, shot with a war bullet by regime forces from behind and from above the 128 Tehranpars police station, bullet hit his lung, transferred to hospital for surgery, died from pulmonary embolism after surgery. His body was found in Kahrizak and buried without any ceremony
40-year-old Gilaki citizen from Rasht, father of one child, killed by government suppression forces during protests in the city

Shot during nationwide protests while riding a motorcycle with his sister. Government forces shot him multiple times in different parts of his body. He died from severe bleeding. His sister was also wounded in the abdomen during the shooting but survived.
Hit by war bullet in Shahinvila, Karaj on Thursday 18 Dey month
Follower of the Yarsan faith and resident of the village of Armanijan in the Dinavar District of Sahneh County, Kermanshah Province. Shot by security forces on Taq-e Bostan Boulevard in Kermanshah.

Shot with war bullets by security forces at Helal Ahmar intersection in Izeh city. The bullet hit his shoulder and he died hours later due to heavy bleeding. Security forces transferred his body to Ahvaz and forced his family to remain silent. Against the family's wishes, they imposed a martyrdom narrative and forced the family to bury him in the martyrs' section under strict security measures without holding tribal ceremonies. The family did not use the word 'martyr' in their obituary notice.

Went out on 19 Dey (January 8, 2026) in Baharestan, Isfahan and disappeared. Body was identified among the unnamed corpses on 28 Dey (January 17, 2026) and was buried the same day under security conditions. Head and face were unrecognizable. Exact time and manner of death unknown.
23-year-old Gilaki citizen from Ishka village in Lahijan district, killed by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces in the evening on Thursday in the area of Lahijan National Garden
Shot in the abdomen on 18 Dey in Mashhad, died on 25th
32-year-old computer industry worker shot and killed by the Islamic terrorist regime in Haft-houz. A young man who wanted to live, worked, and had a future, but received bullets in response.

Killed during suppression of popular protests in Dowlatabad area of Tehran's District 20. Described as a martyr on the path to freedom who lost his life while protesting against oppression and violation of people's rights.
Family member reported missing/lost during protests, described as 'one from our family is also missing'

Killed during protests on 18th of Dey month. His body was found among other victims of Iran's national revolution. Brother of the tweet author Payam Fotouhiyehpour, went missing on Wednesday when communication with outside the country became available, family and friends searched everywhere but found no trace until Tuesday when they were informed his body was found among the martyrs.
Killed during protests in Shahreza on bloody days of 18-19 Dey by direct gunfire with war bullets or pellets

14-year-old teenager shot directly by Islamic Republic suppressive forces to the head and eye area during nationwide protests. Family transferred his body to Khalili Hospital in Shiraz. Despite his death, hospital doctor had declared his eye needed to be removed, but hours later after contact from government forces, Pouya's body was suddenly transferred from the hospital. Four to five days later, Pouya Jafari's body was only handed over to the family after obtaining commitments and receiving money. According to informed sources, security agents buried the teenager's body themselves and warned the family they had no right to hold mourning ceremonies. Only his father and mother were allowed to visit the grave, and even at the burial site they were prohibited from crying and mourning. After burial, security forces stationed around the Jafari family's residence and with severe security measures tried to suppress any reaction, gathering, or information sharing about this teenager's killing.

Kurdish Kurmanji youth from Esfarayen, North Khorasan province. Shot by Islamic Republic suppression forces with war bullets to the mouth and chest area during popular protests. Lost his father in childhood and had one brother; their mother raised the two children alone.
Young enthusiastic athlete from Nahavand, shot in the heart from very close range during protests in Nahavand city
Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppressive forces. Bullet hit his face and caused fatal brain damage.
17-year-old teenager killed by suppressive agents of the Islamic Republic
23-year-old student injured during protests in Saadat Abad on 18 Dey 1404. No news has been available about this girl since then.
Shot directly by regime suppression forces during protests in Meymand, Fars Province
Shot by Islamic Republic agents during protests in Nasim Shahr

Worked at a pharmacy. Was present at protests with his friend. First his friend was shot and killed on the spot, then Ramtin was killed by a direct shot to the head while trying to lift his friend from the ground.
Shot directly in the head around Kakh Square in Gorgan. He was the breadwinner of his family, having previously lost his father and brother, and was the only support his mother had.

Shot and killed by plainclothes officers in a white Samand car on the night of 18th Dey. Family retrieved his body with great difficulty and buried him at 3-4 AM without anyone present, under complete media silence. Intelligence officers threatened the family that if anyone held ceremonies or posted announcements, they would arrest his brother and father. He had completed all his marriage and engagement preparations and was planning to finalize arrangements in the coming days when he was killed by the Islamic Republic.

Shot by government forces during protests in Dezful. Was a 19-year-old law student at Azad University of Dezful who also professionally pursued boxing and worked as an automotive electrician for several years alongside his studies.

Father of one daughter, resident of Tehran, shot directly in the forehead by government suppression forces during people's protests. His body was delivered to family one week later and buried in Masjed Soleyman

Kurdish citizen from Kermanshah, 41 years old and father of a young child, taxi driver, killed by gunfire from military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Alvand city, Qazvin. His body was buried on 21 Dey in 'Behesht Fatemieh' Alvand.
Killed by gunfire from military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Qarchak Varamin, Tehran Province. Originally from Sonqor
Shot and killed in Karaj. According to reports, the shooting occurred from the rooftop of a police station and he was killed by gunshot.

17-year-old volleyball player and member of Setaregan Alborz team in Karaj. Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppression forces in the lung area during protests at Mosbah intersection in Karaj. He was with his family during protests but got separated in the crowd and disappeared. His body was found hours later at a clinic. Family was forced to pay heavy costs to receive his body and buried him under security restrictions in Hajiabad cemetery in Karaj.
Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppressive forces in the chest area from behind
Killed at Se-Rah-e Simin (Simin intersection) in Isfahan by regime forces
Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppression forces in Afsarieh neighborhood of Tehran

17-year-old student from Shushtar, killed by direct gunshot to the head from close range during popular protests. He was a final year high school student who dreamed of freedom and a better future for Iran. His close ones say he used to say 'I go to the streets for Iran's freedom, even if they kill me'
17-year-old Lor from Shushtar, Khuzestan, shot by suppression forces. Security forces delivered his body to his family after five days and he was buried on 23 Dey (January 13, 2026) in the same city

Shot with direct gunfire on the night of the 18th in the city of Dansfahan (one of the counties of Qazvin Province with 14,000 population). Had been fighting against the Islamic Republic for a long time. When he was killed, authorities demanded 200 million tomans to release his body and buried him at 5 AM in a heavily secured environment without notice or presence of anyone except his family. The family was not even allowed to print obituaries or hold mourning ceremonies.
Commemorative post by his father after his death. Father said: 'My dear son, with your departure you gave us honor but broke my back. But [you are] sacrificed for dear Iran.'

Shot with seven bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces. His burial ceremony was held under the strictest security measures with only ten family members allowed to attend. The transfer and burial of his body was conducted with armed escort by security agents and the area around the burial site was completely under government forces control.
Shot by direct fire from government suppression forces during popular protests. 27 years old, from Eslam Abad-e Gharb

Born in Mehr 1367, 37 years old, resident of Marzdaran neighborhood in Tehran, owner of a cabinet-making workshop in Ariashahr. Shot dead by direct fire from suppression forces during protests in Ariashahr district. Was with five friends at protests when one was shot. Returned to help his wounded friend when a sniper affiliated with security forces fired from a building rooftop. Security forces then targeted him with six war bullets, killing him on the spot. About to get married, gave his phone, password and car keys to his mother before leaving home and asked for her forgiveness.
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Mashhad during the protests

Shot with war ammunition in the lung area during protests. Originally from Shabad, lived in various areas including Shahryarshahr and Vali-e Asr Shabad before moving with family to Ni-pehan village in Qasr-e Shirin due to his father's agricultural lands. Was a tattoo artist who moved to Karaj with his wife for career advancement. Body was delivered to family after extensive pressure and difficulty - many victims' bodies were reportedly stacked on top of each other in a warehouse. Burial was forced to be conducted quietly at 10 AM instead of the planned 2:30 PM ceremony due to security pressure. Buried under heavy security presence with IRGC forces, plainclothes agents, mobile phone and internet cuts, with only close relatives present. Family continues to face unspecified security pressures.

20-year-old Lor protester shot by Islamic Republic suppression forces with bullets hitting both legs, died from severe bleeding around 11 PM on Khalij 18 street in Sarabtaveh area of Yasuj. Body buried in Sepidar cemetery in Yasuj suburbs.

Retired teacher killed during popular protests when government suppression forces fired five war bullets directly at his leg and heart. He was trying to help a female protester who had fallen to the ground after being shot in the head by suppression forces. He was first shot in the leg, then killed with four additional bullets to his heart.
16-year-old teenager killed by Khamenei's mercenaries in Karaj
Shot and killed in Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari. His family faced repeated threats while trying to recover his body
Shot in the heart by government forces. From Esfarayen. Described as sacrificing his life for the homeland.
32-year-old protein distributor, shot by security forces on Keshavarzi Street. Had a 10-month-old child.

25-year-old from Gerash, Fars who worked in Bandar Abbas. Killed by government forces during peaceful protests in Bandar Abbas on 18 Dey. His body was returned to his family four days later under security conditions to be buried in silence.

Shot directly in the head by a sniper with war bullets during popular protests in front of the 8th police station in Gohardasht. He was an athlete who worked at a sports club in Shahin Villa, Karaj, and rented the club's buffet to support himself and his mother. His father had died years ago and he was the sole breadwinner for the family. Security forces prevented public burial and he was buried in restrictive conditions in Soheylieh, Romandeh village without public ceremonies.
Cinema actor and assistant director, Gilaki citizen from Bandar Kiashahr in Gilan province, shot by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran during protests
23-year-old from Nurabad Mamsani, resident of Chenar Shahijan in Fars province, shot by suppressive forces during popular protests

22-year-old monarchist from Izeh, killed at 10 PM on Hafez South Street in Izeh by security forces with three bullets. His family broke into the morgue at night to retrieve his body to prevent the Islamic Republic from conducting forced interviews and receiving money from them. He was buried at 5 AM on 19 Dey 1404 in Takht Kashan village in Izeh.
Shot with direct gunfire by suppression forces in Izeh. Kurdish/Lor ethnicity from Izeh

Shot in the head by regime forces during protests in Fardis, Karaj. Originally from Ramhormoz, Khuzestan. The impact was so severe that it completely shattered his skull. He had moved to Karaj to support his mother and worked as a barber and perfume seller.

Shot in the head with a war weapon by suppressive forces. The bullet hit his head and the severity of the injury was such that his head was shattered. Originally from Ramhormoz, Khuzestan, and from the Lor ethnic group. Had migrated from Khuzestan to Karaj to make a living. Was a barber and also worked in perfume sales to support his mother. Had lost his father and had been forced to work since childhood.
Shot by suppression forces in Yazdanshahr, Isfahan

17-year-old from Salas Babajani, player for Saipa youth football team, shot with war bullet by security forces during popular protests in Tehran. According to his father Adel Moradi in video released by government media when receiving his son's body, he was shot from close range from behind.

Kurdish citizen from Divandareh, killed by Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Tehran. He had lost his mother several years ago and was living with his grandfather's family in Tehran. His body was delivered to the family after several days and the burial ceremony was held on 30 Dey in Tazeh Ava Vazir village in Divandareh.

Kurdish woman from Marivan studying textile and fashion design at Shariati College in Tehran. Shot in the head from close range from behind after joining a protest after leaving college. Family traveled from Kermanshah to Tehran to identify her body among hundreds of young people. Intelligence forces surrounded family home and prevented burial, forcing family to bury her body along the road between Kermanshah and Kamyaran.

Truck driver from Mobarakeh, Isfahan. Shot directly by government forces on the evening of 19 Dey. According to witnesses, he was targeted from behind with a war bullet and simultaneously hit with pellets from the front. His father, who was standing a few meters away, ran toward the injured person after hearing gunshots and discovered it was his own son. Rostam was severely wounded with blood coming from his mouth. He was transferred to hospital but died due to the severity of his injuries. Around 3-4 AM, armed government forces entered the hospital and forcibly removed the bodies of the deceased at gunpoint, despite resistance from families.
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime

Mechanical engineer and graduate of Gilan University who ran a classic car repair shop. Shot in the side during popular protests in Sadeghiyeh area of Tehran while present on the street with her sister. Her sister transported her bloodied body by motorcycle toward the hospital, but she died before reaching the medical center. Family was subjected to severe security pressures to refrain from publicizing news of her death.
25-year-old Gilaki citizen from Tonekabon, shot in the head by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government
Gilaki citizen from Jalise village in Deylaman, resident of Lahijan, killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces
Shot directly with war bullets by IRGC (Revolutionary Guards) in Lahijan, body was buried at midnight without permission for mourning ceremony

Shop owner who went out toward Khaqani street in Isfahan on Thursday night. Shot directly in the leg, arrested while wounded, then executed with a shot to the head while in custody. Body returned after one week for 400 million rials
Shot in the stomach by Khamenei regime suppressors
Killed during 2025-2026 Iranian protests

Graduate architecture student shot by government forces during nighttime shooting on Mehranpour Street in Narmak, Tehran. He was with his family members when the shooting occurred and was trying to move them away from the incident location when he was targeted by bullets from Islamic Republic regime agents. He was shot in the kidney area, transferred to Ansari Hospital in Narmak, but died despite medical efforts.
Killed in Narmak, Tehran. The message requests that his name be remembered so his blood is not forgotten.
38-year-old from Azimiyeh, Karaj killed on 18 or 19 Dey 1404

Location of Death: Jahan Nama or Garmdarre, Karaj, Alborz
Notes: 30 years old, married, national and Asian Muay Thai champion, shot directly with bullet from behind in front of his wife and mother by government agents during popular protests

Petroleum refinery engineer from Arak who disappeared during Arak protests on Thursday 18 Dey (January 8, 2026) and whose lifeless body was delivered to his family at Arak morgue on 24 Dey (January 13, 2026)
Killed during protests in Azimiyeh, Karaj area. Date uncertain - either 18 or 19 Dey 1404

Shot with eight bullets while helping injured people in front of Rashid police station in Tehranpars. He had been detained during 2022-2023 protests. He had a seven-year-old son waiting for him at home.

Shot directly in the heart during a chase with security forces in Masoor neighborhood of Khorramabad. Family immediately washed and shrouded his body to prevent security forces from taking it. Security forces later came to the family home attempting to forcibly take the body, but family elders resisted and after a confrontation, the agents were forced to retreat and flee

Shot in the head with live ammunition by government forces during popular protests. Killed by a sniper positioned on top of a building near the gathering location. He had made a will requesting that if killed by Islamic Republic forces, his death announcement should state he was a 'martyr for the homeland', but security forces prevented his family from honoring this request and called him a 'rioter' instead. Originally from Ashtian in Markazi Province.
17-year-old Arab youth from Abadan's Maniohi district, killed by direct gunfire from suppression forces while participating in nationwide protests. He had traveled to Tehran for construction work.
Killed by Khamenei's agents on 18 Dey. Described as a hero of the nation and another brave person from Rasht.

Civil engineer and student at Azad University of Hashtgerd. Shot and killed by Islamic Republic agents with two bullets - first bullet fired from inside Gohardasht mosque (opposite the main Gohardasht police station) hit his side, second bullet hit the jugular artery in his neck. Died on the spot in front of his wife's eyes. Had participated continuously in protests from 2017 to 2025. Family was religious and regime-supporting. Body was initially not released, family had to pay costs related to bullets before burial was allowed three days later at local Atishgah cemetery with security forces present.
Father of two children named Sepehr and Arsam, killed during protests by Islamic Republic suppression forces
Killed by direct gunfire. From Javadiyeh, Tehran. Has a 15-year-old daughter.
Shot with war bullet (تیر جنگی). Had a 5-year-old child who still doesn't know his father was killed. Cousin's friend of the Twitter user.
From Khormoj, shot in the throat during protests in Bushehr. Body was found in hospital two days after death. Buried four days later with only parents present under heavy security surveillance.
Died in Karaj

Shot by security forces near Azadi Street in Tehran. Legal Medicine officials cited excessive bleeding as cause of death and returned only personal belongings including blood-stained clothes to family while withholding body for burial.

Shot with hunting pellets from less than 3 meters distance during protests on Amiri Street in Abadan. Father of a 3-year-old child named Ariamehr. His body was held by security agencies for 5 days, and family received it only after threats and giving heavy commitments. Buried on Tuesday 23 Dey 1404.

Shot during protests on Amiri Street in Abadan. Targeted by state security forces with direct fire from a pellet gun at close range. Oil industry contractor from Mehran. Body released to family after five days of security pressure, funeral held on Tuesday January 13.
Killed during protests. Father of a 2-month-old daughter. Described as very unknown/obscure (گمنام).

Athlete from the village of Hajilarghala in Gonbad-e Kavus, Golestan, born in 2000, medal-winning champion in kickboxing and martial arts, from Iran's Turkmen community, killed by security forces of the Islamic Republic regime during the nationwide protests
Taekwondo, TRX and bodybuilding trainer. Shot in the head by government sniper on 18 Dey in Varamin.

Shot directly during protests in Anzali. Family was contacted on the night of 22 Dey and informed they were burying the body. The family was not allowed to hold any ceremonies including third and seventh day memorials, and security pressures continue on the family to prevent information dissemination.
Shot in the back/lumbar region by security forces, died from excessive bleeding
40-year-old father of a 5-year-old child, shot and killed in Ariashahr-Tehran

Shot with direct gunfire by Islamic Republic forces while holding her mother's hand in front of the shrine in Astaneh Ashrafiyeh. Killed without any confrontation or threat, dying in front of her mother's eyes. Mother, in indescribable shock and fear that officers would take her daughter's body, transported the corpse home and kept it with her until morning.
23-year-old from Zabol, killed by suppressive forces during nationwide protests in Sabzevar

Shot with war bullet near Tus neighborhood police station, Meraj Square in Mashhad. Body was delivered to Razavi Hospital in Mashhad at 10:30 PM. Family searched hospitals during the night, his phone briefly turned on near dawn and someone answered saying to come to Razavi Hospital Mashhad, then phone went dead. Body was identified through photos shown to family. Buried in Behesht Reza cemetery. Family was threatened by Astan Quds Razavi Khorasan to declare him a martyr. Employee, studying for associate degree.

Shot by a sniper from government forces of the Islamic Republic while in the area of Falakeh Kakh in Gorgan. The shooting was carried out from the top of Sarmayeh Tower. Security institutions pressured the family to declare he was a Basiji member and conditioned the return of his body on accepting this narrative. Family and relatives emphasize that he was a protester and rights activist with no affiliation to government institutions.
Shot by Islamic Republic mercenary forces. He was from Dinavar, Kermanshah province, and had come to Tehran to earn a living. Left behind a 5-year-old daughter.
Killed at Seyyed Heshmat and Shahrestani intersection, mostly with heavy machine gun (doshka). Part of 61 people killed in one incident over two days.
Disappeared on Thursday 18 Dey (January 8) in Mashhad and after two weeks, his body was delivered to the family on 6 Bahman (January 26)
Shot in the eyes with bullets in front of Shahrak Vali-e Asr police station in Tehran. His mother says he grew up as an orphan and she devoted all her youth to raising him.
Shot directly by suppression forces in the Nasser Khosrow neighborhood of Khorramabad
Among 40-50 people who lost their lives in the city of Alvand, Qazvin province on the night of 18 Dey
17-year-old Turkish child from Karaj, killed by direct shooting by government suppression forces during protests on Thursday evening

Shot directly in the neck and chest during protests by security forces of the Islamic Republic regime. Succumbed to injuries in hospital. In one of his final messages wrote: 'My life is in such a mess now that I don't see next year; either I must die or Khamenei.'
Killed during protests. Friend was forced to add 'Haji' to his name on a banner after his death
Shot with war bullet (گلوله جنگی) in Qale Hassan Khan on Thursday night. Family threatened to keep quiet about his death.
Killed by Islamic regime. In his last messages to his friends, he said: 'Either I die, or Khamenei.' He gave his life for his country.

Taekwondo practitioner shot directly by suppression forces in Sabooni neighborhood of Kermanshah with a war bullet to his head during the Iranian national revolution. He was a follower of the Yarsani religion. His family received his body after paying 700 million tomans to security institutions and buried him on Sunday 21 Dey 1404 in Roqe Sarab Tiran cemetery in Kuzran.

Shot from behind with a war bullet by suppressive forces around 9 PM on Thursday 18 Dey 1404, which was his birthday. The bullet hit him from behind and passed through his thigh area. Due to severe injuries and heavy bleeding, his transfer to hospital was delayed. He arrived at the hospital around 12:30 AM and suffered brain death. Doctors managed to revive him once, but he ultimately died around 4 AM. He worked at a cardboard manufacturing company as a driver and executive worker. He had lost his father at age 9 and his sister at age 17-18, and was the only remaining member of his family.
23-year-old Kurdish Yarsan citizen shot and killed by IRGC forces during popular protests in Dare-Darizh neighborhood of Kermanshah. His funeral was held with widespread public attendance.

Trans man who was shot directly in the heart with a bullet. He was 24 years old, worked in accounting with a diploma degree, and was employed at a large manufacturing company in Baghestan area of Karaj. He also worked as a Snap driver after his main job to cover his expenses. Member of the queer community who, despite being assigned female at birth, did not consider himself a girl. The neighborhood where he lived did not have the capacity to accept his identity, but his family ultimately accepted his gender identity, as evidenced by the non-feminine photo they placed on his grave.

Nurse at Aram Hospital in Karaj and mother of two children. Shot in Mehr Villa area on 18 Dey while trying to help a young girl who was being beaten. Was hit by a bullet from behind that struck her spleen area, causing severe injuries that led to her death.

A nurse at Aram Hospital and mother of two, was shot dead while trying to protect a young girl from being beaten. The bullet hit her spleen, killing her instantly. Her sisters who rushed to help were brutally beaten by regime forces with their hands broken and faces struck with brass knuckles.

12-year-old Kurdish Yarsani child from Kozaran, Kermanshah, killed during popular protests in Hashtgerd city, Alborz province. Shot by two military bullets to the neck and waist area by Islamic Republic military-security forces. Body was returned to family after they signed a written commitment not to publicize the death and not to hold a public funeral ceremony. Burial ceremony was held under pressure from security forces at Nazarabad cemetery in Hashtgerd.

Gilaki citizen and violin teacher from Siahkal, shot by Islamic Republic forces in the vicinity of Lahijan governorate. Eyewitnesses described the shooting as from a distance in the governorate area. Method of killing described as 'unusual'. Body buried in Barfjan shrine in the city.
Dr. Sanaz Mousavi, an anesthesiologist, was shot in the head by regime forces in Haft-e Tir area of Mashhad
Shot with war bullet during massive protests in Mashhad, died as a martyr for the homeland

Shot by Islamic Republic suppressive forces while leaving Mehr clinic in Shiraz. First hit by shotgun pellets, then killed with a war bullet. Her body was delivered to her family under pressure and threats from security forces who demanded silence about the crime.

Shot from behind on Moradi Street in Bandar Abbas at 10 PM in front of his wife. Family forced to pay 1 billion [rials/tomans] to retrieve body and sign document claiming he was a Basij member. Family under severe pressure. Previously arrested in 1401 (2022) during anti-government protests.
Shot with war bullets in the area of Se Rah-e Simin, Isfahan. Referred to affectionately as cousin's son by the tweeter.
Listed in Iran International Memorial as a victim
Referenced as a victim with the phrase 'his name hasn't become a hashtag yet', suggesting he was killed but has not received widespread social media attention
Shot in the head with war bullets on the first day of the protests. Killed in Sirjan where many people were killed but few dared to speak about it due to Islamic Republic death threats.

Shot by the regime in the streets for protesting. Was an orphan with no family to receive her body after paying the $4,500 fine demanded by the IRGC for removing bullets from bodies of murdered protesters before burial. Buried in an unmarked mass grave. Her Telegram channel was called 'The Girl Who Was a Sun'.
Shot with bullet to the neck area in the vicinity of the overpass in Ashrafi Isfahani, Tehran. Buried in Shiraz.
Shot by government mercenary forces during the violent suppression of popular protests. Originally from Kuhdasht county.
Died in Kuchsafahan on January 8, 2026 during the protests. Also known by the name Aryan.
Killed during protests in Shahreza on bloody days of 18-19 Dey by direct gunfire with war bullets or pellets
Kurdish Yarsan citizen killed by gunfire from Islamic Republic's military-security forces during popular protests in Tehran
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime. Death occurred on either 18 or 19 Dey 1404
Killed on Thursday night. According to locals, they were peaceful youth. Shot in the stomach.

Shot three times in the chest by security forces near Imam Hossein area on Daneshjo Boulevard near Midon. He was from Amirabab neighborhood (Enghelab Street) in Yazd. Lost his father in 2008. On Thursday night January 8th, he was taking his two sisters and mother home and was heading toward Imam Hossein when he was killed. Buried on Tuesday in block 2 of Rezvan Khaldbarin cemetery in Yazd.

Kurdish citizen from Kermanshah, retired from Road and Transportation Department, shot with live ammunition by government suppression forces during popular protests in Nobhar neighborhood. He was shot along with his son, who was injured while Shahab was killed. His body was buried on Sunday 21 Dey 1404 in Bagh Ferdows cemetery in Kermanshah.

Young woman from Tehran killed by direct gunfire from government security forces during popular protests. Both her parents had previously died and she lived alone with her brother, supporting herself by selling handmade dolls.

Shot twice with direct fire by regime forces while unarmed during uprising in Saadat Abad. Died instantly. Body recovered from Kahrizak the next day and buried in Lavasan beside his grandmother. Was a talented barista who told a friend before going out: 'Either everything changes, or I die.'

Shot while helping a wounded person in Qaleh Hassan Khan. First shot in the leg, then when they saw he was still standing, shot in the side. He gave his home address and was taken home where he died in his father's arms. Family was not allowed to bury him in Tehran.
Described as martyred (شهاب), with phrase 'my child went for other young people' suggesting he died for others during protests

Shot with bullet during protests in Gilan province. Family refused to take him to hospital due to unsafe conditions and security atmosphere, fearing he would be killed in hospital as there were multiple reports of finishing shots being fired at wounded protesters. He was taken home to find treatment but died at home. He was an athlete, described as a modest, calm and well-mannered young person who was noble and beloved, with a life connected to sports, morals and respect for others.
Shot in the heart with war bullets by government suppressive forces during popular protests in Rasht. Resident of Rasht from Jirdeh rural district in Shaft county, Gilan province
31 years old, held a biomedical engineering degree, shot directly on Thursday 18 Dey in Kolachai, Gilan Province
Killed in the path of homeland during Iranian protests, buried in Nourabad Mamasani
High school principal killed during protests
Commemorated as a martyr with eternal name (جاویدنام), indicating death during protests. From Kuhdasht in Lorestan province.

Student at Beheshti National University, daughter of Fatah and Shirin, from Baneh city, killed by direct gunfire from suppressive forces during popular protests in Tehran. Security institutions returned her body to family after applying pressure, threats and obtaining commitments, and in exchange for payment of 150 million tomans. Buried on Monday evening 6 Bahman 1404 in Baneh cemetery.
Shot directly in the head with two war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces in Fardis, Karaj. She had a one-year-old son and was buried in Behesht-e Ali cemetery in Karaj.

Kurdish man from Eslamabad-e Gharb (Shabad) killed by direct gunshot to the head from Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests. Shot around 9 PM in front of the governorate building in Eslamabad-e Gharb. Security agencies and IRGC pressured family to take the body but family refused to let the body leave Cheshmeh-Khani village. Government agencies demanded money from the family which the family explicitly refused.
18-year-old daughter killed with repeated blows to head and face by regime forces on 18 Dey in Mashhad. Her lifeless body was found 10 days later
35-year-old woman from Sari, killed in Sadeghieh Square, Tehran after being hit by 6 bullets fired by security forces while rushing to help the wounded during protests
Young woman from Shazand county in Markazi province, killed by direct shooting by government suppression forces during evening protests in Arak. She worked at a photography studio.
Owner of Ava cafe, resident of Tehranpars, Amin Street. Killed during shooting by armed forces.

Shot with a bullet to his back by Islamic Republic forces. He was 37 years old, had recently gotten his life together, renovated his house, and was planning to marry his partner. He was supportive of those around him and had helped many people in his neighborhood. On Thursday 18 Dey, he called his mother saying he wanted to go out that night. Despite his mother's insistence that he not go, he said 'Mother, if I don't go, who will? Look at our living situation, you take care of yourselves, I'll watch out for myself.' He went out and never returned.

Shot with live ammunition while dancing Kurdish dances around a fire in Punak Square after a placard of Qassem Soleimani was burned. Initially wounded and taken to Al-Ghadir Hospital which had no capacity, then transferred to Rasoul Akram Hospital where he died at 2 a.m. on Friday due to lack of medical attention and severe blood loss. From the city of Bukan. Was one of 22 young people shot down at the scene. Body was assigned number 12647 at Kahrizak Forensic Medicine Center among five thousand bodies.

Shot by suppression forces with war bullets during protests in Tehran Pars neighborhood. Transported to Tehran Pars Hospital at Third Circle where he died. Was an only child from a well-off family, a responsible teenager who participated in protests. Was a student who was planning to emigrate to Canada to continue his studies.
Shot with live ammunition by Islamic Republic forces

Shot with direct gunfire by suppressive forces. Had family relationship with Matin Montazerzohour. Both were concerned about freedom and went to the streets, but the response to their protest against the current situation was bullets.
Shot and killed during protests. Member of the same family as Matin MontazerZohour, both from Gorgan

Shot in the head during protest. Initially wounded in the leg and walked to hospital herself. Family was told she was 'not there' when they went to find her. Body was later returned showing she had been executed with a bullet to the head. Islamic Republic demanded 700 million tomans (approximately $5,000-$6,000) to hand over her body.
From Kuhdasht, Lorestan province. Killed by suppressive forces through direct gunshot in Tehran.
Professional handball player and Wushu athlete shot in the stomach by regime's security forces, later died in hospital from her injuries
Shot with two bullets to chest and abdomen during protests for freedom from Islamic regime

Stopped to help a girl who was being beaten by security forces, was attacked with batons and machetes on the spot and taken away half-dead. Since 19 Dey (January 8, 2026), no one has said he is detained, no one has said he is alive, and there is no news of his body.

Kickboxing athlete shot during protests. Initially targeted with pellet shots, then while fleeing despite being wounded, security forces shot him in the side from behind with a pistol. He was taken alive to an ambulance, but friends found his body hours later with signs of bruising on his neck. He had told others he was going to a 'wedding' and had even visited a barbershop before participating in the protests.

39-year-old tailor and mother of an 11-year-old daughter, shot directly by Islamic Republic suppression forces around 7 PM on January 8, 2026, while returning from work during gatherings in Nazi-Abad, Tehran. Her body was retrieved by family from Kahrizak forensic medicine after hours of fear and uncertainty. Her 11-year-old daughter Dorsa was home alone waiting for her mother who never returned. Buried in Asadabad, Hamedan.

Young married woman returning home with her husband in Daneshgah Square when attacked by Basij forces. After witnessing her husband's brutal killing, she was shot with 27 pellets to her head and face and struck multiple times on the back of her head, completely destroying the back of her skull. Regime took the bodies and held memorial services claiming them as their own martyrs, even circulating announcements around Daneshgah Square and conducting their own burial ceremonies. Couple was monarchist, not regime supporters. Left behind a 9th grade child.
Lost her life from direct fire in the Khaksefid area of Tehranpars.
Killed by Islamic Republic forces in Pare Sar city, Gilan province
Language instructor from Shiraz, fatally shot by Islamic Republic forces on Friday evening. Shot in the head from close range of approximately six meters. Died due to severity of injuries.

Language teacher and beloved educational figure. Shot directly with a war bullet at close range (about 6 meters) in the head in the Sadra neighborhood of Shiraz by Khamenei's mercenaries. Her body was buried under severe security measures in a completely controlled environment in Ghalat village, Shiraz. The burial ceremony was held with severe restrictions on public attendance and under security forces' supervision.
Shot by security forces with direct fire to the head on Sadra Street
Killed on 18 Dey. Was a professional athlete and talented hairdresser.
Shot and killed, his body was discovered by his family five days later
15-year-old teenager shot with live ammunition by plainclothes agents during protests. His family was forced to pay $3,500—a so-called 'bullet fee'—to have his body released for burial
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime on 18 Dey 1404
12-year-old child shot in the face and neck with pellet bullets by security forces at a distance of less than one meter
Shot with bullet but was refused admission at two hospitals and died in her mother's arms. She was an only child raised by her mother.
Shot from behind on Niroye Daryaei Resalat street, died thirsty and hungry in her mother's arms at Shahidaye Tajrish hospital. She was her mother's only child.

Kurdish citizen from Kermanshah, shot with live ammunition by Iranian government security forces during popular protests in Moallem neighborhood of Kermanshah. Mother of two children aged 9 and 13, was targeted and killed in front of her children's eyes.

Killed by IRGC during protests in Kermanshah, Kurdistan Region. Family stated there were no visible bullet wounds on his body and he probably died as a result of severe tear-gas inhalation. Also known as Mohammadreza Kianimanesh.
Killed due to inhaling tear gas fired by government forces during protests in Kermanshah. His body was buried 8 days later in Bagh Ferdows cemetery in Kermanshah.

Brother of Hamid Arzanlou. Shot twice in the neck while running to help his wounded brother. Died in hospital days after his brother's death. Regime demanded $30,000 to return body and forced family to sign false cause of death.
Teacher, killed by regime forces on Ashrafi Esfahani street in Tehran
Afghan national killed on 18 Dey 1404 in Tehranpars, Tehran

Shot directly in the eye by suppression forces at Sadeghieh Square. He was a patriot and honorable man who had resigned from the Air Force in 2022 during the Mahsa Amini uprising. He was the father of two daughters aged 4 and 9.
45-year-old from Fardis, Karaj killed during protests

17-year-old student shot by Islamic Republic suppression forces with direct gunfire. Hit by multiple bullets - eight bullets to the side/torso area and one bullet wounded her leg. Died from severe injuries caused by this deadly shooting. Targeted with war weapons during suppression of popular protests.
Shot by sniper with eight live rounds, died in her mother's arms

Chemistry student shot and killed while trying to rescue a wounded girl who had been shot. Killed by forces of the Velayat-e Faqih regime. Family was not allowed to bury him in Arak, so his body was buried in Gazran village

Shot in the head with a war bullet in front of Gohardasht police station. Music teacher and tar/setar instructor, manager of 'Pazhvak Honar' music school. His body was missing for 7 days before being found mistakenly buried in place of another person at Behesht-e Sakineh. Body found with torn clothes and blood, face unrecognizable due to severe injuries, identified only through fingerprints. Father was pressured to not hold a ceremony and falsely claim Yaser was a Basij member, though he was an independent artist and musician.

Dedicated musician and music instructor, master of tar and setar instruments, director of 'Pezhvak Honar' music academy. Shot directly in the head with a military-grade bullet. Body remained missing for seven days until authorities contacted family for identification.
17-year-old youth shot with two bullets by government forces during protests. Family held his burial ceremony in Rey city like a wedding celebration.

Shot with bullets by Islamic Republic suppressors during protests in Dareh Daraz (Dejir) neighborhood of Kermanshah. He was a student studying in Italy who had returned home for New Year winter holidays. He was from the Kurdish Yarsan community.
Graduate student in geophysics studying in Italy who had returned to Kermanshah for holidays just days before being killed. Shot by security forces.
Shot by suppression forces in Karaj. Lur ethnicity.
Kurdish citizen from Harsin, Kermanshah province, shot with live ammunition by government suppressive forces during popular protests in Shahriyar, Tehran province
Killed during protests in Mashhad. Mother is requesting people to call out his name.
Shot with eight war bullets by a sniper from suppressive forces, died in her mother's arms

Shot from behind with war bullets while moving away from the scene during protests in Fouladshahr. Security forces engaged in widespread and direct shooting. An unknown person who knew Younes transported his wounded body by car to near his family's home. The family, thinking he was alive, took him to Fouladshahr Hospital where blood was seen from his mouth and nose. The hospital doors were closed and families were denied information. Many other bodies were also brought to the hospital by families. After about 10 hours, no clear information was given to the family, and the next day bodies were transferred from the hospital by security agencies. The family went through a long, ambiguous process with pressure and threats to receive the body. After about 10 days, the family was told the body could only be buried with limited attendance and no public ceremony. Younes had been working since adolescence in jobs like construction and welding, and just one week before his death had started a new job as a CNC cutting machine operator at a company.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial from Park Square area in Mashhad
Described as a lively and cheerful northern boy who was killed. The tweet mentions the author was reminded of Hamidreza Rouhi when seeing Yusuf.

Kurdish Kurmanji man, originally from Quchan in Razavi Khorasan province, resident of Chalous. Shot directly in the heart with live ammunition by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests. His family found his body in the street around 9 PM after he had lost a lot of blood. He died in his brother's arms at the hospital.
Shot with a war bullet by IRGC forces in Bagh Feyz neighborhood, Eslamshahr. His body was not returned to his family

Shot with war bullet to the back and died from suffocation caused by chemical gas by government mercenaries on Shariati Street in Najafabad. After his death, they also denied him peace and did not allow his body to be buried in Haji cemetery
Died in Karaj during the protests
Mother of two daughters from Baghbehadran, killed by direct shooting of government suppressive forces during people's protests

Retired Social Security Organization employee from Sonqor, residing in Karaj. Killed along with her husband and child when their private car was shot at by government agents during peaceful protests. The family was inside their personal vehicle when it was riddled with bullets.
Killed during protests in Dey 1404. She was seeking justice and was killed on the path to freedom. Cousin of Ali Mozaffari who was killed in Shahrivar 1401.

Kurdish citizen, 28 years old, dentist from Quchan living in Mashhad, killed during popular protests in Haft-Tir Square with direct shooting by government forces, war bullet hit to the head area. She was the cousin of Ali Mozaffari, who was killed in the 'Jin, Jiyan, Azadi' movement in Quchan.

Student with rank 146 nationwide in 2024 Master's entrance exam, Bachelor's graduate in Electrical Engineering from Isfahan University of Technology, pursuing Master's at Amirkabir University. Shot directly by regime's repressive forces during protests.
Shot in the back of the head. Initially authorities prevented the family from receiving her body, but it was eventually buried in Imamzadeh Heydar in Kalak County.
Kurdish citizen killed during popular protests in the provinces of Ilam, Tehran, Alborz, Markazi, Kermanshah and Isfahan

Student of Italian language studies at the University of Tehran, shot directly by Islamic Republic security forces on Ariamehr (Fatemi) Street during the nationwide uprising. Struck by live ammunition during violent crackdown on protests.
28-year-old Gilaki citizen from Rasht, Gilan province. Shot with direct fire by government forces during popular protests in the city, died from impact of military bullet.
Shot directly by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government in Shaft, Gilan. Described as a Gilaki citizen from Shaft.
Shot in the head by a regime sniper during protests. She was 38 years old and worked as a taekwondo, TRX and bodybuilding coach.
Taekwondo coach, TRX and fitness instructor. Shot dead with a sniper round to the head by regime's police forces.

Shot and hospitalized for 8 days at Taleghani Hospital before dying. Described as a soldier who supported the Pahlavi monarchy. While hospitalized, he told others to continue protests in the streets and joked about having a street named after him.
Employee of Khuzestan Steel Industries, killed by Islamic Republic's suppressive forces
Shot by direct fire from suppression forces. He was from Lordegan in Bakhtiari Province.
Killed by Islamic Republic mercenaries and hired agents of Velayat-e Faqih in Khomein city, Markazi Province-Arak
Executed by Iran's Judiciary, accused of spying for Israel's Mossad. First espionage-related execution in 2026.

Lor citizen from Lordegan, Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari province, shot directly by suppressive forces during popular protests. His funeral was held on January 19, 2026 with widespread citizen participation and anti-regime slogans. Exact date of death uncertain - occurred either January 8 or 9, 2026
Murdered by the Islamic Republic regime for demanding freedom
30-year-old from Lordegan in Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari province
Victim from Lordegan, Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari province
Police chief of Iranshahr who was assassinated by militants of the Baloch nationalist militant organisation People's Fighters Front (PFF).

Gilaki citizen from Fouman, sister of Mehran Basir Tavana who was killed in 2022-2023 Gilan protests. Arrested by security forces on Wednesday 17 Dey 1404 in Rasht city and transferred to an unknown location. According to eyewitnesses, this citizen was arrested by several plainclothes officers using motorcycles, and agents quickly removed her from the crowd. According to an informed source, she was visiting a doctor at the time of arrest and since her arrest, no information is available about her detention location, physical condition, or the detaining authority.
Shot with war bullets during protests in Lordegan on 17 Dey when security forces opened fire on people, killing 12 individuals
Father of a 20-day-old child, killed in Lordegan during protests

Shot directly with military ammunition by regime forces on Sohrourdi Street in Alvand while working at Ali Meshti juice and ice cream shop. Body was eventually returned to family after payment of 300 million tomans for bullet cost and 1 billion tomans for body delivery, under severe security pressure. Buried on January 10 with government agents present at funeral.
Shot by bullets from the Islamic regime during protests. Described as dreaming of a free Iran.
Arrested on 17 Dey by the Islamic Republic, body was returned to family a few days later. Executed by the Islamic Republic.

Killed by special units of the Islamic Republic using live ammunition during protests in Marlik Town, Tehran. As of the report, no information was available regarding the release of his body for funeral arrangements.
Shot in the face with pellet ammunition by security forces while sitting in his car, died after being transferred to the hospital
Shot in the face with shotgun pellets by security forces while sitting behind the wheel of his personal car. Died after being transferred to hospital.
15 years old, killed by the Islamic Republic regime
Arrested by IRGC intelligence forces during a raid on her home on Wednesday evening, 17 Dey 1404. Killed under torture several days later. Mother of two children and sole breadwinner of her family
28-year-old owner of Shila fast food in Tehranpars, killed by the Islamic Republic. He was his family's only son, full of dreams.

Arrested by Islamic Republic security forces during protest gathering at Paramount intersection (Panzdah-e Khordad) in Shiraz. Detained at Soroush Criminal Investigation detention center (Plaque 201). Authorities are pressuring family and threatening maximum penalties to prevent media coverage of his case and prevent pursuit of his release process. His condition remains uncertain with no official information about reasons for arrest or detention location.

Boxer who was severely wounded by IRGC gunfire on Saturday 13 Dey 1404 during popular protests in Malekshahi city. He was transferred to the intensive care unit of Khomeini Hospital in Ilam and died after 4 days of hospitalization.

Kurdish citizen, son of Abbas, from Saghez living in Bijar, married with two children (one only 3 months old). Arrested on the street during popular protests in Bijar on Thursday evening January 8, 2026. Severely tortured with batons and repeated beatings during arrest. Died Friday January 9, 2026 in a hospital in Sanandaj as a result of severe injuries sustained. Security forces did not allow family visits during hospitalization. After death, his body was secretly buried without family knowledge in an unmarked location in Saghez. Family under severe pressure not to speak or report to media.
Gilaki citizen from Someh Sara and resident of Rasht, killed by gunfire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during nationwide protests in Dey month 1404 in Rasht city

Kurdish citizen shot in the head during popular protests in Malekshahi on Saturday 13 Dey 1404 (January 2, 2026). After being transferred to ICU at Khomeini Hospital in Ilam with low consciousness level, he died after three days due to severity of injuries. His brother Mostafa Aghamohammadi was also wounded in the same protests and remains in critical condition.
Died during protests in Tehran
Shot in the abdomen with war bullets during protests. Gilak citizen and barber who had been supporting his mother and sister since childhood after losing his father
Baloch citizen from Zahedan arrested by military forces while working during nationwide protests on 16 Dey 1404 (January 5, 2026). Still in detention after 26 days.
Initially injured during IRGC shooting of protesters on January 3, transferred to Imam Khomeini Hospital in Ilam, died several hours later from his injuries

Shot in the head with live ammunition by regime forces during protests. The family was forced to hold a secret burial at 4 a.m. on January 8. He had been married only one year and became father to Dazhyar just three days before he was murdered.
Killed on 13 Dey in Neyriz, was a close friend of Ebrahim Hashembeygi. His body was buried alongside Hashembeygi's body in complete silence surrounded by security forces at 2 AM on 22 Dey.

Initially injured when IRGC agents opened fire from inside Basij base on peaceful protesters marching from Shohada Square, later died from injuries. Agents shot without regard for who they hit. Protesters were completely unarmed.

Shot with war bullet on Thursday in Marvdasht, taken home due to family's fear of taking him to hospital, died Friday morning. Family kept the body at home for two days, tried to bury him secretly on the second night but were prevented by security forces. Authorities refused to issue burial permit and family is under severe pressure.

Retired brigadier general of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps and Kurdish citizen who was participating in protests when he was shot and killed by live ammunition fired by IRGC forces. He was specifically targeted by the shooters according to reports. He was transferred to Imam Khomeini Hospital in Ilam where he later succumbed to his injuries. His son confirmed on social media that his father was killed directly by government forces.

Killed instantly when IRGC agents opened fire from inside Basij base on peaceful protesters marching from Shohada Square. Agents shot without regard for who they hit. Protesters were completely unarmed.
Also known as Bozoneh, initially reported killed on January 3 during IRGC shooting of protesters
Wounded with metal pellet, died when taken to livestock farm instead of hospital after being wounded. Presence of security forces at hospitals deterred proper medical care.

Shot by IRGC forces on Artesh Street in Jafarabad, Kermanshah. Transferred to Taleghani Hospital where he died shortly afterward. After his death, security agencies, the governor's office, and Kermanshah provincial authorities pressured the family to publicly announce that Rasoul was a government Basij member and to attribute his death to thugs and rioters.

Killed instantly when IRGC agents opened fire from inside Basij base on peaceful protesters marching from Shohada Square. Agents shot without regard for who they hit. Protesters were completely unarmed.

16-year-old Kurdish child and worker, shot in the back and side with war bullets by Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps forces during popular protests in Jafarabad neighborhood of Kermanshah. His family received his body on 15 Dey and buried him the same day in Jabarabad Sofla village in Bilovar. After his killing, security agencies pressured his family to introduce him as a Basij member and blame protesters for his death, but the family refused this request.
Fatally shot by plainclothes agents who arrived in three white vehicles and fired metal pellets at protesters trying to block a road in Jafarabad area.

Shot on the evening of January 3, 2026 on Artesh Street in Jafarabad, Kermanshah and sustained severe injuries that caused him to fall into a coma. Was admitted to the intensive care unit at Taleghani Hospital where he remained until he died on January 4, 2026. Following his death, the family was reportedly pressured by authorities and told to pay 800 million tomans to receive the brothers' bodies. As of January 5, 2026, the bodies had not been returned.
Shot by security forces during protests in Noorabad (Delfan), Lorestan Province

Shot by security forces during protests in recent days. Killed alongside Amirhossam Khodayarifard and Ahad Ebrahimpour Abdoli in the cities of Kuhdasht and Nourabad in Lorestan province and Harsin in Kermanshah province.

42-year-old Kurd with a wife and two children, shot by government security forces. Initially reported by IRGC as a Basij member killed by protesters, but later report by Hengaw stated he was shot by government security forces

Shot by Islamic regime forces while shielding his sister during protests. His body was stolen and returned to family after several days with threats and coercion using repetitive scenarios. Family, especially his sister, remains under heavy pressure from security forces.

Coffee shop owner in Hamadan, active on Instagram with username 'AmirCaffeine'. Shot and killed during protests in Hamadan. Had married approximately two years prior to his death. His body has not been returned to his family and the status of body delivery remains unclear.

Student of geotechnical engineering at Amirkabir University. Arrested in the Narmak area of Tehran on the 12th of Dey (some sources incorrectly say the 19th). Faces many charges. In phone calls, only said he was fine and nothing more is known about him.
Shot in the head by Islamic Republic forces on the evening of Thursday 11 Dey during national uprising, fell into coma, died in hospital on the evening of 12 Dey
Doctor who was abducted from her home in Shiraz by security forces on Friday 12 Dey (January 1, 2026). No news of her whereabouts for five days as of the tweet date.
Killed by security forces of the Islamic Republic regime
Lor man shot directly from the front by Iranian state forces outside Police Station No. 11 during protests following the killing of Khodadad Shirvani. Kalashnikov round struck his abdomen
Killed by security forces of the Islamic Republic regime

Shot by security forces during protests in recent days. Killed alongside Amirhossam Khodayarifard and Ali Azizi in the cities of Kuhdasht and Nourabad in Lorestan province and Harsin in Kermanshah province.

Unmarried man from the village of Hasan Gaviyar Mirbeg. Shot three times by Iranian state forces in Bahesht Square. Witnesses said he was targeted while trying to help a woman being detained, with one bullet striking his heart
Killed by security forces during protests. Body showed classic spray patterns of metal pellet wounds on torso.

Shot by security forces during peaceful protest near the county governor's office in Azadegan Square. One of at least six protesters killed in Azna when IRGC agents opened fire on peaceful protesters.
Shot with live ammunition by government security forces during popular protests
Died during protests in Rasht in Dey 1404
Shot directly in the head. He had returned from military service one month prior. His lifeless body was found at Sadra Hospital and buried at Darel Rahme cemetery.
Shot from behind in the back, bullet hit his heart in Parand, Tehran. Family does not have proper access and asked for information to be shared
17-year-old mathematics student at Dana Smart School in Bandar Abbas. Shot and killed by Islamic Republic regime while returning home from dormitory in his car.
Died in Dey 1404 in Shahrak-e Gharb, Tehran during the protests

Shot by security forces during peaceful protest near the county governor's office in Azadegan Square. One of at least six protesters killed in Azna when IRGC agents opened fire on peaceful protesters.

Shot by security forces during peaceful protest near the county governor's office in Azadegan Square. One of at least six protesters killed in Azna when IRGC agents opened fire on peaceful protesters.

Died during protests in Shahrak Andisheh in Dey 1404
Shot and killed by Islamic Republic forces in Malard. Her mother asks for her name to be remembered.

Initially reported missing, killed during peaceful protest. On January 3, when family inquired at police station, officials showed them pictures and family identified Safari among deceased with visible severe head injuries. Authorities continue to withhold his body.
Killed by security forces of the Islamic Republic regime in Azna

Reported to have been killed outside the governor's office protest in Fasa. However, The Jerusalem Post stated on 31 December that Samavati was alive according to several sources, and that the rumour of Samavati's death was disinformation by the authorities aiming at frightening the protesters.
15-year-old teenager killed by security forces in Azna that evening, alongside Shayan Asadollahi and Vahab Musavi/Ghaedi.

Barber of Lur ethnicity, shot in the abdomen with live ammunition by direct gunfire from security forces (including IRGC pickup trucks) while returning from a protest. He was one of three protesters killed in Azna that evening, alongside a 15-year-old teenager (Mostafa) and Vahab Musavi/Ghaedi.

Shot by security forces during peaceful protest near the county governor's office in Azadegan Square. One of at least six protesters killed in Azna when IRGC agents opened fire on peaceful protesters.

Born in 2004, shot in the head by a plainclothes security agent while participating in peaceful protest. The group of protesters had spent hours peacefully demonstrating and chanting against the government. The crowd moved towards Imam Square, where a statue of Ruhollah Khomeini is located. Stones were thrown at the statue. Basij, police officers and plainclothes security officers started firing their weapons. According to IranWire, locals alleged that Ebrahim Aharoun, a retired IRGC member in plainclothes during the protest, was the person who shot Khodayarifard. After the shooting, Khodayarifard was transferred to medical facilities in Khorramabad, where he died several hours later. Government officials falsely claimed he was a Basij member and pressured his family to state this, but the family refused.
Killed by security forces of the Islamic Republic regime in Fouladshahr
Lor man killed by live ammunition during protests. Shot with a Kalashnikov and died before being transferred to medical facilities
Lor man, father of two. Shot at close range with a pellet gun during protests and died after being transferred to medical facilities

12-year-old child shot and killed by agents of the Islamic Republic while riding on a motorcycle with his father. After the child was shot and fell, his father stopped to see what happened and was also shot and killed.

Taxi driver and father of three children (ages 4, 11, and 15). Originally from Kangavar, lived in Vahidieh Shahriar for years. Was alone in Vahidieh area on Joughin Street when he was caught by Basij forces and plainclothes agents. 30-year-old Baha'i citizen, tennis coach and resident of Kerman, arrested by government forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran at his family home on Tuesday 29 Dey 1404. No information about his fate has been available since then.

Arrested by Intelligence Office agents at workplace in Mashhad. Has been detained for over two weeks without clear charges specified, held at Vokil Abad prison. Appears to be targeted as a Bahai Iranian based on context.

Charged with 'moharebeh' (enmity against God) for alleged connections with Israel and America. Family informed orally by IRGC Sari that he has been sentenced to death and execution will be carried out in Tehran. Likely transferred to security detention centers in Tehran. Denied access to lawyer and other basic prisoner rights.

Pregnant 30-year-old woman from Gonabad, killed by direct gunshot with live ammunition to the neck area on Moalem Boulevard in Mashhad. She and her husband were chanting slogans when security forces pursued them. After entering one of the alleys around Moalem Boulevard, they were identified and stopped. Security forces shot her directly in the neck with live ammunition while she was pregnant. Her husband was also injured by shotgun pellets to the leg. They were transferred to Chamran Clinic in Mashhad, affiliated with the Revolutionary Guards, where she died due to inadequate medical care at the military-affiliated medical center.

Mother of two children arrested by regime suppression forces. Family has received no clear information about her place of detention, legal status, or physical condition. The arrest was carried out as part of a policy of intimidation, pressure on families, and suppression of women during the national uprising.

34-year-old woman arrested without any reason or explanation. Security forces entered the gym and took her from inside. They showed no warrant, gave no explanation, just took her. They also took the gym's cameras and erased the memory to leave no trace behind. No agency is accountable for this apparent kidnapping.
